original: kha cig tu ni gsung gis so //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni gsung gis so //
translated: In some places, by his speech.

original: kha cig tu ni thugs kyis so //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni thugs kyis so //
translated: In some places, by his mind.

original: kha cig tu ni gsum kas kyang ngo //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni gsum kas kyang ngo //
translated: In some places, by all three.

original: ci'i don du 'od zer dang bcas pa'i cho 'phrul dang gsol ba 'debs pa ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i don du 'od zer dang bcas pa'i cho 'phrul dang gsol ba 'debs pa ston par byed ce na /
translated: For what purpose does he display the miracle of light rays and the request?

original: las kyi khyad par gyi don du ste /
analyzed: las kyi khyad par gyi don du ste /
translated: For the purpose of a special activity.

original: 'od zer de ni las brgyad dang lus @261b gnyis can no //
analyzed: 'od zer de ni las brgyad dang lus @261b gnyis can no //
translated: That light ray has eight activities and two bodies.

original: de la yang dag par sad par byed pa'i las can ni /
analyzed: de la yang dag par sad par byed pa'i las can ni /
translated: Among them, the activity of perfect awakening is

original: gang des reg pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pas skyes pa'i stobs snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang des reg pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pas skyes pa'i stobs snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: that by which the bodhisattvas touched by that light are illuminated with the power of their own tathāgata blessings.

original: sdud pa dang 'gyed pa'i las ni grangs med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su bkye nas 'od 'dom gang tsam du bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sdud pa dang 'gyed pa'i las ni grangs med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su bkye nas 'od 'dom gang tsam du bsdus pa'o //
translated: The activity of gathering and emanating is to emanate into countless world systems and gather them into a fathom of light.

original: rgyu nyid kyi las ni grangs med pa'i 'od zer gyi 'khor gyi rgyu nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyi las ni grangs med pa'i 'od zer gyi 'khor gyi rgyu nyid kyis so //
translated: The activity of cause is to be the cause of the retinue of countless light rays.

original: ston par byed pa'i las ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang der gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kun du ston pa'o //
analyzed: ston par byed pa'i las ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang der gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kun du ston pa'o //
translated: The function of revealing is that it reveals the circle of the Tathagata's retinue and the bodhisattvas who reside there in all the worldrealms.

original: rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i las ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i las ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The function of pacifying is that it pacifies all the sufferings of the unfortunate realms.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i las can ni bdud thams cad kyi mthu dman par byed pa ste skrag cing brtabs pas gdul bya rnams la bgegs byed pa la mi 'jug pa'o ;
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i las can ni bdud thams cad kyi mthu dman par byed pa ste skrag cing brtabs pas gdul bya rnams la bgegs byed pa la mi 'jug pa'o ;
translated: The function of overpowering is that it diminishes the power of all maras, because they are frightened and terrified and do not engage in obstructing those to be trained.

original: /'dun par byed pa'i las ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi phrin las dang mthu gsal bar byed pa las so //
analyzed: /'dun par byed pa'i las ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi phrin las dang mthu gsal bar byed pa las so //
translated: The function of inspiring is that it inspires through the manifestation of inconceivable buddhadeeds and powers.

original: gsol ba 'debs pa'i las ni tshigs su bcad pa'i sgra 'byin pa las so //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa'i las ni tshigs su bcad pa'i sgra 'byin pa las so //
translated: The function of supplicating is that it supplicates through the sound of verses.

original: lus gnyis ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: lus gnyis ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is there a twofold body?

original: skar mda' lta bu'i lus ni gang gi tshe khams gzhan du 'gyed pa'o //
analyzed: skar mda' lta bu'i lus ni gang gi tshe khams gzhan du 'gyed pa'o //
translated: The body like a shooting star is when one is dispersed to another realm.

original: nyi ma lta bu'i lus ni gang gi tshe sprin gyi dra ba mthug po'i khang pa brtsegs pa byas nas thams cad gnas te gcig gi mthus so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: nyi ma lta bu'i lus ni gang gi tshe sprin gyi dra ba mthug po'i khang pa brtsegs pa byas nas thams cad gnas te gcig gi mthus so sor snang ngo //
translated: The body of the Buddha is like the sun, for it is the same in all the universes, and it is seen everywhere according to its power.

original: de ltar 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de rnams su gcig tu gyur pa bzhin du phan tshun mthong bas bstan pa yang sla bar 'gyur la nyan pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de rnams su gcig tu gyur pa bzhin du phan tshun mthong bas bstan pa yang sla bar 'gyur la nyan pa yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the circle of the assembly, being one, sees the Buddha face to face; it is easy for it to be instructed and to understand.

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das pa'i lung ston par bzhed par gyur pa de'i tshe 'od zer rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyab tu nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das pa'i lung ston par bzhed par gyur pa de'i tshe 'od zer rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyab tu nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, when the Blessed One wishes to make a prediction, the rays disappear behind him.

original: 'on te ma 'ongs pa ma yin na mdun du'o //🔽dmyal bar skye ba ni zhabs kyi mthil du'o //🔽byol song du skye ba ni zhabs kyi rting par ro //
analyzed: 'on te ma 'ongs pa ma yin na mdun du'o // dmyal bar skye ba ni zhabs kyi mthil du'o // byol song du skye ba ni zhabs kyi rting par ro //
translated: If the person is not in the future, the rays disappear in front of him.🔽If he is to be reborn in hell, the rays disappear under his feet.

original: yi dags su skye ba ni zhabs kyi mthe bong la'o //
analyzed: yi dags su skye ba ni zhabs kyi mthe bong la'o //
translated: If he is to be reborn as an animal, they disappear in his heels.🔽If he is to be reborn as a hungry ghost, they disappear in his toes.

original: mir skye ba ni pus mo dag la'o //
analyzed: mir skye ba ni pus mo dag la'o //
translated: If he is to be reborn as a human, they disappear in his knees.

original: stobs kyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni phyag g-yon pa'i mthil du'o //
analyzed: stobs kyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni phyag g-yon pa'i mthil du'o //
translated: The cakravartin king of power has it in the palm of his left hand.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni phyag g-yas pa'i mthil du'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni phyag g-yas pa'i mthil du'o //
translated: The cakravartin king has it in the palm of his right hand.

original: lhar skye ba ni lte bar ro//
analyzed: lhar skye ba ni lte bar ro//
translated: Birth as a god is at the navel.

original: @262a * // nyan thos kyi byang chub ni zhal du'o //
analyzed: @262a * // nyan thos kyi byang chub ni zhal du'o //
translated: The enlightenment of the śrāvaka is at the mouth.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni smin mtshams su'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni smin mtshams su'o //
translated: The enlightenment of the pratyekabuddha is between the eyebrows.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni gtsug tor du'o zhes so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni gtsug tor du'o zhes so //
translated: Unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is at the uṣṇīṣa.

original: ci'i don du spyod lam bzhi dang / ston pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / nang du yang dag par 'jog pas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i don du spyod lam bzhi dang / ston pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / nang du yang dag par 'jog pas gnas pa ste /
translated: For what purpose does he abide by the four postures, teaching, meditative equipoise, and internal placement?

original: sku dang gsung dang / thugs kyi spyod pa dang / bya ba dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid bzhi rnams kyis gnas she na /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang / thugs kyi spyod pa dang / bya ba dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid bzhi rnams kyis gnas she na /
translated: By the four characteristics of the body, speech, and mind of the one free from action, he abides.

original: gnas pa thams cad kyis 'phags pa thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phan 'dogs pa chen po rab tu 'jug pa las so //
analyzed: gnas pa thams cad kyis 'phags pa thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phan 'dogs pa chen po rab tu 'jug pa las so //
translated: From the engagement in the great, uncommon benefit of all the noble ones by all abidings.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i bsam pa'i dbang las bcom ldan 'das kyi nang du yang dag par 'jog pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo las ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i bsam pa'i dbang las bcom ldan 'das kyi nang du yang dag par 'jog pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo las ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the Bhagavat enters into the inner samādhi through the power of the world's thoughts, not through his own nature.

original: ci'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas te /
translated: Why is it said three times?

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhe na /
translated: Why is the wheel of the Dharma turned twelve times?

original: 'di tsam gyis 'gro ba'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis 'gro ba'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this much is sufficient to accomplish the welfare of beings.

original: de la chos ni bstan pa'o //🔽de nyid 'khor lo ste gdul bya'i rgyud rnams la 'khor bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes chos kyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: de la chos ni bstan pa'o // de nyid 'khor lo ste gdul bya'i rgyud rnams la 'khor bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes chos kyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: Here, the Dharma is the teaching.🔽It is a wheel because it is turned in the mental series of those to be trained.

original: bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is the four truths.

original: de gsum du bzlas pa ni /🔽'di ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de gsum du bzlas pa ni / 'di ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The three repetitions are:🔽This is suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo zhes bden pa bzhi'i rang bzhin yongs su gcad pa ni lam dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mo zhes bden pa bzhi'i rang bzhin yongs su gcad pa ni lam dang po'o //
translated: The first path is the determination of the nature of the four truths.

original: de kho na rim pa ji lta bar yongs su shes par bya ba dang / rab tu spang bar bya ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba 'di tsam nyid du yongs su gcad pa ni lan gnyis pa'o//
analyzed: de kho na rim pa ji lta bar yongs su shes par bya ba dang / rab tu spang bar bya ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba 'di tsam nyid du yongs su gcad pa ni lan gnyis pa'o//
translated: The second is the determination that the suchness of the four noble truths is just this: to be thoroughly known, to be abandoned, to be manifested, and to be cultivated.

original: de kho na'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su shes pa spangs pa dang mngon du byas pa dang bsgoms zin pa nyid du yongs su gcad pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su shes pa spangs pa dang mngon du byas pa dang bsgoms zin pa nyid du yongs su gcad pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the determination that the suchness of the four noble truths is just this: to be thoroughly known, to be abandoned, to be manifested, and to be cultivated by one’s own self.

original: de'i phyir de ni lan gsum du bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni lan gsum du bskor ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the wheel of Dharma has three turnings.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin dang / yongs su shes par bya ba nyid dang yongs su shes pa nyid ces pa rnam pa gsum dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa'i de'i rang bzhin dang spong bar bya ba nyid dang spangs pa nyid ces pa gsum dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin dang / yongs su shes par bya ba nyid dang yongs su shes pa nyid ces pa rnam pa gsum dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa'i de'i rang bzhin dang spong bar bya ba nyid dang spangs pa nyid ces pa gsum dang /
translated: The truth of suffering has three aspects: the nature of suffering, to be thoroughly known, and to be thoroughly known by one’s own self. The truth of origin has three aspects: the nature of origin, to be abandoned, and to be abandoned by one’s own self.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i de'i rang bzhin dang mngon du bya ba nyid dang mngon du byas pa nyid ces pa gsum dang / lam gyi bden pa'i @262b de'i rang bzhin dang bsgom par bya ba dang bsgom pa nyid ces pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i de'i rang bzhin dang mngon du bya ba nyid dang mngon du byas pa nyid ces pa gsum dang / lam gyi bden pa'i @262b de'i rang bzhin dang bsgom par bya ba dang bsgom pa nyid ces pa gsum ste /
translated: The three of the truth of the path are its nature, that which is to be cultivated, and that which is cultivated.

original: de'i phyir de ni rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
translated: Therefore, it has twelve aspects.

original: yang na 'di ni sdug bsngal ba'o //🔽yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni sdug bsngal ba'o // yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: Or, it is the three repetitions of “This is suffering,”🔽“It is to be fully understood,”

original: yongs su shes so zhes pa lan gsum du bskor ba'o //🔽so so la sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang yang dag pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir rig pa dang mi slob pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi blo 'byung ba'i phyir zhes pa rnam pa bcu gnyis rnams so
analyzed: yongs su shes so zhes pa lan gsum du bskor ba'o // so so la sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang yang dag pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir rig pa dang mi slob pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi blo 'byung ba'i phyir zhes pa rnam pa bcu gnyis rnams so
translated: and “It is fully understood.”

original: // de ltar bden pa so so la ste gsum dang bcu gnyis su chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: // de ltar bden pa so so la ste gsum dang bcu gnyis su chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since each of the four noble truths is turned three times, there are twelve aspects.🔽Since the four noble truths are similar in terms of the three repetitions,

original: lam gsum dang rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
analyzed: lam gsum dang rnam pa bcu gnyis su chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
translated: He turned the wheel of the Dharma three times with twelve aspects.

original: chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi bstan pa las so //
analyzed: chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi bstan pa las so //
translated: He taught the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi spyod pa re re'i gnyen po gzhung ji snyed kyis yongs su rdzogs pa de snyed kyi gzhung gi phung po ni chos kyi phung po'o zhes pa chos kyi phung po stong phrag rnams
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rnams kyi spyod pa re re'i gnyen po gzhung ji snyed kyis yongs su rdzogs pa de snyed kyi gzhung gi phung po ni chos kyi phung po'o zhes pa chos kyi phung po stong phrag rnams
translated: The eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma are the complete number of scriptures that are the antidotes to the individual conduct of the eighty-four thousand kinds of beings who engage in desire and so on.

original: so // ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gshegs she na /
analyzed: so // ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gshegs she na /
translated: Why did he go to nirvana?

original: le lo can rnams myur ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: le lo can rnams myur ba'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of those who are lazy.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'a kya thub pa'i dam pa'i chos yun ji srid du gnas par 'gyur zhe na /🔽lnga brgya pa tha ma ji srid par ro //🔽brgya phrag lnga rnams 'dus pa ni lnga brgya pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'a kya thub pa'i dam pa'i chos yun ji srid du gnas par 'gyur zhe na / lnga brgya pa tha ma ji srid par ro // brgya phrag lnga rnams 'dus pa ni lnga brgya pa'o //
translated: For how long does the holy Dharma of the Bhagavat Sakyamuni remain?🔽It remains for as long as the last five hundred years.🔽Five hundred years is five hundred years.

original: tha ma ni lnga brgya pa lnga pa ste /
analyzed: tha ma ni lnga brgya pa lnga pa ste /
translated: The last is the fifth five hundred years.

original: lnga brgya pa lngar dam pa'i chos gnas par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i gsung las te dam pa'i chos sgrub pa nyams pa'o zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: lnga brgya pa lngar dam pa'i chos gnas par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i gsung las te dam pa'i chos sgrub pa nyams pa'o zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that this refers to the decline of the practice of the true Dharma.

original: gzhan rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i dus ni lo stong phrag lnga rnams te /
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i dus ni lo stong phrag lnga rnams te /
translated: Others say that the period of the true Dharma of the Tathagata lasts for five thousand years.

original: de rnams brgya phrag lnga lnga rnams kyis phyed mar byas pa ni lnga brgya pa bcu rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams brgya phrag lnga lnga rnams kyis phyed mar byas pa ni lnga brgya pa bcu rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Those five thousand years are divided into ten periods of five hundred years each.

original: dus bcu rnams te /
analyzed: dus bcu rnams te /
translated: There are ten periods.

original: sngon la re zhig rtogs pa'i dus dang sgrub pa'i dus dang lung gi dus zhes pa gsum mo //
analyzed: sngon la re zhig rtogs pa'i dus dang sgrub pa'i dus dang lung gi dus zhes pa gsum mo //
translated: First, there are three periods: the period of realization, the period of practice, and the period of scriptures.

original: slar yang so sor rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: slar yang so sor rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Again, each of those is divided into three:

original: dgra bcom pa dang phyir mi 'ong ba dang rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lhag mthong dang ting nge 'dzin dang tshul khrims dang chos mngon pa dang / mdo sde dang 'dul ba'i sde snod kyi dus te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang phyir mi 'ong ba dang rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lhag mthong dang ting nge 'dzin dang tshul khrims dang chos mngon pa dang / mdo sde dang 'dul ba'i sde snod kyi dus te /
translated: the period of arhats, nonreturners, and stream-enterers; the period of insight, concentration, and ethics; and the period of the Abhidharma, sūtras, and Vinaya piṭaka.

original: dgu po rnam grangs ji lta bar lnga brgya pa dgu rnams la'o //
analyzed: dgu po rnam grangs ji lta bar lnga brgya pa dgu rnams la'o //
translated: The nine periods of five hundred years are for the nine categories of disciples.

original: bcu pa'i dus ni rtags tsam ste /
analyzed: bcu pa'i dus ni rtags tsam ste /
translated: The tenth period is the mere sign of the teaching.

original: 'di nyid lnga brgya pa tha @263a * //🔽ma'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid lnga brgya pa tha @263a * // ma'o zhes smra'o //
translated: This is the last of the five hundred year periods.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration.

original: ye shes lnga po rnams kyang sngar ni mdor bsdus pas rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: ye shes lnga po rnams kyang sngar ni mdor bsdus pas rnam par gzhag la /
translated: The five kinds of transcendent knowledge were previously presented in brief.

original: 'dir ni rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni rgyas par bya'o //
translated: Now they will be presented in detail.

original: de la dang po ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang bdag nyid gcig pa'i ye shes so //🔽de yang chos kyi rnam grangs mtha' dag thos pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa las /
analyzed: de la dang po ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang bdag nyid gcig pa'i ye shes so // de yang chos kyi rnam grangs mtha' dag thos pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa las /
translated: The first is the transcendent knowledge that is of the same nature as the extremely pure realm of the Dharma.

original: sa ma lus pa sgom pa'i rgyu can rtag tu sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa'i ched du nye bar gnas pa ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo dang tshad med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rjes su song ba dang /
analyzed: sa ma lus pa sgom pa'i rgyu can rtag tu sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa'i ched du nye bar gnas pa ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo dang tshad med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rjes su song ba dang /
translated: Moreover, it is the cause of the cultivation of all the stages, and it is the cause of the generation of the constant benefit and happiness of all sentient beings. It is the transcendent knowledge that is the door of concentration and retention, and that is accompanied by immeasurable merit and knowledge.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad las grol ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad las grol ba ni /
translated: It is liberated from all afflictive and knowledge obscurations.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin dang / 'phags pa'i chos thams cad bskyed pa'i rgyu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin dang / 'phags pa'i chos thams cad bskyed pa'i rgyu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the extremely pure expanse of reality, the suchness of all phenomena, the unmistaken nature, the cause that produces all the qualities of the noble beings and the nature of all the tathagatas.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: If the tathagatas are the nature of the expanse of reality,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang de bzhin nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang de bzhin nyid yin zhing /
translated: if the expanse of reality is suchness

original: de yang chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: and that is the universal characteristic of all phenomena,

original: chos kyang rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams te so so rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyang rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams te so so rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: then phenomena are the various individual characteristics that are different from each other.

original: de'i rjes su son pa'i chos kyi dbyings ci ltar tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su son pa'i chos kyi dbyings ci ltar tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: How can the expanse of reality that conforms to them not be different?

original: tha dad pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of those different phenomena.

original: tha dad par gyur na yang ji ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad par gyur na yang ji ltar spyi'i mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If they are different, how can it be a universal characteristic?

original: dper na nam mkha' dngos po med pa bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa tha dad pa thams cad kyi rjes su son kyang tha dad pa ma yin par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' dngos po med pa bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa tha dad pa thams cad kyi rjes su son kyang tha dad pa ma yin par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: For example, just as space, which is a non-entity, is realized as not different, even though it pervades all the different things such as pots, cloth, etc.,

original: bum pa'i nam mkha' dang snam bu'i nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa ni tha snyad tsam mo //
analyzed: bum pa'i nam mkha' dang snam bu'i nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa ni tha snyad tsam mo //
translated: the expressions “space of the pot” and “space of the cloth,” etc., are mere conventional expressions.

original: de bzhin du chos nyid de'i bdag nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa thams cad kyi rjes su son yang tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos nyid de'i bdag nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa thams cad kyi rjes su son yang tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, that reality, by its very nature, pervades all the different things such as form, etc., but is not different,

original: spros pa ma lus pa las ldog pa ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa ma lus pa las ldog pa ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cessation of all conceptual elaboration is the universal characteristic of all dharmas.

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid ces pa la sogs pa ni khyad par gzhan spangs pas tha snyad tsam mo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid ces pa la sogs pa ni khyad par gzhan spangs pas tha snyad tsam mo //
translated: The expressions “emptiness of form,” up to “emptiness of consciousness,” etc., are mere conventional expressions, because they exclude other specific natures.

original: khyad par gzhan mi spong ba ni rab 'byor gzugs stong pa'o nas rnam par shes pa stong pa'o zhes pa'i bar kyang ngo //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan mi spong ba ni rab 'byor gzugs stong pa'o nas rnam par shes pa stong pa'o zhes pa'i bar kyang ngo //
translated: In particular, the non-rejection of other is also the passage from “Subhuti, form is empty” up to “consciousness is empty.”

original: gang zhig rten cing @263b 'brel par 'byung //
analyzed: gang zhig rten cing @263b 'brel par 'byung //
translated: That which is dependently arisen

original: de ni stong pa nyid du brjod //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid du brjod //
translated: is explained to be emptiness.

original: de ni brten nas brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de ni brten nas brtags pa'o //
translated: That is dependent imputation.

original: dbu ma yi ni lam nyid do //🔽zhes pa dang / gang phyir dben pa dben gyur las //
analyzed: dbu ma yi ni lam nyid do // zhes pa dang / gang phyir dben pa dben gyur las //
translated: It is the path of the middle way.🔽And: Because of being empty, it is not different

original: tha mi dad pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: from emptiness.

original: ces pa'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: ces pa'i rigs pa las so //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: don dam par ni chos kyi dbyings 'dir rang gi ngo bo spong ba'am ngo bo gzhan nye bar len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni chos kyi dbyings 'dir rang gi ngo bo spong ba'am ngo bo gzhan nye bar len pa ma yin no //
translated: In the ultimate, this element of attributes does not abandon its own entity or take up another entity.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: ldog pa rang bzhin med nyid phyir //
analyzed: ldog pa rang bzhin med nyid phyir //
translated: Because of the absence of entity in the reversal,

original: tha dad tha dad med rtag min //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad med rtag min //
translated: it is not different or not different and not permanent.

original: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs pa /🔽nam mkha' nam mkha' zhes brjod de /
analyzed: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs pa / nam mkha' nam mkha' zhes brjod de /
translated: The Bhagavat also said:🔽Space is said to be space.

original: nam mkha' ni brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni brjod du med pa'o //
translated: Space is inexpressible.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces brjod de stong pa nyid ni brjod du med pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces brjod de stong pa nyid ni brjod du med pa'o zhes so //
translated: Likewise, it is called “emptiness of emptiness,” but emptiness is inexpressible.

original: chos bstan pa don med par thal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos bstan pa don med par thal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And it does not follow that the teaching of the Dharma is pointless,

original: de rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi phyir te /🔽brgyud par phrin gyi yi ge mthong bas don rtogs pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje chen po'i rgyu mthun pa gang brjod du med pa'i don brjod pas gsal bar byed pa de 'di nam mkha' la tshon gyi ri mo 'god pa bzhin
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi phyir te / brgyud par phrin gyi yi ge mthong bas don rtogs pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje chen po'i rgyu mthun pa gang brjod du med pa'i don brjod pas gsal bar byed pa de 'di nam mkha' la tshon gyi ri mo 'god pa bzhin
translated: because it is the cause of understanding it.

original: du shin tu ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: du shin tu ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Just as one understands the meaning by seeing the written letter, so the Tathāgatas’ great compassion is the cause of the Dharma, which is inexpressible meaning, and it is made clear by expression. That is very wonderful, like painting a picture in the sky.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As is said,

original: blo gros rgya mtsho 'di lta ste skyes bu 'ga' zhig kho na nam mkha' gzugs med pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'di tshon sna tshogs pas bkra bar byed do //
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho 'di lta ste skyes bu 'ga' zhig kho na nam mkha' gzugs med pa bstan du med pa thogs pa med pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'di tshon sna tshogs pas bkra bar byed do //
translated: “Sāgaramati, it is like this: some person would paint a picture in the sky, which is formless, invisible, unimpeded, and non-revealing.

original: ji srid du blo gros rgya mtsho de bas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams shin tu dka' ba mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: ji srid du blo gros rgya mtsho de bas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams shin tu dka' ba mdzad pa ste /
translated: As long as that is so, O Sāgaramati, the Blessed Buddhas perform a very difficult task.🔽Having fully awakened to the inexpressible Dharma, they make it known to other beings through speech.

original: gang brjod du med pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas brjod pas sems can pha rol rnams la rnam par rig par byed pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gang brjod du med pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas brjod pas sems can pha rol rnams la rnam par rig par byed pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i bar du'o //
translated: And so on up to:

original: chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag pa 'di yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pas thams cad du dbyer med par 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings yongs su dag pa 'di yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pas thams cad du dbyer med par 'jug ste /
translated: This purity of the Dharma-realm is also fully accomplished by the equality of mind towards all sentient beings, because it is pure by nature, and it is entered into everywhere without distinction.

original: ji ltar rang gi sems rnam par dag par yongs su grub cing rtag tu rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir rang bzhin yongs su dag pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi yongs su 'jug pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi sems rnam par dag par yongs su grub cing rtag tu rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir rang bzhin yongs su dag pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi yongs su 'jug pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Just as one's own mind is fully accomplished as pure and always naturally luminous, because of its natural purity, in the same way, the engagement of the minds of all sentient beings is naturally pure.

original: 'on kyang glo bur ba'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par gzhag par mi bya'o //🔽de'i tshe yang skyon rnams kyis @264a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang glo bur ba'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par gzhag par mi bya'o // de'i tshe yang skyon rnams kyis @264a * //
translated: But it is not to be established as being free from adventitious stains.

original: gos pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gos pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Even then, it is not defiled by faults.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is naturally pure.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa ni skyon rnams te sun dbyung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir dang sems dri ma can du byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa ni skyon rnams te sun dbyung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir dang sems dri ma can du byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because desire, etc. are faults, they are to be rejected, because they defile the mind.

original: de rnams kyang glo bur ba ste brtags pa'i stobs kyis 'jug pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang glo bur ba ste brtags pa'i stobs kyis 'jug pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And they are adventitious, because they do not have that as their intrinsic nature, since they operate by the power of imagination.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams spang bar bya ba ste rang bzhin ni spang bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams spang bar bya ba ste rang bzhin ni spang bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, they are to be abandoned, because the intrinsic nature cannot be abandoned.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o zhes so //
translated: “This mind is luminous by nature.”

original: ji ltar nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag kyang mig ma dag pa rnams la rab rib la sogs pas nye bar bcom pa las rnam par ma dag par snang ba de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag kyang rang gi rtog pas kun nas bslang
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag kyang mig ma dag pa rnams la rab rib la sogs pas nye bar bcom pa las rnam par ma dag par snang ba de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag kyang rang gi rtog pas kun nas bslang
translated: Just as space, though naturally pure, appears impure to those with impure eyes, because it is destroyed by such things as cataracts, in the same way, though the dharmadhatu is pure, it appears impure to those whose eyes of wisdom are destroyed by the cataracts of their thoughts.🔽

original: ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan las shes rab kyi mig ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis nye bar bcom pa rnams la rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yang phyin ci log tu snang ngo //
analyzed: ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan las shes rab kyi mig ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis nye bar bcom pa rnams la rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yang phyin ci log tu snang ngo //
translated: Just as space, although naturally completely pure, appears impure to those with impure eyes, because it is destroyed by such things as cataracts, in the same way, although the completely pure dharmadhātu is completely pure by nature, it appears erroneously to those whose eyes of wisdom are destroyed by the cataracts of ignorance, because of the signs of desire and so on that are motivated by their own thoughts.

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i shes rab kyi spyan can rnams ni de ltar mi dgongs so //🔽chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa de yang rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i shes rab kyi spyan can rnams ni de ltar mi dgongs so // chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa de yang rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa ni /
translated: Those who have the eye of wisdom that is completely pure in every way do not think in that way.

original: khyad par med pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sku bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sku bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: That completely pure dharmadhātu is taught to be the dharmakāya of all tathāgatas, which is completely pure in every way and without distinction.

original: de kho na don dam par de bzhin gshegs par brjod do //
analyzed: de kho na don dam par de bzhin gshegs par brjod do //
translated: That suchness is called the Tathāgata ultimately.

original: dus thams cad du de bzhin kho nar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du de bzhin kho nar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists just as it is at all times.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud rnams la yang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud rnams la yang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: And because it exists in the mind-streams of all sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that all sentient beings have the essence of the Tathāgata.

original: thams cad la gnas kyang de sems can rnams kyi rang gi sgrib pa'i stobs bskyed pa las dmus long gis nyi ma bzhin du mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: thams cad la gnas kyang de sems can rnams kyi rang gi sgrib pa'i stobs bskyed pa las dmus long gis nyi ma bzhin du mi mthong ngo //
translated: Even though it abides in all, like the blind man and the sun, it is not seen by sentient beings due to the power of their own obscurations.

original: ji skad du theg pa chen po bsdus par gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du theg pa chen po bsdus par gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Mahāyāna-saṃgraha:

original: snod chag pa yi zla ba bzhin //
analyzed: snod chag pa yi zla ba bzhin //
translated: Like the moon in a broken vessel,

original: sems can skyon can la snang min //
analyzed: sems can skyon can la snang min //
translated: it does not appear to those with faults.

original: zhes so ; / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin na de ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i tshul can yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'bad rtsol med pas ci ltar sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i rgyu can gyi ye
analyzed: zhes so ; / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin na de ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i tshul can yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'bad rtsol med pas ci ltar sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i rgyu can gyi ye
translated: If the Tathāgatas are the nature of the pure dharmadhātu, since that is the mode free from all elaborations, how do they perform the welfare of sentient beings without effort?🔽

original: shes rnams skyed par byed ce na /
analyzed: shes rnams skyed par byed ce na /
translated: If the tathāgatas are the nature of the pure dharmadhātu, since that is free from all elaborations, how do the pristine wisdoms that are the cause of benefiting sentient beings arise without effort?

original: nam mkha' @264b bzhin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' @264b bzhin te /
translated: They are like space.🔽For example, space is the absence of obstruction to the arising of physical, verbal, and mental karma. It is the absence of obstruction in the nature of things. It is the absence of conceptualization.

original: dper na / nam mkha' ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bos skabs ster bar byed cing rnam par rtog par yang mi byed pa dang / dper na zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgron ma la sogs pa rnams kyi 'od zer rnams de la 'bad rtsol med par skyes nas gzugs la sogs pa rnams rab tu gsal bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bos skabs ster bar byed cing rnam par rtog par yang mi byed pa dang / dper na zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgron ma la sogs pa rnams kyi 'od zer rnams de la 'bad rtsol med par skyes nas gzugs la sogs pa rnams rab tu gsal bar byed pa dang /
translated: For example, the light rays of the moon, sun, lamps, and so on arise without effort in space and illuminate forms and so on.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rnams kyang 'bad rtsol dang bral bar sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa ni 'bad pa🔽med par don thams cad mdzad par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rnams kyang 'bad rtsol dang bral bar sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa ni 'bad pa med par don thams cad mdzad par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Just as wish fulfilling gems effortlessly fulfill the wishes of sentient beings, in the same way, the Tathagata, who abides in the pure dharmadhatu, is established as performing all actions without effort.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes lnga la sogs pa thams cad bskyed pa la rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes lnga la sogs pa thams cad bskyed pa la rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the pure dharmadhatu is the cause of the generation of all the Tathagata's five wisdoms and so forth,

original: ye shes kyi sprul pa longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa'i rgyu mtshan rnams thams cad la nam mkha' bzhin du go skabs 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sprul pa longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa'i rgyu mtshan rnams thams cad la nam mkha' bzhin du go skabs 'byin par byed do //
translated: or it is like space, providing the opportunity for all the causes of the activities of sentient beings, such as the emanations of wisdom, the enjoyment body, the emanation body and so forth.

original: mi zad pa nyid kyis rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir dang thogs pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa las kyang sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pa'i dbang las de'i bdag nyid rkyen gyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi zad pa nyid kyis rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir dang thogs pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa las kyang sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pa'i dbang las de'i bdag nyid rkyen gyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of its inexhaustibility, its vastness, and its unobstructedness, it is nonconceptual. However, due to the power of previous conditioning, it arises by the power of conditions as its own nature.

original: 'di kho na yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mchog tu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo ste /🔽gang mtshan dang dpe byad thams cad kyis yongs su brgyan pa rnams 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar gyi bskal par byin gyis rlob pa dang sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pas chos kyi sku'i gnas skabs las rnam par rtog pa med pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
analyzed: 'di kho na yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mchog tu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo ste / gang mtshan dang dpe byad thams cad kyis yongs su brgyan pa rnams 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar gyi bskal par byin gyis rlob pa dang sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pas chos kyi sku'i gnas skabs las rnam par rtog pa med pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
translated: This is the nature of the Tathagatas' supreme inconceivability.

original: dang / sprul pa rnams kyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: dang / sprul pa rnams kyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
translated: Those who are fully adorned with the major and minor marks bless the kalpas until the end of samsara and, by the power of their previous aspirations, without conceptualization, they act for the welfare of sentient beings with their omniscience and emanations in the state of the Dharma body.

original: gal te yang de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la 'di ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yang de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la 'di ni bya ba'o //
translated: Even though they act in this way, the Tathagatas have no conceptualization whatsoever.🔽If at that time the Tathagatas think, This is to be done, or This is not to be done, then they would be conceptualizing.

original: 'di ni bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med mod /
analyzed: 'di ni bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med mod /
translated: It is not that he thinks, This is not to be done.

original: de lta na yang sngon gyi 'phen pa'i dbang las rab tu nges par bzung nas /🔽gnyid sad pa bzhin dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de lta na yang sngon gyi 'phen pa'i dbang las rab tu nges par bzung nas / gnyid sad pa bzhin dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba bzhin du /
translated: However, he is definitely impelled by the power of his previous vow.

original: ji skad brjod pa'i bya ba rnams rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i bya ba rnams rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the activities that are to be done, like one waking from sleep or like one rising from the attainment of cessation.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos nges par bstan par gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos nges par bstan par gsungs pa /
translated: As the noble Sagaramati Sūtra says,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dge slong gand'i @265a * //
analyzed: dge slong gand'i @265a * //
translated: the monk Ganda

original: byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: blesses himself

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: and enters the absorption of cessation.

original: gand'i'i sgra de'i rna bar nye bar ltung ba yang ma yin la rnam par rtog par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gand'i'i sgra de'i rna bar nye bar ltung ba yang ma yin la rnam par rtog par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The sound of the word 'Ganda' does not reach his ear, nor does he conceive of it,

original: 'on kyang ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: but he still rises.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa de yang ye shes dang sprul pa thams cad kyis sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa la dbyer med par 'jug gi / skye ba dang 'gag pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa de yang ye shes dang sprul pa thams cad kyis sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa la dbyer med par 'jug gi / skye ba dang 'gag pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not engaged in production and cessation.

original: de kho na mngon par dgongs nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na mngon par dgongs nas gsungs pa /
translated: With that reality in mind, it is said:🔽Manjusri, 'nonproduction' and 'noncessation' are designations for Tathagatas.🔽Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.🔽Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.🔽Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.🔽Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.🔽Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.🔽Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.

original: 'jam dpal skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa zhes pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes pa la sogs pa dang / lha'i bu chos thams cad skye ba med pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa zhes pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes pa la sogs pa dang / lha'i bu chos thams cad skye ba med pa ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba ste /
translated: Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.🔽Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.🔽Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.🔽Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.🔽Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.🔽Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.🔽Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.🔽Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.🔽Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.

original: de lta na thob pa med do //
analyzed: de lta na thob pa med do //
translated: Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.🔽Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.🔽Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.🔽Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.🔽Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.🔽Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.

original: mngon par rtogs pa med do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa med do zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.🔽Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.🔽Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.🔽Son of a god, the nonproduction of all things is the appearance of the Buddha.

original: gzugs la sogs pa don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo can rnams la yang skye ba la sogs pa rnams yod pa ma yin pa la kun rdzob tu ni rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa don dam par de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo can rnams la yang skye ba la sogs pa rnams yod pa ma yin pa la kun rdzob tu ni rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, there is no attainment, no clear knowledge.🔽Son of a god

original: de bzhin du ye shes dang sprul pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes dang sprul pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang ngo //
translated: Likewise, all wisdom, emanations, and so on are also like that.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If the Tathāgata is the nature of the dharmadhātu,

original: de sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba nye bar sgrub pa'i ched du gsungs pa dang bzhud pa dang 'byon par byed pas ;
analyzed: de sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba nye bar sgrub pa'i ched du gsungs pa dang bzhud pa dang 'byon par byed pas ;
translated: then he is said to come and go for the sake of accomplishing the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyang smra ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong bar thal bas cig shos dang 'dra bar rnam par dag pa med pa dang skye ba la sogs par thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyang smra ba dang 'gro ba dang 'ong bar thal bas cig shos dang 'dra bar rnam par dag pa med pa dang skye ba la sogs par thal lo zhe na /
translated: Since he is not different from that, it follows that the dharmadhātu also speaks, goes, and comes. Therefore, like the other, it follows that it is impure and arises and so on.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ste chos kyi dbyings kyang sems can thams cad kyi rgyud kyi rjes su son pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ste chos kyi dbyings kyang sems can thams cad kyi rgyud kyi rjes su son pa'o //
translated: The nature of the dharmadhātu is the Tathāgata ultimately, and the dharmadhātu is also present in the mindstreams of all sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyang rang gi sa bon yongs su smin pa'i dbang las dang de'i bdag po nyid las de'i ngo bo'i bya ba so sor snang ba'i rnam par rig pa nye bar skyes pas na de ltar rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rang gi sa bon yongs su smin pa'i dbang las dang de'i bdag po nyid las de'i ngo bo'i bya ba so sor snang ba'i rnam par rig pa nye bar skyes pas na de ltar rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: Moreover, they arise from the power of the full maturation of their own seeds and from their own dominant condition, and the consciousness that appears as the individual activity of their own nature is generated. Thus, they function.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata

original: chos bstan pa dang bzhud pa la sogs pa sems can gyi don gyi bya ba mdzad do zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa dang bzhud pa la sogs pa sems can gyi don gyi bya ba mdzad do zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa'o //
translated: is conventionally said to perform the activity of benefiting sentient beings, such as teaching the Dharma and passing into nirvāṇa.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag po nyid tsam ma gtogs pa'i bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag po nyid tsam ma gtogs pa'i bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have any other activity apart from being the dominant condition.

original: gang las de'i ngo bo'i bya bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang las de'i ngo bo'i bya bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: From what is the activity of his own nature?

original: ji skad du 'phags pas gsungs pa /🔽khyod kyis yi ge gcig kyang @265b ni ;
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pas gsungs pa / khyod kyis yi ge gcig kyang @265b ni ;
translated: As it is said by the noble ones:🔽You, the chief,

original: / cung zad bshad pa med par ni //
analyzed: / cung zad bshad pa med par ni //
translated: without teaching even a single syllable,

original: gtso bos gdul bya'i skye bo kun //
analyzed: gtso bos gdul bya'i skye bo kun //
translated: satisfy all beings to be trained

original: chos kyi char pas tshim par mdzad //
analyzed: chos kyi char pas tshim par mdzad //
translated: with the rain of Dharma.

original: ces so // bcom ldan 'das ma bar mar yang /
analyzed: ces so // bcom ldan 'das ma bar mar yang /
translated: And in the Blessed Mother,

original: rigs kyi bu nges par de bzhin gshegs pa ni gang du yang bzhud pa 'am byon pa med de /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu nges par de bzhin gshegs pa ni gang du yang bzhud pa 'am byon pa med de /
translated: Son of noble family, the Tathāgata does not go anywhere or come from anywhere.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid ni g-yo ba med pa'o nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid ni g-yo ba med pa'o nas /
translated: Because suchness is unmoving.

original: ji srid du de bzhin nyid de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du de bzhin nyid de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Suchness is the Tathāgata.

original: gzugs kyi sku la mngon par dgongs nas de bzhin gshegs pa gshegs so zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku la mngon par dgongs nas de bzhin gshegs pa gshegs so zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te 'gal ba med do //
translated: With regard to the form body, it is said that the Tathāgata goes and so forth. There is no contradiction.

original: gal te sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid yin na ci ltar khyed dang bdag gi don nyid du 'bad rtsol med par 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor tha dad ce na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid yin na ci ltar khyed dang bdag gi don nyid du 'bad rtsol med par 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor tha dad ce na /
translated: If the realm of all buddhas is the nature of pure reality, how is it that you and I, without effort, have different circles of retinue?

original: chos kyi sku tha dad pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas spros pa med pa'i ngo bo can sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang las longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku tha dad pa can rnams kyi yang rang gi 'dus byas pa'i stobs kyis byung ba rnam
analyzed: chos kyi sku tha dad pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas spros pa med pa'i ngo bo can sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang las longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku tha dad pa can rnams kyi yang rang gi 'dus byas pa'i stobs kyis byung ba rnam
translated: The dharmakāya, the Tathāgata who is not different, is the nature of non-elaboration. By the power of previous aspirations, the saṃbhogakāya and nirmāṇakāya, which are different, arise by the power of one’s own composition.

original: pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams nye bar dmigs la /
analyzed: pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams nye bar dmigs la /
translated: The maṇḍala of the retinue, which is perfect in every way, is observed.

original: sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang bkod pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang bkod pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The various buddhafields and various arrays are also [observed].

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog gis dben pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog gis dben pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa /
translated: The mirror-like wisdom is free from the concepts of self and mine, and the concepts of object and subject, and is not limited to an object and aspect.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag spangs pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag spangs pa /
translated: It is free from all the stains of affliction and concepts.

original: g-yo ba med pa /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa /
translated: It is unmoving.

original: ye shes ma lus pa'i rten gyi rang bzhin dmigs pa ma lus pa la brjed ngas med pa /
analyzed: ye shes ma lus pa'i rten gyi rang bzhin dmigs pa ma lus pa la brjed ngas med pa /
translated: The nature of the support of all intuition, it is never forgetful of any object.

original: yul dang dbang po dang shes pa'i gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i rgyu mtshan shes pa thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang shes pa'i gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i rgyu mtshan shes pa thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa /
translated: It is the support of all cognitions that are the causes of the appearance of the reflections of objects, faculties, and consciousnesses.

original: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the object of the pure suchness.

original: de yang shes bya thams cad la khyab par byas nas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de yang shes bya thams cad la khyab par byas nas 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is also the source of the pervasion of all objects of knowledge.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The Tathāgata is of that nature.

original: des rang rig pa'i rnam pas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su son pa'i skye mched la sogs pa gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bar so sor snang ba rnams de'i rnam pa nye bar 'dzin pa'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: des rang rig pa'i rnam pas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su son pa'i skye mched la sogs pa gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bar so sor snang ba rnams de'i rnam pa nye bar 'dzin pa'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Therefore, by the mode of reflexive awareness, the Tathāgata thoroughly knows the appearances of the sense bases, etc., which are like reflections, because they are the apprehension of their aspects.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni brjed ngas pa med pa'i chos nyid can du yang de nyid kyi phyir rig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni brjed ngas pa med pa'i chos nyid can du yang de nyid kyi phyir rig ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is also known to be of the nature of nonforgetfulness for the very same reason.

original: @266a * // shes bya mtha' dag la brjed ngas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @266a * // shes bya mtha' dag la brjed ngas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no forgetfulness of any object of knowledge.

original: gzhan du na me long lta bu'i ye shes med na ci ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du na me long lta bu'i ye shes med na ci ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin te /
translated: Otherwise, if the mirror-like knowledge did not exist, how could there be omniscience?

original: shes bya'i phung po mtha' dag rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de la rab tu gsal bas so //
analyzed: shes bya'i phung po mtha' dag rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de la rab tu gsal bas so //
translated: Because the totality of objects of knowledge are clearly reflected in it, as if present before it.

original: dus gsum pa'i srog chags su gyur pa thams cad kyi shes pa yang des yang dag par mi rig pa 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: dus gsum pa'i srog chags su gyur pa thams cad kyi shes pa yang des yang dag par mi rig pa 'byung ba med de /
translated: And there is no arising of any knowledge of all living beings of the three times that is not known by that knowledge.

original: thams cad yang dag par rig pa kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag par rig pa kho na'o //
translated: All are known by it.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long gi ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long gi ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas /
translated: Or else, on the basis of the mirror-like knowledge of the Tathāgata,

original: rgyud gzhan rnams la yang skye mched dang de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams 'jig rten gyis shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan rnams la yang skye mched dang de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams 'jig rten gyis shes par 'gyur te /
translated: the images of the sense-spheres, their objects and consciousnesses arise in other mind-streams and are known by the world.

original: de med na de rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: de med na de rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir la /
translated: Because they do not occur in the absence of that knowledge,

original: 'byung ba'i dus nyid na yang yang dag par rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dus nyid na yang yang dag par rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because they are known by that knowledge even when they occur.

original: de'i phyir 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, this is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor la brten nas /
translated: Based on the sphere of the Tathāgata’s mirror-like wisdom,

original: skye mched dang de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams rnam par rig par byed do zhes so //
analyzed: skye mched dang de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams rnam par rig par byed do zhes so //
translated: the images of the sense-spheres, their objects, and consciousnesses are cognized.

original: de'i dbang gis de rnams 'byung ba'o zhes dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis de rnams 'byung ba'o zhes dgongs pa ste /
translated: It is intended that they arise by the power of that,

original: sa bon yod na'ang sa gzhi la sogs pa med pa las myu gu mi skye ba bzhin dang / gzugs yod kyang me long med pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan mi 'char ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon yod na'ang sa gzhi la sogs pa med pa las myu gu mi skye ba bzhin dang / gzugs yod kyang me long med pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan mi 'char ba bzhin no //
translated: just as a sprout does not arise from a seed that does not exist, even if there is a ground, etc., and just as a reflection does not arise due to the existence of form, if there is no mirror.

original: 'di yang mi g-yo ba bskyod bya ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang mi g-yo ba bskyod bya ma yin pa ste /
translated: This [mirror-like wisdom] is also immovable, not to be moved,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yongs su g-yo ba thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rgyun gyis rtag tu rjes su son pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yongs su g-yo ba thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rgyun gyis rtag tu rjes su son pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from all movements of conceptualization and because it always follows continuously.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa gsum rnams ni g-yo ba yang ste res 'ga' ba nyid du tha snyad bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa gsum rnams ni g-yo ba yang ste res 'ga' ba nyid du tha snyad bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The three beginning with the gnosis of equality are also moving, because they are conventionally said to be occasional.

original: gal te 'di shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu mtshan yin na de'i phyir de'i dbang gis 'byung ba srog chags thams cad kyi shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams cig car ram thams cad kyi tshe 'char bar thal bar ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu mtshan yin na de'i phyir de'i dbang gis 'byung ba srog chags thams cad kyi shes pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams cig car ram thams cad kyi tshe 'char bar thal bar ci ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the reason for the arising of consciousness is the existence of the mirror, then why does it not follow that the reflections of the consciousnesses of all living beings arise simultaneously in it?

original: ji ltar me long gi dkyil 'khor ni gzugs brnyan sna tshogs 'char ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur zhing rtag tu gzugs brnyan 'char bar byed pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar me long gi dkyil 'khor ni gzugs brnyan sna tshogs 'char ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur zhing rtag tu gzugs brnyan 'char bar byed pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: The surface of the mirror is the reason for the arising of various reflections, but it is not always the cause of the arising of reflections,

original: gzugs brnyan gyi rkyen la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi rkyen la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on the conditions of the reflections.

original: de bzhin du me long gi ye shes ni sems can dang / dus kyi rkyen gyi khyad par la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du me long gi ye shes ni sems can dang / dus kyi rkyen gyi khyad par la ltos pa ste /
translated: In the same way, the mirror-like gnosis depends on the conditions of sentient beings and time.

original: mu stegs pa la @266b sogs pa kha cig ni mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa las dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pas bsgribs /
analyzed: mu stegs pa la @266b sogs pa kha cig ni mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa las dam pa ma yin pa'i chos nyan pas bsgribs /
translated: Some, such as the tīrthikas, are obscured by listening to non-Dharma teachings due to encountering non-virtuous friends.

original: kha cig ni dam pa'i chos spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyis dam pa'i chos kyis phongs par gyur pa'i las byed /
analyzed: kha cig ni dam pa'i chos spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyis dam pa'i chos kyis phongs par gyur pa'i las byed /
translated: Some create the karma that is characterized by abandoning the holy Dharma, which leads to being bereft of the holy Dharma.

original: kha cig ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs /
analyzed: kha cig ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs /
translated: Some are obscured by the obscurations of affliction.

original: kha cig ni las kyi sgrib pa drag pos bsgribs /
analyzed: kha cig ni las kyi sgrib pa drag pos bsgribs /
translated: Some are obscured by the obscurations of karma.

original: kha cig ni ngan song gsum dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i mi dang 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi ngo bo rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs /
analyzed: kha cig ni ngan song gsum dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i mi dang 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi ngo bo rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs /
translated: Some are obscured by the obscurations of ripening, such as being born as a human in the three lower realms, in the north, or as a being without discernment.

original: kha cig ni mi khom par ltung /
analyzed: kha cig ni mi khom par ltung /
translated: Some fall into the unfavorable states.

original: kha cig ni theg pa dman pa'i rigs can rnams te /
analyzed: kha cig ni theg pa dman pa'i rigs can rnams te /
translated: Some have the lineage of the Hīnayāna.

original: 'di rnams thams cad dus re zhig pa'i snod ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad dus re zhig pa'i snod ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: All of these are not suitable vessels for a while.

original: ji skad du mdo sde rgyan du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo sde rgyan du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras:

original: ji ltar chu yi snod chag na //
analyzed: ji ltar chu yi snod chag na //
translated: Just as a pot that is broken

original: zla ba'i gzugs ni mi snang ba //
analyzed: zla ba'i gzugs ni mi snang ba //
translated: The form of the moon does not appear🔽In a broken clay pot.

original: de bzhin sems can ngan  pa la //
analyzed: de bzhin sems can ngan  pa la //
translated: Likewise, in evil sentient beings

original: sangs rgyas gzugs ni mi snang ngo //🔽ji ltar me ni gzhan du 'bar //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs ni mi snang ngo // ji ltar me ni gzhan du 'bar //
translated: The form of the Buddha does not appear.🔽Just as a fire burns elsewhere

original: slar yang gzhan du zhi ba ltar //
analyzed: slar yang gzhan du zhi ba ltar //
translated: And is extinguished elsewhere,

original: de bzhin sangs rgyas rnams la yang //
analyzed: de bzhin sangs rgyas rnams la yang //
translated: So it is with the buddhas:

original: snang dang mi snang shes par bya //
analyzed: snang dang mi snang shes par bya //
translated: Know that they appear and disappear.

original: zhes dang / sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba rnams yod pa na /
analyzed: zhes dang / sangs rgyas kyis gdul bar bya ba rnams yod pa na /
translated: And: When there are those to be trained by the buddhas,🔽the buddhas appear.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i phyir de snang gi rnam par brtul zin pa na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i phyir de snang gi rnam par brtul zin pa na /
translated: When the training is complete,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir de mi snang ngo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir de mi snang ngo //
translated: they disappear into nirvana.

original: gsungs pa / skye bo'i bsod nams kyis dang smon lam khyad par las //
analyzed: gsungs pa / skye bo'i bsod nams kyis dang smon lam khyad par las //
translated: It is said: Because of the merit of beings and the power of their special aspirations,

original: 'phangs phyir 'di yi 'jug pa shin tu bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: 'phangs phyir 'di yi 'jug pa shin tu bsam mi khyab //
translated: their activity is extremely inconceivable.

original: ces so // snying rje chan po'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku ni rtag pa ste /
analyzed: ces so // snying rje chan po'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku ni rtag pa ste /
translated: The dharmakāya, the nature of great compassion, is permanent.

original: rgyu ni yongs su smin gyur na //
analyzed: rgyu ni yongs su smin gyur na //
translated: When the causes are fully ripened,

original: gang dang gang la gang tshe dang // gang tshe bya ba phan 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang dang gang la gang tshe dang // gang tshe bya ba phan 'gyur ba //
translated: whenever,

original: de dang de la de snang ngo //
analyzed: de dang de la de snang ngo //
translated: that appears to them.

original: thams cad kyi tshe yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar gnas kyang sems can rnams kyi rang gi las kyi nyes pas bskyed pas rgyu ma tshang ba las 'bras bu ster bar snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar gnas kyang sems can rnams kyi rang gi las kyi nyes pas bskyed pas rgyu ma tshang ba las 'bras bu ster bar snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though the buddhas remain like wish fulfilling gems at all times, they do not appear to give their effects due to the incompleteness of the causes, which are the faults of sentient beings' own karma.

original: dper na lha'i rgyal pos char pha ba tu zin kyang rul bar gyur pa la sogs pas sa bon du mi rung bar gyur pa'i sh'a li la sogs pa'i sa bon ni myu gu skyed par mi byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lha'i rgyal pos char pha ba tu zin kyang rul bar gyur pa la sogs pas sa bon du mi rung bar gyur pa'i sh'a li la sogs pa'i sa bon ni myu gu skyed par mi byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even though the king of gods causes rain to fall, rice seeds and so on that are not suitable as seeds due to being rotten and so forth do not produce sprouts.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni gang byang chub sems dpa' sa mthong ba'i lam mngon par rtogs pa'i dus su bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes thob la /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni gang byang chub sems dpa' sa mthong ba'i lam mngon par rtogs pa'i dus su bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes thob la /
translated: The gnosis of equality is that when bodhisattvas realize the path of seeing, they attain the gnosis of the equality of self and others.

original: de nyid la dmigs pa de kho nas gong nas gong du sgom pa rab tu gyur @267a * //
analyzed: de nyid la dmigs pa de kho nas gong nas gong du sgom pa rab tu gyur @267a * //
translated: By means of that alone, they focus on that and their meditation becomes superior.

original: pa'i rnal 'byor gyis byams pa dang snying rje chen po dang ldan pa sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhugs pa /
analyzed: pa'i rnal 'byor gyis byams pa dang snying rje chen po dang ldan pa sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhugs pa /
translated: The yoga of the great being, endowed with great love and compassion, enters into the nirvana that does not abide in the buddha stage.

original: dbyibs dang kha dog gi bdag gi dngos po sku rnam pa sna tshogs pa ston pa'i thabs su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dbyibs dang kha dog gi bdag gi dngos po sku rnam pa sna tshogs pa ston pa'i thabs su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The method of manifesting the various forms of the body, which is the entity of shape and color, is established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir me long lta bu'i ye shes las khyad par ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir me long lta bu'i ye shes las khyad par ro //
translated: Therefore, it is distinguished from the mirror-like wisdom.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po tsam dang de'i chos nyid kyi yul can gyi me long lta bu'i ye shes la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po tsam dang de'i chos nyid kyi yul can gyi me long lta bu'i ye shes la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the object of the mirror-like wisdom, which has as its object the mere entity of dependent origination and the reality of that.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshangs pa chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: tshangs pa chos thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: Brahma, all phenomena are dependently originated.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khong du chud pa yang byang chub ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khong du chud pa yang byang chub ste /
translated: The understanding of dependent origination is enlightenment.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad gzigs pa ste 'dra ba kho na ni tshangs pa chos de rnams so /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad gzigs pa ste 'dra ba kho na ni tshangs pa chos de rnams so /
translated: Just as the Tathagata sees all phenomena, Brahma, those phenomena are exactly the same.

original: zhes dang / slar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes dang / slar yang gsungs pa /
translated: And again he says:

original: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma gtogs pa'i chos de rdul tsam yang ma mthong ngo zhes so //
analyzed: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma gtogs pa'i chos de rdul tsam yang ma mthong ngo zhes so //
translated: I do not see any dharma, even the size of a mere atom, that is not dependently arisen.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid la rten 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra yang yang dag par 'jug pa nyid du mngon par dgongs nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid la rten 'brel par 'byung ba'i sgra yang yang dag par 'jug pa nyid du mngon par dgongs nas gsungs pa /
translated: With the intention that the term “dependently arisen” applies only to the reality of dependent origination, he says:

original: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba de ni chos mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba de ni chos mthong ba'o //
translated: Whoever sees dependent origination sees the dharma.

original: gang chos mthong ba de ni sangs rgyas mthong ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: gang chos mthong ba de ni sangs rgyas mthong ba'o zhes so //
translated: Whoever sees the dharma sees the Buddha.

original: don dam pa'i chos yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang don dam pa'i sangs rgyas yin pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang don dam pa'i sangs rgyas yin pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because it is the ultimate dharma and because it is the ultimate Buddha.

original: de ni thams cad du tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: de ni thams cad du tha dad pa med do //
translated: It is not different in any way.

original: tshad med pa rnams kyang mi g-yo ba nas bzung nas rnam par smin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'byung ba dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi yul can dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang chos thams cad ma dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams kyang mi g-yo ba nas bzung nas rnam par smin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'byung ba dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi yul can dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang chos thams cad ma dmigs pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The immeasurables are also called objective because they are associated with the knowledge of sameness, because they are the domain of the realm of Dharma, and because they are nonconceptual, and because they do not apprehend any dharmas.

original: de rnams nyid sangs rgyas kyi sa la rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs shing rtag tu rjes su son pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams nyid sangs rgyas kyi sa la rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs shing rtag tu rjes su son pa ste /
translated: They are called fulfilled because on the Buddha stage they are fulfilled in every way and are always present.
