original: bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //🔽de rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro // de rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: Because their activity is uninterrupted.🔽They are called sameness because they function without any difference in all places.

original: thams cad du khyad par med par 'jug pa'i phyir ram yang na de rnams kho na mnyam pa nyid de mnyam pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du khyad par med par 'jug pa'i phyir ram yang na de rnams kho na mnyam pa nyid de mnyam pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, they are sameness itself because they are focused on sameness.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag dang lam dang 'bras bu dag kyang mnyam pa nyid de rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag dang lam dang 'bras bu dag kyang mnyam pa nyid de rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Samsara and nirvana, paths and fruits, are the same, because they are by nature completely at peace.

original: rnyed @267b pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad rnams thams cad du ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rnyed @267b pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad rnams thams cad du ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The eight worldly concerns, such as gain and loss, are all of one taste.

original: gcig tu mnyam pa nyid dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa yon tan rnams kyang mnyam pa nyid du yongs su rdzogs pas na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: gcig tu mnyam pa nyid dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa yon tan rnams kyang mnyam pa nyid du yongs su rdzogs pas na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: And since the qualities such as the elements that lead to enlightenment are also perfect in their sameness, it is the wisdom of equality.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni gzungs dang bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams thams cad kyi yang dag par 'dzin pa nyid kyis skye ba'i sgo
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni gzungs dang bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams thams cad kyi yang dag par 'dzin pa nyid kyis skye ba'i sgo
translated: The wisdom of discernment is the gateway to the arising of the powers, fearlessnesses and so forth, because it is the perfect retention of all the powers of memory, concentration, samadhi, absorption, the correct understandings, the powers and the fearlessnesses.

original: / shes bya'i rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad la thogs pa med par 'jug pa bee d'urya la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku yang dag par ston pa'i thabs /
analyzed: / shes bya'i rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad la thogs pa med par 'jug pa bee d'urya la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku yang dag par ston pa'i thabs /
translated: The method of displaying the body which is the nature of vaiḍūrya and so on, penetrating all the various aspects of objects of knowledge without obstruction.

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i rgyu'i chos rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa'i rgyu'i chos rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of cutting off all doubts, and it illuminates the Dharma.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can /
translated: It has as its object the general and particular characteristics.

original: rnam pa shin tu rnam par phyed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa shin tu rnam par phyed pa ste /
translated: Its aspect is very well differentiated.

original: ji ltar chos de rnams mngon par tha dad pa'i rnam pas phyed pa yin pa de lta kho nar so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar chos de rnams mngon par tha dad pa'i rnam pas phyed pa yin pa de lta kho nar so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it differentiates those dharmas just as they are, by the aspect of their manifest difference.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rgyu ste longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yis 'byor pa sna tshogs pa bstan pa las byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang dam pa'i chos rdzogs par longs spyod pa so sor nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rgyu ste longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yis 'byor pa sna tshogs pa bstan pa las byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang dam pa'i chos rdzogs par longs spyod pa so sor nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of the enjoyment body, because it is the experience of the enjoyment of the great bodhisattvas and the perfect enjoyment of the holy Dharma, from the display of the various enjoyments of the enjoyment body.

original: khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas gzhan gyi rgyu dang 'bras bus bsdus pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba so sor snang ba ste /
analyzed: khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas gzhan gyi rgyu dang 'bras bus bsdus pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba so sor snang ba ste /
translated: The individual appearances of mind and mental factors included in the causes and results of other realms, reincarnating beings and birth processes.

original: gang gi phyir de'i bdag rkyen las rtogs pa po rnams de ltar rnam par gzhag pa nye bar 'dogs pas so //🔽dga' ba'i rgyu yang ste pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa chos sna tshogs pa rnams kyis dga' bar bya ba nyid kyis dga' ba nges par 'brel par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i bdag rkyen las rtogs pa po rnams de ltar rnam par gzhag pa nye bar 'dogs pas so // dga' ba'i rgyu yang ste pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa chos sna tshogs pa rnams kyis dga' bar bya ba nyid kyis dga' ba nges par 'brel par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, those who understand it posit it and impute it.

original: de la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams dga' bas so //
analyzed: de la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams dga' bas so //
translated: It is the cause of joy, because it is the cause of the joy of bodhisattvas through being the cause of the joy of bodhisattvas through being the cause of the various kinds of joy, such as the transcendent perfections.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gdul bya ji lta bar sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i ched du tshad med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i thabs sna tshogs pa rnams kyis pha rol la phan pa byed pa'i rgyud
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gdul bya ji lta bar sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i ched du tshad med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i thabs sna tshogs pa rnams kyis pha rol la phan pa byed pa'i rgyud
translated: The gnosis that accomplishes activities is the cause of benefiting others in all the world systems through the infinite and inconceivable variety of skillful means for the sake of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: gcig pa can te rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can no //
analyzed: gcig pa can te rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can no //
translated: It is a single entity, having as its object the general and specific characteristics of all things.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sprul pa sna tshogs pa'i rten nyid kyi phyir sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sprul pa sna tshogs pa'i rten nyid kyi phyir sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: It is the emanation body because it is the basis for the various emanations of the tathāgatas.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is of three kinds:
the emanation of body,

original: sprul pa dang / gsung gi sprul pa dang / thugs kyi sprul pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa dang / gsung gi sprul pa dang / thugs kyi sprul pa'o //
translated: the emanation of speech, and the emanation of mind.

original: de la sku'i sprul pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sku'i sprul pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The emanation of body is of three kinds:

original: rdzu 'phrul kun du ston pa dang / skye ba kun du ston pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa kun du ston pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul kun du ston pa dang / skye ba kun du ston pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa kun du ston pa'o //
translated: the display of miracles, the display of birth, and the display of karma.

original: de rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis 'dun par mdzad de /
analyzed: de rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis 'dun par mdzad de /
translated: They are attracted by the miracle of the Buddha’s magical power.

original: dang por mngon du phyogs pa bskyed pa las rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dang por mngon du phyogs pa bskyed pa las rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: First, he generates faith by producing a sense of devotion.

original: dper na / lteng rgyas 'ong srungs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / lteng rgyas 'ong srungs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the faith generated in Urubilvā-Kāśyapa and so on.

original: kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul gyis yongs su smin par mdzad de /
analyzed: kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul gyis yongs su smin par mdzad de /
translated: They are matured by the miracle of his teaching.

original: las su rung ba nyid du bskyed pa las dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyas par mdzad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: las su rung ba nyid du bskyed pa las dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyas par mdzad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: and by the development of the roots of virtue through the creation of fitness.

original: rjes su bstan pa'i chos 'phrul gyis khams gsum pa ngang ngan 'gro las rnam par grol bar mdzad de /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa'i chos 'phrul gyis khams gsum pa ngang ngan 'gro las rnam par grol bar mdzad de /
translated: By the miracle of teaching, he liberates the three realms from evil destinies.

original: de'i nye bar bstan pa'i stobs kyis 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pa'i phyir dang / 'od zer 'gyed pa la sogs pas sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar byas shing sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dran par byas nas bde 'gro la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nye bar bstan pa'i stobs kyis 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pa'i phyir dang / 'od zer 'gyed pa la sogs pas sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar byas shing sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dran par byas nas bde 'gro la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the power of his teaching generates the noble path and because he causes the cessation of suffering through the emission of light rays, etc., and having reminded them of their former roots of virtue, he establishes them in good destinies.

original: cho 'phrul gsum rnams kyang gnas pa bzhin rnams kyis byed de /
analyzed: cho 'phrul gsum rnams kyang gnas pa bzhin rnams kyis byed de /
translated: The three miracles are performed by the four stations.

original: de la spyod lam gyis gnas pa ni sku'i las thams cad do //
analyzed: de la spyod lam gyis gnas pa ni sku'i las thams cad do //
translated: Among them, the station of conduct is all the actions of the body.

original: ston pas gnas pa ni gsung gi las thams cad do //
analyzed: ston pas gnas pa ni gsung gi las thams cad do //
translated: The station of teaching is all the actions of speech.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis gnas pa ni gang rang bzhin gyis mnyam par gzhag pa dang / gang yang ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par phyogs par byed pas te de gnyis yid kyi las so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis gnas pa ni gang rang bzhin gyis mnyam par gzhag pa dang / gang yang ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par phyogs par byed pas te de gnyis yid kyi las so //
translated: Abiding in concentration is twofold: natural meditative equipoise and the correct orientation toward concentration.

original: snyoms par 'jug pas gnas pa ni gang sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis sems can rnams la gzigs pa dang lha la sogs pa nas 'pho ba na yang ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pas gnas pa ni gang sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis sems can rnams la gzigs pa dang lha la sogs pa nas 'pho ba na yang ste /
translated: Abiding in meditative equipoise is twofold: the Tathāgatas look upon sentient beings with the eye of a Buddha, and they manifest birth in all the world systems simultaneously.

original: de gnyis ka yid kyi las so //
analyzed: de gnyis ka yid kyi las so //
translated: Both of these are mental actions.

original: skye ba kun du ston pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams cig car 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du skye ba nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba kun du ston pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams cig car 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du skye ba nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: The display of birth is the display of birth in all the places of birth in all the world systems simultaneously by the Tathāgatas.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa kun du ston pa ni las kyi 'gro ba yang dag par ston pa ste /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa kun du ston pa ni las kyi 'gro ba yang dag par ston pa ste /
translated: The display of the evolution of karma is the correct teaching of the evolution of karma.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar longs spyod pa yang dag par ston pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar longs spyod pa yang dag par ston pa'i phyir //
translated: It is the correct teaching of the experience of the results of karma, whether desirable or not.

original: gang gi phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal lus kyis myong ba sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu las kyi lus kyi rten can skye la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal lus kyis myong ba sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu las kyi lus kyi rten can skye la /
translated: Because pleasure and pain are experienced by the body, they arise as the result of past karma, and they are based on the body of karma.

original: sngon gyi las kyis sprul pa'i lus ni las kyi lus so //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis sprul pa'i lus ni las kyi lus so //
translated: The body emanated by past karma is the body of karma.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kho na sku sprul pa po las kyi sku ste so @268b sor snang ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kho na sku sprul pa po las kyi sku ste so @268b sor snang ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa ste /
translated: The body of emanation is the body of karma, because it is the cause of the appearance of the consciousness of the individual.

original: de lta bu byung ba dang spyod tshul gyi mtha' ston pa dang skyes pa'i rabs thams cad sgrol la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byung ba dang spyod tshul gyi mtha' ston pa dang skyes pa'i rabs thams cad sgrol la sogs pa'o //
translated: All the stories of the past lives of the Buddha, such as the Jataka Tales, are also the emanation body.

original: de thams cad kyang sprul pa'i skur ston pa ste /
analyzed: de thams cad kyang sprul pa'i skur ston pa ste /
translated: All of these are shown to be the emanation body.

original: dper na mthe bo'i rtse mo snad pa la sogs bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mthe bo'i rtse mo snad pa la sogs bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the teaching of the injury to the toe, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rdo rje'i snying po'i sku can nye bar 'pho ba med pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rdo rje'i snying po'i sku can nye bar 'pho ba med pa'i chos can te /
translated: The Tathagatas have the vajra essence body, and they are immutable.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' la yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug 'byung po bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag brgyad cu'i 'khor can gyis 'bad pa drag pos /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' la yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug 'byung po bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag brgyad cu'i 'khor can gyis 'bad pa drag pos /
translated: Because even though the lord of the desire realm, Mahesvara, with a retinue of 84 trillion spirits,

original: mtshon cha'i khyad par de dang de rnams kyis nye bar bsnun pa'i khyad par rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: mtshon cha'i khyad par de dang de rnams kyis nye bar bsnun pa'i khyad par rnams kyis kyang /
translated: made great effort to harm the bodhisattva with various weapons,🔽he did not create even a single hair-raising experience, let alone any other harm.

original: ba spu gcig langs pa'i nyams pa'ang skyes pa med na rnam pa gzhan du lta ci gzhig / de yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la yang lhas byin ming tsam nyid kyis nyes par spyod pa byas so zhes pa 'di ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ba spu gcig langs pa'i nyams pa'ang skyes pa med na rnam pa gzhan du lta ci gzhig / de yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la yang lhas byin ming tsam nyid kyis nyes par spyod pa byas so zhes pa 'di ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it that Devadatta committed negative actions merely by the name?

original: de'i phyir 'di thams cad ni srog chags rnams dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bya ba la rab tu 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i don du de dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid bstan pas gdul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di thams cad ni srog chags rnams dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bya ba la rab tu 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i don du de dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid bstan pas gdul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore all this is taught to be of the same fortune as sentient beings in order to guide them to engage in and turn away from virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: dka' ba spyod pa ston pa ni de ltar bstan pas gdul bar bya ba rnams gdul bya'i don dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis dag par mi 'gyur gyi ye shes kyis dag pa'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i don du yang ngo //
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa ston pa ni de ltar bstan pas gdul bar bya ba rnams gdul bya'i don dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis dag par mi 'gyur gyi ye shes kyis dag pa'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i don du yang ngo //
translated: The display of austerities is also for the purpose of teaching that those to be trained are not purified by mere morality and ritual, but by intuition.

original: byang chub ni mchog tu rnyed par dka' ba yin pas dge sbyong mgo reg la byang chub ga la yod ces pa 'di'i 'bras bu'o zhes gsungs pa ni ngag gi nyes par spyod pa las bzlog pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni mchog tu rnyed par dka' ba yin pas dge sbyong mgo reg la byang chub ga la yod ces pa 'di'i 'bras bu'o zhes gsungs pa ni ngag gi nyes par spyod pa las bzlog pa'i don du'o //
translated: The result of this is the statement: “How can there be enlightenment for a shaven-headed monk?” This is for the purpose of turning one away from verbal misconduct.

original: sku'i sprul pa dang gsung gi sprul pa de yang rang dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa dang ma 'brel pa yang ngo //
analyzed: sku'i sprul pa dang gsung gi sprul pa de yang rang dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa dang ma 'brel pa yang ngo //
translated: The emanation of body and the emanation of speech are both related and unrelated to one’s own and others’ bodies.

original: thugs kyi sprul pa ni rang dang gzhan dang 'brel pa kho na'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi sprul pa ni rang dang gzhan dang 'brel pa kho na'o //
translated: The emanation of mind is related only to one’s own and others’ minds.

original: de la sku'i sprul pa rang gi lus dang 'brel pa ni bdag nyid 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i gzugs su ston pa ste /
analyzed: de la sku'i sprul pa rang gi lus dang 'brel pa ni bdag nyid 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i gzugs su ston pa ste /
translated: The emanation of body related to one’s own body is the display of one’s own body in the form of a universal monarch, etc.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang nyan thos rnams kyis sku dang gsung gi 'jug pa ni 'jig rten rjes su gzhug pa las kyang rig par bya ste /🔽ji ltar mnyan yod du rgyal po ka pi na @269a * //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang nyan thos rnams kyis sku dang gsung gi 'jug pa ni 'jig rten rjes su gzhug pa las kyang rig par bya ste / ji ltar mnyan yod du rgyal po ka pi na @269a * //
translated: The physical and verbal actions of buddhas, bodhisattvas and sravakas are to be understood as engaging in the world through their inconceivable skill in means.

original: gdul ba'i don du bdag cag gi bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i gzugs 'dzin pas rgyan rnams kyang bzung zhing gzhu yang bzung la /
analyzed: gdul ba'i don du bdag cag gi bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i gzugs 'dzin pas rgyan rnams kyang bzung zhing gzhu yang bzung la /
translated: For example, in order to tame King Kapina in Shravasti, our Bhagavan took on the form of a chakravartin, took up ornaments and took up a bow.

original: 'khor de nyid du nyan thos chen po rnams thams cad kyis kyang rgyal phran la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis rab tu byung ba la bkag pa'i rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs pa bzung ba nas /
analyzed: 'khor de nyid du nyan thos chen po rnams thams cad kyis kyang rgyal phran la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis rab tu byung ba la bkag pa'i rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs pa bzung ba nas /
translated: In that retinue, all the great sravakas also took up various kinds of ornaments that were forbidden for those who had gone forth, taking on the forms of vassal kings and so on.

original: ji srid ka pi na dang blon po la sogs pa'i 'khor stong phrag bco brgyad bsnyen par rdzogs te /
analyzed: ji srid ka pi na dang blon po la sogs pa'i 'khor stong phrag bco brgyad bsnyen par rdzogs te /
translated: Until eighteen thousand retinue members including Kapina and his ministers were fully ordained.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / mnyan yod de nyid du bram ze'i khye'u 'dul ba'i dus na bcom ldan 'das tshangs pa'i gzugs gdong bzhi pa ral pa'i cod pan 'chang bar gsungs pa dang / rgyal po'i khab drug cu mtho ris kyi 'bras bu dang byang chub la rab tu bkod mtho ris kyi 'bras bu dang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa dang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / mnyan yod de nyid du bram ze'i khye'u 'dul ba'i dus na bcom ldan 'das tshangs pa'i gzugs gdong bzhi pa ral pa'i cod pan 'chang bar gsungs pa dang / rgyal po'i khab drug cu mtho ris kyi 'bras bu dang byang chub la rab tu bkod mtho ris kyi 'bras bu dang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa dang /
translated: In Rajagriha, he established sixty people in the result of the higher realms and enlightenment.

original: drang srong gnas 'jog gi rigs can gyi bram ze mo 'dul ba na /
analyzed: drang srong gnas 'jog gi rigs can gyi bram ze mo 'dul ba na /
translated: When taming the brahmin lady of the Rishipatana family,🔽in Shravasti the Bhagavan took the corpse of a woman and said, “This is my wife.”

original: mnyan yod du bcom ldan 'das kyis bud med kyi ro bzung zhing 'di ni bdag gi chung ma'o zhes kyang gsungs pa dang / ko sa la'i gar mkhan 'dul ba'i don du du yul ma kar kotta balli ru bcom ldan 'das gar mkhan gyi lugs 'dzin par gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: mnyan yod du bcom ldan 'das kyis bud med kyi ro bzung zhing 'di ni bdag gi chung ma'o zhes kyang gsungs pa dang / ko sa la'i gar mkhan 'dul ba'i don du du yul ma kar kotta balli ru bcom ldan 'das gar mkhan gyi lugs 'dzin par gsungs pa dang /
translated: In order to tame the dancer of Kosala, in the land of Markota Bhallika the Bhagavan taught in the form of a dancer.

original: dri za zur phud lnga pa gdul ba'i ched du dri za tha mal pa'i gzugs can bcom ldan 'das kyi pi wang bsnams shing glu blangs la pi wang gi rgyud stong po bcad pa na sgra stong phrag yongs su rdzogs pa nam mkha' las byung ba lta bu'o
analyzed: dri za zur phud lnga pa gdul ba'i ched du dri za tha mal pa'i gzugs can bcom ldan 'das kyi pi wang bsnams shing glu blangs la pi wang gi rgyud stong po bcad pa na sgra stong phrag yongs su rdzogs pa nam mkha' las byung ba lta bu'o
translated: In order to tame the gandharva Pañcaśikha, the Bhagavān took on the form of an ordinary gandharva, held a vīṇā, sang songs, and when he cut the thousand strings of the vīṇā, the sound of the thousand strings was completely heard as if coming from the sky.

original: // de bzhin du rab tu byung ba dang 'gal ba 'dul ba la bkag pa gzhan rnams kyang khyim pa tha mal pa'i gzugs kyis spyod par gsungs te /
analyzed: // de bzhin du rab tu byung ba dang 'gal ba 'dul ba la bkag pa gzhan rnams kyang khyim pa tha mal pa'i gzugs kyis spyod par gsungs te /
translated: Similarly, it is said that the other prohibitions in the vinaya that conflict with ordination are to be practiced by ordinary householders.

original: ji skad du bstod pa mdzad pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bstod pa mdzad pas gsungs pa /
translated: As the Praise in Honor of One Worthy of Honor says:

original: mchog tu zhi ba la gnas kyang //
analyzed: mchog tu zhi ba la gnas kyang //
translated: Although you abide in supreme peace,

original: thugs rje'i dbang du gyur nyid kyis //
analyzed: thugs rje'i dbang du gyur nyid kyis //
translated: because you are under the power of compassion,🔽you set your feet

original: rol mo mkhan gyi sgyu rtsal la'ang //🔽khyod kyi zhabs ni bkod pa mdzad //
analyzed: rol mo mkhan gyi sgyu rtsal la'ang // khyod kyi zhabs ni bkod pa mdzad //
translated: in the arts of the musician.

original: ces so // rol mo mkhan ni rol rtsed mkhan rnams so //
analyzed: ces so // rol mo mkhan ni rol rtsed mkhan rnams so //
translated: Musicians are those who play music.

original: de rnams kyi sgyu rtsal ni bzo ste bi wang sgrogs pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgyu rtsal ni bzo ste bi wang sgrogs pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Their arts are their crafts, such as playing the vīṇā.

original: de yang mdzad pa'i ched du gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mdzad pa'i ched du gshegs pa'o //
translated: and he went for the purpose of performing that action.

original: sde pa'i lung rnams su yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: sde pa'i lung rnams su yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said in the scriptures of the various sects:

original: mar me mdzad pa nas bzung nas //
analyzed: mar me mdzad pa nas bzung nas //
translated: “Beginning with Dīpaṃkara,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chags bral te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chags bral te //
translated: the Tathāgatas, free from attachment,

original: sgra can 'dzin sras zhes pa //
analyzed: sgra can 'dzin sras zhes pa //
translated: and the sons of Nanda and Upananda,

original: 'di ni 'jig rten rjes rjes gzhug @269b pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten rjes rjes gzhug @269b pa'o //
translated: these are the followers of the world.”

original: zhes te / cho 'phrul sna tshogs pa rnams ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te / cho 'phrul sna tshogs pa rnams ston pa'o //
translated: They display various miracles.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyag la sogs pa'i las mthun pa ma yin pa rnams kyang ston pa nas dman pa bran nyid kyi bar du yang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyag la sogs pa'i las mthun pa ma yin pa rnams kyang ston pa nas dman pa bran nyid kyi bar du yang ngo //
translated: The bodhisattvas also display actions that are not in accord with reality, such as bowing down to others, in order to conform to the world, even acting as a menial servant.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang nyan thos rnams kyi spyod pa ni 'di 'dra ba'o zhes bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang nyan thos rnams kyi spyod pa ni 'di 'dra ba'o zhes bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the conduct of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, the bodhisattvas, and the disciples is inconceivable.

original: de la thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis dad pa kho na bya'o //
analyzed: de la thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis dad pa kho na bya'o //
translated: Those who desire liberation should have faith in it.

original: gzhan yang kha cig tu gdul bya dang 'tsham pa'i yul du gshegs pas dang / kha cig tu gdul bya rnams rang gi yul du bkug pas dang / kha cig tu gnas pa'i sku las /🔽phyogs thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa rnams su sku la sogs pa yang dag par bstan pas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang kha cig tu gdul bya dang 'tsham pa'i yul du gshegs pas dang / kha cig tu gdul bya rnams rang gi yul du bkug pas dang / kha cig tu gnas pa'i sku las / phyogs thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa rnams su sku la sogs pa yang dag par bstan pas so //
translated: Moreover, in some places, the Bhagavat goes to a place that is suitable for the disciples, in some places, he draws the disciples to his own place, and in some places, he displays his body in immeasurable world systems in all directions from his own place.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni dbang thams cad so sor rtogs pa'i dbang nyid thob pa'i phyir sku la sogs pa rnams kyi rdul phra rab kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bar la 'jug pa dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams kyi yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pas dben par mdzad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni dbang thams cad so sor rtogs pa'i dbang nyid thob pa'i phyir sku la sogs pa rnams kyi rdul phra rab kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bar la 'jug pa dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams kyi yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pas dben par mdzad de /
translated: The Bhagavat, having attained the mastery of each of the powers, enters into the circle of atoms of the body, etc., and, in accordance with the aspirations of sentient beings, he causes them to be devoid of false imagination.

original: dper na ser skya'i gzhi'i nags su seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snying po dang brgya byin dang dpal mo dang ri skyes dang gzhon nu la sogs pa lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang srin po dang dri za dang lha ma yin dang nam mkha'
analyzed: dper na ser skya'i gzhi'i nags su seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snying po dang brgya byin dang dpal mo dang ri skyes dang gzhon nu la sogs pa lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang srin po dang dri za dang lha ma yin dang nam mkha'
translated: For example, in the forest of Kapilavastu, the Buddha subdued many hundreds of thousands of gods, nagas, yakshas, rakshasas, gandharvas, demigods, garudas, and kinnaras, such as the lion, Apajara, Vasu, Indra, Shri, Giri, Kumara, and so on, who were endowed with nirvana.

original: lding dang mi 'am ci brgya phrag stong du ma rnams mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i bstan pa sa btul lo zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu rim pa ji lta bar dper brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lding dang mi 'am ci brgya phrag stong du ma rnams mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i bstan pa sa btul lo zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu rim pa ji lta bar dper brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this way, the Buddha's deeds are to be known as illustrated by these examples, in the same order.

original: bag med pa dang ldan pa rnams kyang bag yod pa'i gnas la bkod pas /
analyzed: bag med pa dang ldan pa rnams kyang bag yod pa'i gnas la bkod pas /
translated: Even those who are heedless, he establishes in heedfulness,

original: de dang de'i sdug bsngal zhi bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de dang de'i sdug bsngal zhi bar mdzad de /
translated: and thereby pacifies their suffering.

original: dper na bdag cag gi bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' bo dang sor phreng dang mthong ldan dang bde byed la sogs pa rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bdag cag gi bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' bo dang sor phreng dang mthong ldan dang bde byed la sogs pa rnams bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the Blessed One of our own [tradition] doing so for Nanda, Angulimala, Ajnatakaundinya, Udayana, and so on.

original: de ltar ni dga' bo zhes bya ba sh'akya'i gzhon nu chags pa drag po can thams cad du rang gi chung ma la shin tu lhag par chags pa de med par yud tsam yang mi sdod pa de 'dra ba de /
analyzed: de ltar ni dga' bo zhes bya ba sh'akya'i gzhon nu chags pa drag po can thams cad du rang gi chung ma la shin tu lhag par chags pa de med par yud tsam yang mi sdod pa de 'dra ba de /
translated: Thus, the young Shakya man named Nanda was extremely attached to his wife. He could not stay away from her for even a moment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas khyim nas bkug nas rab tu byung du bcug cing rab tu byung nas kyang bud med de nyid nyin dang mtshan du sems par byed kyi chos ma @270a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas khyim nas bkug nas rab tu byung du bcug cing rab tu byung nas kyang bud med de nyid nyin dang mtshan du sems par byed kyi chos ma @270a * //
translated: The Tathagata took him from his home, caused him to go forth, and after he had gone forth, he still thought about that woman day and night.

original: yin pa byed pa /
analyzed: yin pa byed pa /
translated: He did not practice the Dharma.

original: de lta na yang de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar dgra bcom pa nyid thob par mdzad do //
analyzed: de lta na yang de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar dgra bcom pa nyid thob par mdzad do //
translated: Nevertheless, the Tathagata caused him to attain arhatship.🔽Similarly, the foolish brahmin called Angiraja killed 999 people, thinking, “I will kill one thousand people and then I will be a guru.”

original: de bzhin du bram ze rmongs pa sor phreng can zhes bya ba des bla ma'i bka'i bya ba ched du 'gyur ro zhes mi stong du gcig gis ma tshang ba 'tsho ba dang bral bar byas pa de yang phyis de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu phyung zhing khams
analyzed: de bzhin du bram ze rmongs pa sor phreng can zhes bya ba des bla ma'i bka'i bya ba ched du 'gyur ro zhes mi stong du gcig gis ma tshang ba 'tsho ba dang bral bar byas pa de yang phyis de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu phyung zhing khams
translated: The Tathagata later caused him to go forth and attain arhatship.

original: gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar mdzad do /
analyzed: gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar mdzad do /
translated: He also freed him from attachment to the third absorption.

original: zhes pa dang / mthong ldan ni ma skyes dgra yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / mthong ldan ni ma skyes dgra yin la /
translated: Ajatashatru was Darva Nagasena.

original: de'ang zhe sdang can te /
analyzed: de'ang zhe sdang can te /
translated: He was a man of anger.

original: de ltar ni des mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'grogs pa dang / sngon gyi 'khon rjes su 'brel pa las pa chos dang ldan pa'i rgyal po srog dang phral la /
analyzed: de ltar ni des mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'grogs pa dang / sngon gyi 'khon rjes su 'brel pa las pa chos dang ldan pa'i rgyal po srog dang phral la /
translated: He killed the righteous king Bimbisara because he associated with nonvirtuous friends and was influenced by his past hatred.🔽But he was freed from the fuel of the hell fires by relying on the Tathagata as a spiritual friend.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas dmyal ba'i me'i bud shing las thar ro zhes pa dang / rigs kyi bu la de byed kyang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i dbang las /🔽pha rol gyi bud med dang 'grogs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas dmyal ba'i me'i bud shing las thar ro zhes pa dang / rigs kyi bu la de byed kyang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i dbang las / pha rol gyi bud med dang 'grogs pa la brten nas /
translated: Son of family, because of the power of improper mental activity,🔽he took a wife from another family

original: ma 'tsho ba dang phral te /
analyzed: ma 'tsho ba dang phral te /
translated: and separated from his mother.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa kho na la brten nas pho long brdabs pa dang 'dra bas dmyal ba las 'das te mtho ris kyi 'jig rten gyi bde ba nyams su myong ngo zhes thos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa kho na la brten nas pho long brdabs pa dang 'dra bas dmyal ba las 'das te mtho ris kyi 'jig rten gyi bde ba nyams su myong ngo zhes thos so //
translated: and that, in dependence on the teaching of the Tathagata alone, he transcended the hells, which are like a ball of fire, and experienced the happiness of the higher realms.

original: sku'i sprul pa gzhan gyi lus dang lus 'brel pa ni bdud la sogs pa rnams sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i gzugs su ston pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i sprul pa gzhan gyi lus dang lus 'brel pa ni bdud la sogs pa rnams sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i gzugs su ston pa'o //
translated: The emanation of body that is related to another’s body is the manifestation of Mara, etc., in the form of the Buddha, etc.

original: ma 'brel pa ni sa la sogs pa rnams rin po che sna bdun la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i gzugs su ston pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'brel pa ni sa la sogs pa rnams rin po che sna bdun la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i gzugs su ston pa'o //
translated: The emanation of body that is unrelated to another’s body is the manifestation of earth, etc., in the form of the seven jewels, etc.

original: gang yang tshad med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku ston pa dang / gang yang 'od zer bkye nas 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed pa dang / gang yang skye ba la sogs pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang tshad med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku ston pa dang / gang yang 'od zer bkye nas 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed pa dang / gang yang skye ba la sogs pa ston pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the manifestation of immeasurable bodies of the Buddha, the emission of light rays and the illumination of world systems, and the manifestation of birth, etc., are all emanations of body.

original: de bzhin du gsung gi sprul pa bdag gi lus dang 'brel pa ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su go bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung gi sprul pa bdag gi lus dang 'brel pa ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su go bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the emanation of speech that is related to one's own body is the understanding of the infinite world systems by means of the Brahma-like voice.

original: gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa ni gang gis nyan thos la sogs pa chos ma gtogs pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi dbyangs kyis theg pa chen po'i chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa ni gang gis nyan thos la sogs pa chos ma gtogs pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi dbyangs kyis theg pa chen po'i chos ston pa ste /
translated: The emanation of speech that is related to the body of another is that by means of which the disciples and others, even though they are not Buddhists, are taught the Dharma of the Great Vehicle by the voice of the Buddha.

original: dper na 'phags pa rab 'byor la sogs pa rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa rab 'byor la sogs pa rnams bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the teaching of the Dharma by the voice of the Buddha to Subhuti and others.

original: ma 'brel pa ni rol mo'i rnam pa thams cad dang / gzugs @270b snang ba thams cad dang / nam mkha' las kyang chos ston pa'i sgra 'byung bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'brel pa ni rol mo'i rnam pa thams cad dang / gzugs @270b snang ba thams cad dang / nam mkha' las kyang chos ston pa'i sgra 'byung bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The emanation of speech that is unrelated is the teaching of the Dharma that occurs from all kinds of musical instruments, from all kinds of visible forms, and even from the sky.

original: thugs kyi sprul pa ni bdag nyid kyi chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi sprul pa ni bdag nyid kyi chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: The emanation of mind is the comprehension of all dharmas by oneself.

original: gzhan gyi'ang de ltar sems nges par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi'ang de ltar sems nges par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The emanation of mind that is related to another is the ascertainment of the mind of another.

original: gang gis shes rab dman pas kyang chos phra mo yang so sor rtogs par mdzad pa dang / dran pa nyams pa rnams kyang dran pa theb po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis shes rab dman pas kyang chos phra mo yang so sor rtogs par mdzad pa dang / dran pa nyams pa rnams kyang dran pa theb po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And those whose mindfulness has declined can attain mindfulness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de yang rnam pa thams cad du rtag par rjes su son pa bsam gyis mi khyab par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de yang rnam pa thams cad du rtag par rjes su son pa bsam gyis mi khyab par rig par bya ste /
translated: And that emanation of the Buddha should be known as inconceivable in all ways, as always and everywhere present.

original: mdzad pa bya ba dang grangs dang zhing gi bye brag las bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi phyir dang / sems can gyi don gyi bya ba la mi ldog par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzad pa bya ba dang grangs dang zhing gi bye brag las bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi phyir dang / sems can gyi don gyi bya ba la mi ldog par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is inconceivable in terms of its activities, its number, and the variety of its fields, and because it engages in the activities for the welfare of sentient beings without turning back.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang ye shes lnga po 'di rnams kyi go rims rnam par gzhag pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang de'i rab tu dbye ba las so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang ye shes lnga po 'di rnams kyi go rims rnam par gzhag pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang de'i rab tu dbye ba las so //
translated: The order of these dharmadhatu and the five wisdoms is established from cause, effect, and their divisions.

original: de la rgyu ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Therein, the cause is the extremely pure dharmadhatu.

original: 'bras bu ni 'phags pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni 'phags pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The effect is the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: de la dmigs par skyes pa'i phyir dang / de la brten pa'i phyir dang / de'i ldog pa'i dbye ba rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs par skyes pa'i phyir dang / de la brten pa'i phyir dang / de'i ldog pa'i dbye ba rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: because it is born by taking that as its object, because it is based on that, and because it is the fivefold transformation of that.

original: ji ltar skye ba las so zhes pa gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba las so zhes pa gzhan rnams so //
translated: How is it born? It is born from the transformation of the two obscurations.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rim pa ste /
translated: Or else, the nature of the Tathāgata is the cause and the result.

original: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / de la dmigs pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gnyis rab tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / de la dmigs pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gnyis rab tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The nature of the Tathāgata is suchness, which has the characteristic of purity, and the nondiscriminating intuition that has it as its object.

original: rgyu ni tshad med pa dang ldan pas sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni tshad med pa dang ldan pas sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes phul du byung ba'o //
translated: The cause is the preeminence of the intuition of sameness toward all beings, because it is endowed with the immeasurables.

original: 'bras bu ni gzhan gyi don byad pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni gzhan gyi don byad pa ste /
translated: The result is the performance of benefit for others,

original: de yang skal ba dang ldan pa dang skal pa med pa'i sems can so sor rtog pa las dang nge dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya bsgrub pa las so //
analyzed: de yang skal ba dang ldan pa dang skal pa med pa'i sems can so sor rtog pa las dang nge dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya bsgrub pa las so //
translated: which is due to the discernment of individual beings who are worthy and unworthy, and to the performance of the appropriate action.

original: yang na sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par gzhag pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par gzhag pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is the stage of the establishment of all buddhas.

original: ngo bo nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang bya ba sgrub pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gnyis dag dang / gnyis dag dang gcig gis rim pa ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang bya ba sgrub pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gnyis dag dang / gnyis dag dang gcig gis rim pa ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: The essence, the beatific, and the emanation buddhas are, respectively, the pure nature of the realm of Dharma, the pure nature of the realm of Dharma and of space, and the pure nature of the three realms.

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //🔽gal te yang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes de nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can nyid kyi @271a * //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no // gal te yang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes de nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can nyid kyi @271a * //
translated: This is as explained above.

original: phyir me long lta bu'i ye shes la dmigs pa de lta na yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku kho nas bsdus te /
analyzed: phyir me long lta bu'i ye shes la dmigs pa de lta na yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku kho nas bsdus te /
translated: If the mirror-like intuition is the essence body because it is the characteristic of the transformation of the afflicted mind, still, it is included in the beatific body.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni mi g-yo ba nyid kyis na chos kyi skus bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes ni mi g-yo ba nyid kyis na chos kyi skus bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mirror-like intuition is included in the essence body by reason of its immutability.

original: de slob dpon tsandra go mis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de slob dpon tsandra go mis gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated by the master Candragomin:

original: 'ga' zhig de bzhin nyid dmigs pa ;
analyzed: 'ga' zhig de bzhin nyid dmigs pa ;
translated: Some maintain that the suchness intuition

original: / me long ye shes su ni 'dod //
analyzed: / me long ye shes su ni 'dod //
translated: Is the mirror-like intuition.

original: gzhan rnams don kun rnam pa can //
analyzed: gzhan rnams don kun rnam pa can //
translated: The others have all objects as their aspects.

original: don kun spyod yul can du 'dod //
analyzed: don kun spyod yul can du 'dod //
translated: They are accepted as having all objects as their domain.

original: mnyam nyid ye shes gang yin pa //
analyzed: mnyam nyid ye shes gang yin pa //
translated: The knowledge of sameness

original: de ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs //
translated: is focused on suchness.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni //
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni //
translated: The knowledge of accomplishment of the task

original: dgos don rnam pa can du 'dod //
analyzed: dgos don rnam pa can du 'dod //
translated: is accepted as having the aspect of the necessary goal.

original: rnam pa kun du thams cad nyid//
analyzed: rnam pa kun du thams cad nyid//
translated: In every way, it has all aspects,

original: 'di yi rnam shes nus kun ldan //
analyzed: 'di yi rnam shes nus kun ldan //
translated: and its consciousness has all powers.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dag longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir mnyam pa nyid dang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dag longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of sameness and the knowledge of specific discernment are the body of enjoyment,

original: ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos la nye bar longs spyod pa'i rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos la nye bar longs spyod pa'i rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are the very support for the enjoyment of the Dharma that is understood.

original: de la 'bras bu'i gnas skabs ni sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du bzang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i gnas skabs ni sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du bzang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The state of result is called the stage of the perfect Buddha.

original: 'bras bu de yang ye shes dang spangs pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu de yang ye shes dang spangs pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: And that result is the nature of knowledge and abandonment.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of the pure realm of the Dharma.

original: ye shes de yang rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: ye shes de yang rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: And that knowledge is fivefold.

original: 'di tsam kho na sangs rgyas kyi sa ste /
analyzed: 'di tsam kho na sangs rgyas kyi sa ste /
translated: This is the stage of the perfect Buddha.

original: mtha' dag par der sangs rgyas kyi chos ma lus pa bsdus par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: mtha' dag par der sangs rgyas kyi chos ma lus pa bsdus par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because all the qualities of the Buddha are included in it.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa las bya ba gcig tu bya ba rnams ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas pa las bya ba gcig tu bya ba rnams ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus so //
translated: Those that are the same in action are included in the nature of the individual.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa ste lus la sogs pa las so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa ste lus la sogs pa las so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are included in the knowledge of discernment, because one discerns the body, etc.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The four right efforts are by nature vigor.

original: brtson 'grus kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi shes rab kyis yongs su bzung ba 'dor ba med cing gzhag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi shes rab kyis yongs su bzung ba 'dor ba med cing gzhag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: Vigor is also the transcendent lords’ knowledge of discernment, which is characterized by non-rejection and non-fixation.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: It is the knowledge of sameness.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The four immeasurables and the four bases of supernatural power are by nature meditative concentration, and thus are the knowledge of discernment.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo can rnams kyi gnas su 'gyur ro zhes pa'i gsung las so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo can rnams kyi gnas su 'gyur ro zhes pa'i gsung las so //
translated: It is the abode of those who possess the door of meditative concentration.🔽The other powers, which are different from the powers of the superknowledges, the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminations, and the knowledge of the knowledge of the path,

original: gang yang gzhan bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa dang / rdzu @271b 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dag kho na las gzhan pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
analyzed: gang yang gzhan bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa dang / rdzu @271b 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dag kho na las gzhan pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams dang /
translated: which are different from the meditative concentrations, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis, etc., which are different from the door of meditative concentration and the door of mnemonic spells,🔽which are different from the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminations, and the knowledge of the knowledge of the path,🔽which are different from the superknowledges,🔽which are different from the absence of conflict, the knowledge resulting from a resolve, the analytical knowledges, the fearlessnesses, the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha, and the knowledge of the path,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang smon nas shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / lam shes pa rnams dang kun du 'gro ba'i lam dang zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dag las gzhan pa'i stobs rnams ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang smon nas shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / lam shes pa rnams dang kun du 'gro ba'i lam dang zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dag las gzhan pa'i stobs rnams ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: which are different from the knowledge of the path that is omnipresent and the power of the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminations, are all of the nature of mirror-wisdom.

original: kha cig ni mi 'jigs pa rnams dang dad pa la sogs pa rnams mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni mi 'jigs pa rnams dang dad pa la sogs pa rnams mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The fearlessnesses and the faithendurances, etc. are the nature of the exalted wisdom of equality.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: The superknowledge of magical power is by the exalted wisdom of purposeful activity.

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par shes pa dang zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni zag pa zad pa'i rgyud la brjod par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par shes pa dang zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni zag pa zad pa'i rgyud la brjod par 'dod pa na /
translated: The superknowledge of the knowledge of the extinction of contaminants and the power of the knowledge of the extinction of contaminants are by the five exalted wisdoms when it is desired to express the continuum of the extinction of contaminants.

original: rgyu gang gis zag pa rnams zad pa'o zhes ye shes lnga rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis zag pa rnams zad pa'o zhes ye shes lnga rnams kyis so //
translated: By what cause are the contaminants extinguished?

original: yang na mya ngan las 'das pa ni zag pa rnams zad pa'o zhes pa ste chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rnams kyis so //
analyzed: yang na mya ngan las 'das pa ni zag pa rnams zad pa'o zhes pa ste chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rnams kyis so //
translated: Or, nirvana is the extinction of the contaminants, by the very pure expanse of reality and by the mirrorlike and equality exalted wisdoms.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes bzhi rnams so //
translated: The power of the knowledge of the path that leads to every destination is by the four exalted wisdoms, the mirrorlike and so on.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po dang shes rab kyi stobs ni me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dag gis so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po dang shes rab kyi stobs ni me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dag gis so //
translated: The faculty and power of wisdom are by the mirrorlike and the equality wisdoms.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam gyi yan lag rnams mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam gyi yan lag rnams mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis so //
translated: The branches of enlightenment and the branches of the path are by the wisdom of equality.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa shes pa bcu gnyis rnams me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dag gis so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa shes pa bcu gnyis rnams me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dag gis so //
translated: The twelve knowledges such as the knowledge of suffering and so on are by the mirrorlike and the wisdom of equality.

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ni me long ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ni me long ye shes kyis so //
translated: The nature of nonforgetfulness is by mirrorlike wisdom.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyar ba thams cad spangs pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang me long ye shes dag gis so //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyar ba thams cad spangs pa ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang me long ye shes dag gis so //
translated: The abandonment of all the connections of traces is by the purity of the dharmadhatu and mirrorlike wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The perfections are also like that.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni lam gyi gnas skabs su so sor rtog pa dang bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes dag gis so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni lam gyi gnas skabs su so sor rtog pa dang bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes dag gis so //
translated: The contaminated perfections are by the wisdom of discernment and all accomplishing wisdom in the context of the path.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad rnams ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad rnams ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus so //
translated: The major and minor marks are included in the gnosis of accomplishing activities.

original: ye shes kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs smos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs smos pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the collection of mind and mental factors is illustrated by gnosis,

original: de las gzhan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: the other qualities of buddhahood should be applied to that.

original: de bzhin du me long ye shes @272a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du me long ye shes @272a * //
translated: Similarly, mirror gnosis

original: dang de'i rten can gyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes pa gnyis po tshul gcig pa ste /
analyzed: dang de'i rten can gyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes pa gnyis po tshul gcig pa ste /
translated: and the gnosis of equality that is based on it are the same in mode,

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they focus on the pure expanse of reality.

original: de las gzhan pa'i ye shes gnyis kyang ro gcig pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ye shes gnyis kyang ro gcig pa ste /
translated: The other two gnoses are also of one taste,

original: gzhan la phan par byed pa rgyun gcig pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la phan par byed pa rgyun gcig pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are the same continuum of benefit for others and because they focus on suchness.

original: gnyis can gnyis dang chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes ni rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis can gnyis dang chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes ni rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med pa ste /
translated: The gnosis of the pure expanse of reality, which has two aspects, is not of a different nature,🔽because it is the same continuum of benefit for others and because it focuses on suchness.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of the objective support of the extremely pure dharmadhātu.

original: ji skad du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdor gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdor gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Buddha-field Sūtra:

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa na 'dres pa dang nye bar 'dres pa bya ba ro gcig pa can gyi ye shes kyi rdzogs par longs spyod pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa na 'dres pa dang nye bar 'dres pa bya ba ro gcig pa can gyi ye shes kyi rdzogs par longs spyod pa'o zhes so //
translated: “In the pure dharmadhātu, the enjoyment of the wisdom of the single taste of the mixed and thoroughly mixed is complete.”

original: gsung de nyid las sems bskyed pa snga ma rnams su ro gcig pa ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gsung de nyid las sems bskyed pa snga ma rnams su ro gcig pa ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: And in that same text, it should be understood that in the previous arousals of mind, there is not the single taste.

original: 'dres pa ni gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa ni gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The mixed is the single state.

original: gcig tu gyur pa yang res 'ga' tha dad par byed la /
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pa yang res 'ga' tha dad par byed la /
translated: The single state is sometimes made different,🔽but that is never made different.

original: de ni nam yang tha dad par bya ba med pa'o zhes pa nye bar 'dres pa shin tu dbyer med pas mnyam par dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa nyid du nye bar ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nam yang tha dad par bya ba med pa'o zhes pa nye bar 'dres pa shin tu dbyer med pas mnyam par dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa nyid du nye bar ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the thoroughly mixed, the thoroughly inseparable, the equalized, the objective support and the supporter are connected.

original: bya ba ro gcig pa ste ro ni snying po ste rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ba ro gcig pa ste ro ni snying po ste rang bzhin no //
translated: The single taste of activity is the essence, the nature.

original: ye shes kyis rdzogs par longs spyod pa ni yul te /
analyzed: ye shes kyis rdzogs par longs spyod pa ni yul te /
translated: The object is the enjoyment of the perfected nature of intuition,

original: chos kyi dbyings yang dag par longs spyad par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings yang dag par longs spyad par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the perfected nature of the realm of the Dharma.

original: ye shes kyis rdzogs par longs spyod pa gang gis dgongs pa ye shes kyi chos kyi dbyings la dmigs nas skye ba'i phyir ro gcig pa yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyis rdzogs par longs spyod pa gang gis dgongs pa ye shes kyi chos kyi dbyings la dmigs nas skye ba'i phyir ro gcig pa yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The enjoyment of the perfected nature of intuition is the same as the realm of the Dharma, the object of the enjoyment of the perfected nature of intuition, because it is born by taking that as its object.

original: yang na yang dag par longs spyod pa ni rdzogs par longs spyod pa myong byed de /
analyzed: yang na yang dag par longs spyod pa ni rdzogs par longs spyod pa myong byed de /
translated: Alternatively, the enjoyment of the perfected nature is the experience of the perfected nature.

original: ye shes kyis yang dag par longs spyod par bya ba nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: ye shes kyis yang dag par longs spyod par bya ba nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Because it is the perfected nature of intuition,

original: 'di ye shes kyis rdzogs par longs spyod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ye shes kyis rdzogs par longs spyod pa yin la /
translated: it is the enjoyment of the perfected nature of intuition.

original: de yang bde ba ste rten gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro gcig pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bde ba ste rten gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro gcig pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is bliss, because it is the same as the one support.

original: de la sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms kyi dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms kyi dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the same, because there is no distinction of suffering and equanimity in it.

original: 'bras bu yang ste chos kyi dbyings kyi'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ste chos kyi dbyings kyi'o //
translated: It is the result, that is, of the realm of the Dharma.

original: yang na ye shes kho na rdzogs par longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: yang na ye shes kho na rdzogs par longs spyod pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is the perfect experience of intuition alone.

original: kun rdzob tu rang rig pa nyid kyi rnam pas yang dag par longs spyad par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽de yang ro gcig pa ste bdag dang gzhan la sogs pa @272b gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rang rig pa nyid kyi rnam pas yang dag par longs spyad par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro // de yang ro gcig pa ste bdag dang gzhan la sogs pa @272b gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the perfect experience of the intuition of self-awareness in the conventional sense.

original: 'bras bu yang ste /🔽rgyu las gnyis kyi 'du shes kyis dben par dus thams cad du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //🔽mdo'i ngag gi don 'di yang /🔽'dir thams cad rig pa kho na'o //🔽ye shes lnga po 'di rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams kyang bsdus te /

original: 'on kyang sgrib pa'i lhag ma dang bcas pa nyid kyis na yongs su ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgrib pa'i lhag ma dang bcas pa nyid kyis na yongs su ma dag pa'o //
translated: But it is not completely pure because it still has the remainder of the obscurations.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyi spyi la mngon par dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyi spyi la mngon par dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction here, because it is said with the intention of the general, spontaneous wisdom.

original: mi g-yo ba la ni chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa chen po thob pas so //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la ni chos thams cad gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa chen po thob pas so //
translated: On the Immovable, one obtains the great acceptance of the nonarising of all phenomena, because all phenomena are primordially unborn.

original: gal te yang rab tu dga' ba la bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pa yod pa de lta na yang 'bad pa dang bcas par 'byung ba nyid kyis na yongs su dag pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par ma bzhag go //
analyzed: gal te yang rab tu dga' ba la bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pa yod pa de lta na yang 'bad pa dang bcas par 'byung ba nyid kyis na yongs su dag pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par ma bzhag go //
translated: Even though on the Joyful one obtains the sameness of self and others, it is not posited as pure because it still occurs with effort and is not completely pure.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad kyang rgya mtshor chu bo chen po rnams bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sar zhugs pa rten tha dad med pa rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad kyang rgya mtshor chu bo chen po rnams bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sar zhugs pa rten tha dad med pa rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: All the bodhisattva grounds are like the great rivers that enter the ocean, becoming indistinguishable in the buddha ground.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su dag pa rten tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid yongs su dag pa rten tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the suchness of all tathāgatas is completely pure, and the support is not different.

original: de ltar yang 'bras bu ro gcig pa can ye shes kyis rdzogs par longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'bras bu ro gcig pa can ye shes kyis rdzogs par longs spyod pa'o //
translated: Thus, the enjoyment of the enjoyment of wisdom is of one taste, i.e., of the result.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang zag pa med pa'i dbyings la sangs rgyas rnams du mar rnam par ma bzhag @273a * //🔽go ; / gang kho na chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo de kho na nyid stong pa nyid de ni shin tu rnam par dag pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi lam thob pa las sgrib pa gnyis
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang zag pa med pa'i dbyings la sangs rgyas rnams du mar rnam par ma bzhag @273a * // go ; / gang kho na chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo de kho na nyid stong pa nyid de ni shin tu rnam par dag pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi lam thob pa las sgrib pa gnyis
translated: For this very reason, the buddhas are not differentiated in the uncontaminated realm.

original: kyi sa bon shin tu bral bar gyur pa na yongs su dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid gnas gyur pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kyi sa bon shin tu bral bar gyur pa na yongs su dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid gnas gyur pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The suchness of all dharmas, which is the essence of non-error, is emptiness. That is the completely pure dharmadhātu, which is said to be the transformation of the basis when the seeds of the two obscurations are completely removed through attaining the supramundane path of completely pure wisdom.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings kyang ngo //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings kyang ngo //
translated: The uncontaminated realm is also that.

original: de ni ye shes chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de ni ye shes chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes te /
translated: That is the gnosis of the extremely pure dharmadhatu,

original: so sor rang gis rig par bya ba nyid kyis de la dmigs pas na mtha' med pa'i dus su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor rang gis rig par bya ba nyid kyis de la dmigs pas na mtha' med pa'i dus su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of that gnosis, which is to be realized by each one for himself, because it abides in the infinite time.

original: chos kyi dbyings de dang chos thams cad kyang me long lta bu'i ye shes kyis dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de dang chos thams cad kyang me long lta bu'i ye shes kyis dmigs pa ste /
translated: That dharmadhatu and all dharmas are the object of mirror-like gnosis,

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the general and particular characteristics.

original: gang kho na rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid gnas ngan len mtha' dag gi rten kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: gang kho na rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid gnas ngan len mtha' dag gi rten kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa /
translated: That which is the alayavijnana, the support of all the negative reflex actions of the nature of conceptualization,

original: gnyen po'i stobs kyis gnas ngan len gyi dri ma ma lus pa dang bral ba las gnas gyur pa de kho na me long ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po'i stobs kyis gnas ngan len gyi dri ma ma lus pa dang bral ba las gnas gyur pa de kho na me long ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: is called mirror-like gnosis, because it is the transformation of that [alayavijnana] which is free from all the stains of negative reflex actions by the power of the antidote.

original: gang slob dpon tsandra go mis gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang slob dpon tsandra go mis gsungs pa /
translated: That which was taught by the master Candragomin:

original: gang yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes //
analyzed: gang yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes //
translated: That which is the alayavijnana

original: me long ye shes nyid gyur pa //
analyzed: me long ye shes nyid gyur pa //
translated: becomes the mirror-like gnosis.

original: de yang chos kyi dbyings kyi ni //
analyzed: de yang chos kyi dbyings kyi ni //
translated: That also is the dharmadhatu

original: ngo bo nyid du 'ga' zhig 'dod //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du 'ga' zhig 'dod //
translated: Some assert it to be the nature itself.

original: ces so // kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: ces so // kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this foundation consciousness?

original: de nyid kyang de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i chos gzhan dge ba dang mi dge ba de dang de rnams kyis bsgo bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyang de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i chos gzhan dge ba dang mi dge ba de dang de rnams kyis bsgo bya ste /
translated: That very consciousness is directed by other phenomena, virtuous or nonvirtuous, that are different from it.

original: ji ltar rigs par sa bon rgyas pas rgyu byas pa gang las rgyud yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par rgyur blangs pa las stobs ji lta bar dgod par byed pa'i 'jug pa thob par gyur pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par sa bon rgyas pas rgyu byas pa gang las rgyud yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par rgyur blangs pa las stobs ji lta bar dgod par byed pa'i 'jug pa thob par gyur pa na /
translated: In accordance with the type of seed that is planted, the continuum is transformed by the cause that is planted, and the result is produced later, in accordance with the strength of the cause.

original: phyis de'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa @273b mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: phyis de'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa @273b mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: The result may be either desirable or undesirable.

original: dper na rgya skyegs kyi khu bas yongs su bsgos pa'i ras bal gyi sa bon la me tog dang 'bras bu yang dmar po nye bar skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgya skyegs kyi khu bas yongs su bsgos pa'i ras bal gyi sa bon la me tog dang 'bras bu yang dmar po nye bar skye ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a cotton seed that is completely soaked in lac dye will produce red flowers and fruit.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /🔽gang phyir rgyud gang kho na la //🔽las kyi bag chags bsgos gyur pa //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa / gang phyir rgyud gang kho na la // las kyi bag chags bsgos gyur pa //
translated: As it is said:🔽Because the result is connected🔽to the very continuum

original: de kho na la 'bras bu 'brel //
analyzed: de kho na la 'bras bu 'brel //
translated: in which the latent karmic imprint is planted,

original: ras bal la ni dmar nyid bzhin //
analyzed: ras bal la ni dmar nyid bzhin //
translated: like the redness of cotton.

original: zhes so // de kho na yang dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdor gdul bya'i khyad par gyi ngor gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // de kho na yang dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdor gdul bya'i khyad par gyi ngor gsungs pa /
translated: And that reality is stated in the Saṃdhinirmocana Sūtra from the perspective of the differences in disciples:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is deep and subtle;

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i rgyun bzhin 'bab //🔽bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i rgyun bzhin 'bab // bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
translated: All seeds spring up in it like a flowing river.

original: 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //
analyzed: 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //
translated: If I teach it to the childish,🔽They will imagine it to be a self.

original: zhes so // de ni yang srid par nyid mtshams sbyor ba rnams su lus len pa'i phyir len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zhes so // de ni yang srid par nyid mtshams sbyor ba rnams su lus len pa'i phyir len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the appropriating consciousness because it appropriates a body in the various rebirths.

original: chos thams cad kyi sa bon rnams kyi gzhi nyid kyi phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sa bon rnams kyi gzhi nyid kyi phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is called the foundation consciousness because it is the basis of all seeds.

original: skye ba snga ma'i rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba snga ma'i rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is called the fruitional consciousness because it is the fruitional effect of actions in previous lives.

original: gang 'di kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa 'di dang rnam par rtog pa can nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dbang po lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams las gzhan pa kho na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes sems pa de'i dmigs
analyzed: gang 'di kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa 'di dang rnam par rtog pa can nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang dbang po lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams las gzhan pa kho na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes sems pa de'i dmigs
translated: The mind that is different from the consciousnesses of the five sense faculties and the afflicted intellect that is conceptual is the foundation consciousness.

original: pa dang rnam pa ci yin /
analyzed: pa dang rnam pa ci yin /
translated: What is its object and aspect?

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o zhe na /
translated: It is not completely determined in terms of object and aspect.

original: ci ltar rnam pa shes pa zhes bya ba yang yin la 'di 'dra ba yang yin /
analyzed: ci ltar rnam pa shes pa zhes bya ba yang yin la 'di 'dra ba yang yin /
translated: How can it be called consciousness and also be like this?

original: de ltar ni rang gsal la thun mong ma yin pa rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar ni rang gsal la thun mong ma yin pa rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition is: consciousness that is self-clarity and not shared.

original: brjod pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa brgyad ma gtogs pa gzhan ni 'dir cung zad kyang so sor rang gi rnam pa dang bcas par nyams su myong ba med do //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa brgyad ma gtogs pa gzhan ni 'dir cung zad kyang so sor rang gi rnam pa dang bcas par nyams su myong ba med do //
translated: Apart from the eight consciousnesses that are described, there is no other consciousness that experiences its own aspect.

original: mi gsal bar yod do zhes 'dod pa yang rnam par shes par sma ba rnams kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gsal bar yod do zhes 'dod pa yang rnam par shes par sma ba rnams kyi ma yin te /
translated: Those who assert that it exists but is unclear are not Vijñaptika masters.

original: bdag la sogs pa phyi rol du gyur pa yang yod pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa phyi rol du gyur pa yang yod pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
