translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the self and so on would also exist externally.

original: rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rmi lam du yang nyams su myong ba med do zhes gzhan du legs par dpyad zin to //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rmi lam du yang nyams su myong ba med do zhes gzhan du legs par dpyad zin to //
translated: We have already examined this elsewhere, where we concluded that consciousness devoid of aspects is not experienced even in dreams.

original: de'i phyir rta'i rva bzhin du de la mngon sum med la rjes su dpag pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rta'i rva bzhin du de la mngon sum med la rjes su dpag pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, like the horn of a rabbit, it cannot be perceived by either direct perception or inference.

original: de ltar na yang gal te kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yongs su rtog na bdag kyang yongs su rtog cing de kho na yang bdag @274a * //
analyzed: de ltar na yang gal te kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yongs su rtog na bdag kyang yongs su rtog cing de kho na yang bdag @274a * //
translated: Even so, if you posit a foundation consciousness, you will also have to posit a self, and that self will be the very self that you assert to be the object of the view of the self.

original: gi rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gi rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: That is its nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di la yang mngon par dgongs nas bdag tu yongs su rtog par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di la yang mngon par dgongs nas bdag tu yongs su rtog par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: It is with this in mind that the Buddha taught the view of the self.

original: gang bye brag tu smra ba'i khyad par rnams ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: gang bye brag tu smra ba'i khyad par rnams ni legs pa'o //
translated: The Vaibhaika's position is excellent.

original: sems dul gyur las bde ba 'byung //
analyzed: sems dul gyur las bde ba 'byung //
translated: Happiness comes from a disciplined mind.

original: zhes pa dang / gang phyir bdag nyid bdag gi mgon //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / gang phyir bdag nyid bdag gi mgon //
translated: And, Since one is one's own protector

original: pha rol mgon du su zhig 'gyur //
analyzed: pha rol mgon du su zhig 'gyur //
translated: Who will be the protector of others?

original: zhes pa la sogs pa bstan pa na dgongs pa mi shes pa rnams sems kho na bdag go zhes mngon par rlom ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa bstan pa na dgongs pa mi shes pa rnams sems kho na bdag go zhes mngon par rlom ste /
translated: When the teaching of this kind is given, those who do not understand the intention imagine that mind alone is the self.

original: de rnams kyis gal te kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ston pa'i gsung rab nyan thos kyi theg pa thos par gyur na /
analyzed: de rnams kyis gal te kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ston pa'i gsung rab nyan thos kyi theg pa thos par gyur na /
translated: If they hear the scriptures that teach the foundation consciousness in the Sravakayana,

original: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa de bdag go zhes shin tu brtan par rlom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par shes pa de bdag go zhes shin tu brtan par rlom par 'gyur ro //
translated: then they will imagine that consciousness to be the self in a very firm way.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar yang mngon par dgongs nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar yang mngon par dgongs nas gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha taught this in a manner of indirect discourse:

original: byis pa rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The childish imagine that the self🔽has the character of the aggregates,🔽the elements, and the sense bases.🔽Some imagine the foundation consciousness,

original: gang rig pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rtog pa de ni chen po rnams kyang bag med pa las /
analyzed: gang rig pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rtog pa de ni chen po rnams kyang bag med pa las /
translated: which is devoid of the character of cognition,🔽to be the self.

original: rigs med pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs nges par khas len pa bzhin dang / don dam par grub pa'i shes pa tsam khas len pa bzhin du 'khrul pa'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rigs med pa dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs nges par khas len pa bzhin dang / don dam par grub pa'i shes pa tsam khas len pa bzhin du 'khrul pa'o zhes pa ste /
translated: It is like accepting that some have no potential, and that some have the definite potential of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and it is like accepting that consciousness that is ultimately established exists.

original: 'dir skyes bu tshad mas ci zhig /'dir brjod pa'i rigs pas sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag dang 'du shes med pa la yang sems yod do zhes 'dod pa ni yang dag par rtogs pa ma yin no zhes pa rgyas pas ci bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir skyes bu tshad mas ci zhig /'dir brjod pa'i rigs pas sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag dang 'du shes med pa la yang sems yod do zhes 'dod pa ni yang dag par rtogs pa ma yin no zhes pa rgyas pas ci bya ste /
translated: Here, what is the point of this extensive explanation that “it is a mistake to assert that there is no mind in the meditative attainments that lack mind and in the meditative attainment of nondiscernment”?

original: skabs su bab pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: We should set aside what is not relevant here.

original: ye shes gzhan gsum yang gnas gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes gzhan gsum yang gnas gyur pa ste /
translated: The other three kinds of gnosis are also transformations.

original: gang slob dpon tsandra go mis gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang slob dpon tsandra go mis gsungs pa /
translated: As the master Candragomin says:

original: nyon mongs can yid gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: nyon mongs can yid gnas gyur pa //
translated: The afflicted mind is transformed

original: mnyam nyid ye shes brjod par bya //
analyzed: mnyam nyid ye shes brjod par bya //
translated: And is said to be the gnosis of equality.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni //
translated: Discerning gnosis

original: yid kyi rnam shes nyid de'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam shes nyid de'o //
translated: Is the mental consciousness itself.

original: de dag longs spyod rdzogs sku nyid //
analyzed: de dag longs spyod rdzogs sku nyid //
translated: These are the very nature of the enjoyment body.

original: chos la rdzogs longs spyod ston phyir //🔽byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams //
analyzed: chos la rdzogs longs spyod ston phyir // byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams //
translated: In order to demonstrate the enjoyment of Dharma to the great bodhisattvas,🔽the buddhas manifest the enjoyment body.

original: chos la rdzogs longs spyod phyir yang //
analyzed: chos la rdzogs longs spyod phyir yang //
translated: In order to demonstrate the enjoyment of Dharma to the great bodhisattvas,

original: kha cig me long ye shes kyang //
analyzed: kha cig me long ye shes kyang //
translated: some conceive the mirrorlike gnosis

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ru rtogs //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ru rtogs //
translated: to be the enjoyment body.

original: de yang de la rgyu nyid phyir //
analyzed: de yang de la rgyu nyid phyir //
translated: That is so because it is the cause of that,

original: nye bar btags las de bzhin gzhan //
analyzed: nye bar btags las de bzhin gzhan //
translated: and it is so in terms of its designation.

original: dbang po lnga yi rnam shes gang //
analyzed: dbang po lnga yi rnam shes gang //
translated: The consciousnesses of the five sense faculties

original: de ni don kun yongs su 'dzin //
analyzed: de ni don kun yongs su 'dzin //
translated: are the apprehenders of all objects.

original: sems can kun gyi don du ni //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don du ni //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings,

original: bya @274b bsgrub pa tsam nyid thob //
analyzed: bya @274b bsgrub pa tsam nyid thob //
translated: they attain the mere state of being an agent.

original: de yang rtag par thams cad du //
analyzed: de yang rtag par thams cad du //
translated: Moreover, they are always

original: dus ji bzhin dang bsam ji bzhin //
analyzed: dus ji bzhin dang bsam ji bzhin //
translated: in accordance with time and in accordance with thought.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul sku ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul sku ste //
translated: The emanation body of the buddhas

original: sprul pa kun gyi rgyu nyid phyir //🔽kha cig yid kyi kho na la //
analyzed: sprul pa kun gyi rgyu nyid phyir // kha cig yid kyi kho na la //
translated: is the cause of all emanations.🔽Some conceive🔽the emanation body to be the mental consciousness alone.

original: sprul pa'i sku nyid du ni rtog / dbang po lnga yi rnam shes gang //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku nyid du ni rtog / dbang po lnga yi rnam shes gang //
translated: The consciousnesses of the five sense faculties

original: de yi longs spyod rdzogs skur ro //
analyzed: de yi longs spyod rdzogs skur ro //
translated: are the enjoyment body.

original: zhes so // de ltar ye shes lnga po 'di rnams ni yongs su dag pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i kun rdzob tu mchog tu zag pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings las nye bar skyes pa ste de'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar ye shes lnga po 'di rnams ni yongs su dag pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i kun rdzob tu mchog tu zag pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings las nye bar skyes pa ste de'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: Thus, these five pristine wisdoms are completely pure, born from the supreme, uncontaminated realm of supramundane relative truth, and are its nature.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings de yang chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings de yang chos kyi sku ste /
translated: That uncontaminated realm of reality is the dharmakāya.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos gang rnams kyi chos nyid yin pa'i chos de thams cad bcom ldan 'das ma chen mo dag tu gsungs la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos gang rnams kyi chos nyid yin pa'i chos de thams cad bcom ldan 'das ma chen mo dag tu gsungs la /
translated: The Bhagavatī has taught that all phenomena that are uncontaminated are the dharmatā of the dharmakāya.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos ni /
translated: Therefore, the treatise states:🔽The factors of enlightenment, the immeasurables,

original: byang chub phyogs mthun tshad med dang // rnam par thar dang mthar gyis ni //
analyzed: byang chub phyogs mthun tshad med dang // rnam par thar dang mthar gyis ni //
translated: the liberations, and the serial🔽absorptions,🔽which have the nature of the nine,🔽the ten totalities,

original: snyoms 'jug dgu yi bdag nyid dang // zad par bcu yi bdag nyid dang ; / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ni //
analyzed: snyoms 'jug dgu yi bdag nyid dang // zad par bcu yi bdag nyid dang ; / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ni //
translated: and the spheres of overpowering,

original: rab tu dbye bas rnam brgyad dang // nyon mongs med dang smon mkhyen dang // mngon shes so so yang dag rig / rnam pa thams cad dag bzhi dang // dbang bcu dang ni stobs bcu dang // mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi rnams dang // bsrung ba med pa rnam gsum dang //
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas rnam brgyad dang // nyon mongs med dang smon mkhyen dang // mngon shes so so yang dag rig / rnam pa thams cad dag bzhi dang // dbang bcu dang ni stobs bcu dang // mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi rnams dang // bsrung ba med pa rnam gsum dang //
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the three types of nonforgetfulness,🔽the three foundations of mindfulness,🔽the nature of being without error,🔽the complete destruction of the traces,

original: dran pa nyer gzhag rnam gsum dang // bsnyel pa mi mnga'i chos nyid dang // bag chags yang dag bcom pa dang // skye la thugs rje chen po dang // thub pa kho na'i ma 'dres chos //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag rnam gsum dang // bsnyel pa mi mnga'i chos nyid dang // bag chags yang dag bcom pa dang // skye la thugs rje chen po dang // thub pa kho na'i ma 'dres chos //
translated: the great compassion,🔽and the eighteen unmixed qualities of the Sage alone.

original: bco brgyad bshad pa gang yin dang // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen zhes pa'ang //
analyzed: bco brgyad bshad pa gang yin dang // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen zhes pa'ang //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects

original: chos kyi sku ru mngon par brjod //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ru mngon par brjod //
translated: is explained to be the dharmakāya.

original: ces so // byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang tshad med pa rnams dang zhes zlas dbye'o //
analyzed: ces so // byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang tshad med pa rnams dang zhes zlas dbye'o //
translated: The factors of enlightenment and the immeasurables are to be connected with the above.

original: mthar gyis ni snga ma'i rjes su phyi mas 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis ni snga ma'i rjes su phyi mas 'brel pa'o //
translated: The order is the connection of the later with the earlier.

original: bsrung ba med pa ni bsrung bar bya ba ma yin pa ste mi bsrung ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa ni bsrung bar bya ba ma yin pa ste mi bsrung ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Non-protection is not to be protected, i.e., not to protect.

original: de ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: This is the third kind.

original: chos kyi sku zhes pa ni zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes pa ni zag pa med pa ste /
translated: The Dharma Body is undefiled.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshogs so //
translated: Here, it is the aggregate of the Buddha’s qualities.

original: de la skabs ji lta bar bdag gis mang po rnams gsal bar byas la /
analyzed: de la skabs ji lta bar bdag gis mang po rnams gsal bar byas la /
translated: There, I have clarified the many according to the occasion.

original: lhag ma rnams 'dir gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams 'dir gsal bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be clarified here.

original: nyon mongs pa ni ku co dang 'thab rtsod la sogs pa ste /🔽'dir ni 'thab @275a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni ku co dang 'thab rtsod la sogs pa ste / 'dir ni 'thab @275a * //
translated: Afflictions are quarrels, disputes, etc.🔽Here, the cause of quarrels is afflictions.

original: pa'i rgyu nyon mongs pa ni 'thab pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu nyon mongs pa ni 'thab pa'o //
translated: Quarrels are afflictions.

original: bdag la dmigs nas 'di rnams kyi nyon mongs pa skye bar ma gyur cig ces ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la dmigs nas 'di rnams kyi nyon mongs pa skye bar ma gyur cig ces ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: May their afflictions not arise by taking me as an object. This is the samadhi in which one enters.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs las gang las longs nas grong khyer la sogs par zhugs pa de la dmigs nas der de rnams kyi 'thab pa mi skye ba de ni 'thab pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs las gang las longs nas grong khyer la sogs par zhugs pa de la dmigs nas der de rnams kyi 'thab pa mi skye ba de ni 'thab pa med pa'o //
translated: From the power of a previous vow, when one emerges from there and enters a city, etc., by taking that as an object, the quarrels of those there do not arise. That is non-quarrel.

original: de ni nyan thos la yang 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas la yang ste /
analyzed: de ni nyan thos la yang 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas la yang ste /
translated: That is also for the sravaka and also for the Buddha.

original: de dag gi byed pa la khyad par ro //
analyzed: de dag gi byed pa la khyad par ro //
translated: There is a difference in their function.

original: nyan thos kyi nyon mongs pa med pa ni grod la sogs par sems can gang rnams kyis mthong bar gyur pa na de la nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ste ;
analyzed: nyan thos kyi nyon mongs pa med pa ni grod la sogs par sems can gang rnams kyis mthong bar gyur pa na de la nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ste ;
translated: The sravaka's absence of affliction is that when any sentient beings see him, etc. , affliction does not arise in them.

original: de rnams kyi mthong ba nyid rnam par spong ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mthong ba nyid rnam par spong ba'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of their seeing itself.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ni mthong bar gyur pa na yang de rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rgyun gcod pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ni mthong bar gyur pa na yang de rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rgyun gcod pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The Tathagata's is that when they see him, their affliction is interrupted,

original: mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes pa nyon mongs pa 'thab pa dang 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes pa nyon mongs pa 'thab pa dang 'gog pa'o //
translated: but it is not abandoned.

original: nyan thos kyi nyon mongs med pa ni mthong bas mi rnams kyi nyon mongs pa skye ba rnam par spong la /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi nyon mongs med pa ni mthong bas mi rnams kyi nyon mongs pa skye ba rnam par spong la /
translated: Thus, the sravaka's absence of affliction is the abandonment of the arising of affliction in those who see him,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yi ni gzhan rnams kyi yang nyon mongs pa'i rgyun no zhes pa gzhan no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yi ni gzhan rnams kyi yang nyon mongs pa'i rgyun no zhes pa gzhan no //
translated: but the Tathagata's is the interruption of the continuum of affliction in others.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad kyang 'thab pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad kyang 'thab pa'o //
translated: All conceptual proliferation is conflict.

original: de rnams med pa las rnam par mi rtog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'thab pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams med pa las rnam par mi rtog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'thab pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of that is the meditative development of the non-conceptual.

original: 'di shes par gyur cig ces smon nas /
analyzed: 'di shes par gyur cig ces smon nas /
translated: Having aspired: 'May I know this',

original: bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi byung ba'i mtha' la sogs pa la gang shes pa skye ba de ni nyan thos rnams kyi smon nas shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi byung ba'i mtha' la sogs pa la gang shes pa skye ba de ni nyan thos rnams kyi smon nas shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge that arises in relation to the world, such as the end of origination, etc. is the knowledge through prayer of the śrāvakas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi smon nas mkhyen pa ni lhun gyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi smon nas mkhyen pa ni lhun gyis grub pa ste /
translated: The knowledge through prayer of the tathāgatas is spontaneous;

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of conceptual differentiation.

original: kun nas chags pa med pa ste ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas chags pa med pa ste ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is without attachment; because it is devoid of dependence.

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: It is unobstructed;

original: thams cad du gegs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du gegs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not impeded in any respect.

original: rtag tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa ste /
translated: It is ever present;

original: rtag tu thugs mnyam par gzhag pa la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rtag tu thugs mnyam par gzhag pa la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because it is always present in a state of meditative concentration.

original: dri ba thams cad la yang lan 'debs par byed do /
analyzed: dri ba thams cad la yang lan 'debs par byed do /
translated: He answers all questions.

original: yongs su dag pa rnam pa bzhi rnams ni rten yongs su dag pa dang dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang thugs yongs su dag pa dang ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa rnam pa bzhi rnams ni rten yongs su dag pa dang dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang thugs yongs su dag pa dang ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The four purities are the purity of the basis, the purity of the object, the purity of mind, and the purity of knowledge.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i phyogs thams cad kyi bag chags gnas ngan len rnams rten nas shin tu bral bar byas te rang gi bdag nyid kyi @275b dngos po la yang len pa dang gnas dang 'pho ba rnams la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du dbang bsgyur ba🔽nyid ni rnam pa thams cad du rten yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i phyogs thams cad kyi bag chags gnas ngan len rnams rten nas shin tu bral bar byas te rang gi bdag nyid kyi @275b dngos po la yang len pa dang gnas dang 'pho ba rnams la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du dbang bsgyur ba nyid ni rnam pa thams cad du rten yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the basis is the complete separation from the negative reflex actions of all the defilements and their propensities, and the mastery of the body, its taking up, its duration, and its laying down, just as one wishes.🔽The purity of the object is the mastery of all the objects, of emanation, of transformation, and of multiplication.

original: dmigs pa thams cad kyi sprul pa dang yongs su bsgyur ba dang / grangs rnams la dbang bsgyur ba nyid ni rnam pa thams cad du dmigs pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad kyi sprul pa dang yongs su bsgyur ba dang / grangs rnams la dbang bsgyur ba nyid ni rnam pa thams cad du dmigs pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of mind is the mastery of the mind, of concentration, and of the attainment of liberation.🔽The purity of knowledge is the mastery of knowledge, of the knowledge of the past, of the knowledge of the future, and of the knowledge of the present.

original: snga ma bzhin du sems gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral ba dang sems la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa thams cad bsags pa yang rnam pa thams cad du thugs yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sems gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral ba dang sems la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa thams cad bsags pa yang rnam pa thams cad du thugs yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: As before, the purification of mind is the complete purification of all the roots of virtue in the mind, free from all the negative tendencies of the mind.

original: sngar bzhin du ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral ba dang shes bya thams cad kyi ye shes la dbang bsgyur ba ni rnam pa thams cad du ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bzhin du ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral ba dang shes bya thams cad kyi ye shes la dbang bsgyur ba ni rnam pa thams cad du ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: As before, the purification of gnosis is the complete purification of the gnosis of all objects of knowledge, free from all the negative tendencies of the side of ignorance.

original: dbang bcu ni 'chi ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bkren pa dang / nyes pa spyod pa dang ngan 'gro dang yongs su tshol bas ngal ba dang / chos kyis phongs par gyur pa'i las kyi sgrib pa dang / 'dod pas bar du gcod pa dang 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: dbang bcu ni 'chi ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bkren pa dang / nyes pa spyod pa dang ngan 'gro dang yongs su tshol bas ngal ba dang / chos kyis phongs par gyur pa'i las kyi sgrib pa dang / 'dod pas bar du gcod pa dang 'jigs pa dang /
translated: The ten masteries are the antidotes to the ten kinds of harm: death, affliction, poverty, misdeeds, lower realms, weariness from searching, the obscuration of karma that leads to the lack of Dharma, the obstacles of desire, fear,

original: ci ltar smra bar bya zhes pa nye bar 'tshe pa bcu'i gnyen po rnams so //
analyzed: ci ltar smra bar bya zhes pa nye bar 'tshe pa bcu'i gnyen po rnams so //
translated: and the harm of “what should I say?”

original: de la tshe la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du tshe gnas pa'i phyir dang gtod ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la tshe la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du tshe gnas pa'i phyir dang gtod ba'i phyir te /
translated: Mastery of life is the ability to remain for as long as one wishes and to relinquish at will.

original: 'di lta ste brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste brjod du med pa'o //
translated: It is said to be inexpressible.

original: brjod du med pa'i bskal par tshe'i tshad byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa na'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i bskal par tshe'i tshad byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa na'o //
translated: It is the ability to bless the life span to last for an inexpressible eon and so on.

original: sems la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir dang ldang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir dang ldang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Mastery of mind is the ability to enter and rise from meditative concentration, meditative absorption, and meditative attainments as one wishes.

original: yo byad la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par phan par byed pa so sor nye bar gnas par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yo byad la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par phan par byed pa so sor nye bar gnas par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Mastery of requisites is the ability to cause whatever is needed to appear at will.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bkod pa du ma'i rgyan gyis so sor brgyan par byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa yang dag par ston pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bkod pa du ma'i rgyan gyis so sor brgyan par byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa yang dag par ston pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is the ability to display the adornment of all world systems with many arrays and so on.

original: las la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par sku dang gsung gi phrin las grub pa'i phyir dang dus ji lta bar las kyi rnam par smin pa byin gyis rlob pa yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par sku dang gsung gi phrin las grub pa'i phyir dang dus ji lta bar las kyi rnam par smin pa byin gyis rlob pa yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mastery of action is because one accomplishes the actions of body and speech as one wishes, and because one demonstrates the blessing of the maturation of action according to the time.

original: skye ba la dbang ba nyid ni skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du ji ltar 'dod par skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la dbang ba nyid ni skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du ji ltar 'dod par skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Mastery of birth is because one is born as one wishes in all places of birth.

original: rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par mngon par shes pa rnams dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rnam par 'phrul pa kun du ston pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par mngon par shes pa rnams dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rnam par 'phrul pa kun du ston pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Mastery of miracles is because one displays miracles as one wishes, such as the superknowledges and manifestations in all buddhafields.

original: smon lam la dbang ba nyid ni smon lam thams cad yang dag par grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽mos @276a * //
analyzed: smon lam la dbang ba nyid ni smon lam thams cad yang dag par grub pa'i phyir ro // mos @276a * //
translated: Mastery of aspiration is because all aspirations are accomplished.

original: pa la dbang ba nyid ni gang ji ltar mos pa de de bzhin kho nar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: pa la dbang ba nyid ni gang ji ltar mos pa de de bzhin kho nar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Mastery of resolve is because whatever one resolves upon becomes just that.🔽Mastery of knowledge is because one knows all objects of knowledge as one wishes.

original: dper na 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyis yongs su gang ba yang dag par ston pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyis yongs su gang ba yang dag par ston pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the teaching that all world-realms are completely filled with Buddhas.

original: ye shes la dbang ba ni gang kho na shes par 'dod pa de kho na shes pa ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: ye shes la dbang ba ni gang kho na shes par 'dod pa de kho na shes pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mastery of knowledge is the knowledge of just what one wishes to know.🔽 For example, it is like the teaching of the powers, fearlessnesses,

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad dang / mngon par byang chub pa yang dag par ston pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad dang / mngon par byang chub pa yang dag par ston pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: unshared qualities of the Buddha, major and minor marks, and perfect enlightenment.

original: chos la dbang ba nyid ni mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa rnams la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: chos la dbang ba nyid ni mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa rnams la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Mastery of Dharma is the skill in the arrangement of the teachings of Sutra and so on.

original: bsrung ba med pa gsum rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ni sku'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa gsum rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ni sku'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The three absences of fear are as follows: The Tathagata has a completely pure physical conduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de la sku'i kun du spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur ro zhes 'chab par bya bar dgongs pa cung zad mi mnga' ba 'di ni bsrung ba med pa dang po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de la sku'i kun du spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur ro zhes 'chab par bya bar dgongs pa cung zad mi mnga' ba 'di ni bsrung ba med pa dang po'o //
translated: The Tathagata does not have the slightest intention to conceal anything, thinking that others might know that his bodily conduct is impure. This is the first fearlessness.

original: de bzhin du gsung gi las ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung gi las ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the verbal action is the second.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi las ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi las ni gsum pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the mental action is the third.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni /
translated: The three foundations of mindfulness are

original: ji skad du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa ste /
translated: as stated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston pa ni kha cig gus par nyan 'dod rna gtod par byed kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed pa des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur yid bde bar mi 'gyur thugs
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston pa ni kha cig gus par nyan 'dod rna gtod par byed kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed pa des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur yid bde bar mi 'gyur thugs
translated: The Tathagata does not delight or feel pleased when some respectfully listen, attend with ears inclined, set their minds on understanding, and practice the Dharma in accordance with the teaching.

original: mthon po yang ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ba dang gzhan rnams gus par mi nyan rna mi gtong ces pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa khong khro ba ma yin mi bzod pa ma yin thugs mi ches pa ma yin thugs mi mnyes pa ma yin
analyzed: mthon po yang ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ba dang gzhan rnams gus par mi nyan rna mi gtong ces pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa khong khro ba ma yin mi bzod pa ma yin thugs mi ches pa ma yin thugs mi mnyes pa ma yin
translated: The Tathagata is not angry, nor is he impatient, nor does he lack confidence, nor is he displeased,

original: pa dang ; kha cig gus par nyan 'dod pa ngad gus par nyan mi 'dod pa des de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ro zhes pa dgyes pa dang khong khro bar te /
analyzed: pa dang ; kha cig gus par nyan 'dod pa ngad gus par nyan mi 'dod pa des de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ro zhes pa dgyes pa dang khong khro bar te /
translated: nor is he pleased, nor is he angry, when some people wish to listen respectfully and others do not wish to listen respectfully.

original: thams cad du btang snyoms par gnas pa dran pa dang ldan pa'i shes bzhin can no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du btang snyoms par gnas pa dran pa dang ldan pa'i shes bzhin can no zhes pa'o //
translated: He is impartial in all things, mindful, and self-possessed.

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i dus las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i dus las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of being without forgetfulness is that he never misses the time for acting for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: bag chags yang dag bcom pa ni /
analyzed: bag chags yang dag bcom pa ni /
translated: The complete destruction of the latencies is explained in the next verse.

original: nyon mongs pa sangs kyang gang nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa dang 'dra bar spyod pa de nyon mongs pa'i bag chags te til gyi mi tog la sogs pa bsal yang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa rnams la des yang dag @276b par bsgos pa'i dri
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sangs kyang gang nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa dang 'dra bar spyod pa de nyon mongs pa'i bag chags te til gyi mi tog la sogs pa bsal yang bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa rnams la des yang dag @276b par bsgos pa'i dri
translated: The latent impressions of the afflictions are like the purification of the afflictions, but one acts as if the afflictions had not been abandoned.

original: phra mo lhag par gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phra mo lhag par gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like the subtle remaining fragrance of sesame oil, etc., that remains in a pot or cloth, etc., even though the sesame seeds, etc., have been removed.

original: de la ma rig pa'i bag chags ni shes bya yongs su gcod pa'i gegs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i bag chags ni shes bya yongs su gcod pa'i gegs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Among them, the latent impressions of ignorance are the obstacle to the complete discernment of the knowable.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags ni lus dang ngag gi spyod tshul gyi khyad par gyi rgyu yang ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags ni lus dang ngag gi spyod tshul gyi khyad par gyi rgyu yang ste /
translated: The latent impressions of attachment, etc., are also the cause of the special conduct of body and speech.

original: ji ltar dgra bcom pa'i sngon du spre 'ur gyur pas mchongs nas gshegs pa dang / sngon bram zer gyur pa'i rmongs mo zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dgra bcom pa'i sngon du spre 'ur gyur pas mchongs nas gshegs pa dang / sngon bram zer gyur pa'i rmongs mo zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the conduct of a former arhat who, when he was a monkey, moved about jumping, and like the conduct of a former arhat who, when he was a brahman, was called “the foolish one.”

original: de thams cad nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la nub par gyur pa'o zhes pa nyon mongs pa'i bag chags yang dag par bcom pa de bcom ldan 'das su brjod do //
analyzed: de thams cad nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la nub par gyur pa'o zhes pa nyon mongs pa'i bag chags yang dag par bcom pa de bcom ldan 'das su brjod do //
translated: The Blessed One is so called because he has destroyed the latent impressions of the afflictions, which are all of that nature, and have disappeared in the Tathagata.

original: thugs rje chen po ni phan pa'i bsam pa nyid de gang gis bcom ldan 'das dus thams cad du lan drug tu su ni 'grib su ni 'phel zhes pa la sogs par 'jig rten la gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni phan pa'i bsam pa nyid de gang gis bcom ldan 'das dus thams cad du lan drug tu su ni 'grib su ni 'phel zhes pa la sogs par 'jig rten la gzigs pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the very intention to help, by which the Blessed One always looks upon the world with his eye of knowledge, six times during the day and night, asking, who is declining, who is advancing?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang khyad par dang mtshan nyid dang dbye ba mthar thug pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang khyad par dang mtshan nyid dang dbye ba mthar thug pa shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of all aspects is the knowledge of the ultimate nature, distinctions, characteristics, and categories of all phenomena.

original: stobs bcu rnams ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /🔽thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang ldang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: stobs bcu rnams ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang ldang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The ten powers are the power of knowing what is correct and incorrect, the power of knowing the fully ripened effects of actions, the power of knowing the various dhātus, the power of knowing the various aspirations, the power of knowing superior and non-superior faculties,🔽the power of knowing all paths and where they lead, the power of knowing the absorptions, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis, as well as their defilements and purification, the power of knowing one’s own and others’ past lives,🔽

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: The ten powers are the power of knowledge of proper and improper conditions, the power of knowledge of the results of evolutionary actions, the power of knowledge of various higher interests, the power of knowledge of various spiritual capacities, the power of knowledge of the paths going everywhere, the power of knowledge of recollection of former lives, the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, and the power of knowledge of the termination of contamination.

original: 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mdo las ji skad du gsungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mdo las ji skad du gsungs pa bzhin te /
translated: The ten powers are defined as they are described in the sutras.

original: de la srid pa dang mi srid pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dag sta /
analyzed: de la srid pa dang mi srid pa ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dag sta /
translated: The possible and the impossible are the possible and the impossible.

original: rgyu yang gnas so //
analyzed: rgyu yang gnas so //
translated: The cause is the possible.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽gnas kyang gnas su /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gnas kyang gnas su /
translated: For example,🔽the possible is the possible.

original: gnas ma yin pa yang gnas ma yin par rab tu mkhyen to zhes so ;
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa yang gnas ma yin par rab tu mkhyen to zhes so ;
translated: The impossible is the impossible.

original: / nyes par spyod pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: / nyes par spyod pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa ni gnas so //
translated: The undesirable ripening of bad actions is the possible.

original: 'dod pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The desirable is the impossible.

original: legs par spyad pa rnams kyi 'dod pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa rnams kyi 'dod pa ni gnas so //
translated: The desirable ripening of good actions is the possible.

original: mi 'dod pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The undesirable is the impossible.

original: ser snas dbul ba nyid ni gnas so //
analyzed: ser snas dbul ba nyid ni gnas so //
translated: Poverty due to stinginess is the possible.

original: longs spyod chen po nyid ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po nyid ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: Great wealth is the impossible.

original: @277a * // sbyin pas longs spyod chen po nyid ni gnas so //
analyzed: @277a * // sbyin pas longs spyod chen po nyid ni gnas so //
translated: Great wealth due to generosity is the possible.

original: dbul ba nyid ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbul ba nyid ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: Poverty is the impossible.

original: ma dang pha dang dgra bcom pa gsod pa dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mtshams med pa lnga byed pa'i ngang can dang / ma dang dgra bcom ma la mi tshangs par spyod pas sun 'byin pa dang /
analyzed: ma dang pha dang dgra bcom pa gsod pa dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mtshams med pa lnga byed pa'i ngang can dang / ma dang dgra bcom ma la mi tshangs par spyod pas sun 'byin pa dang /
translated: The five heinous actions are the characteristics of killing one's mother, killing one's father, killing an arhat, causing a schism in the Saṅgha, and maliciously drawing blood from a Tathāgata.🔽The five actions similar to heinous actions are defiling one's mother or an arhat, killing a bodhisattva who has attained certainty, killing one in training, stealing the property of the Saṅgha, and destroying a stūpa.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nges pa la gnas pa bkrongs pa dang / slob pa yang dang / dge 'dun 'du ba'i sgo phrogs pa dang / mchod rten 'jig pa zhes pa mtshams med pa dang nye ba lnga byed pa'i sems gnas pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nges pa la gnas pa bkrongs pa dang / slob pa yang dang / dge 'dun 'du ba'i sgo phrogs pa dang / mchod rten 'jig pa zhes pa mtshams med pa dang nye ba lnga byed pa'i sems gnas pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: A mind that abides in these five is not a proper basis.

original: 'gyod pas gnas pa'i sems rab tu sbyangs pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pas gnas pa'i sems rab tu sbyangs pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: A mind that abides in regret is not a proper basis.

original: bud med kyi lus de nyid kyis 'khor los sgyur ba dang tshangs pa nyid la sogs pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bud med kyi lus de nyid kyis 'khor los sgyur ba dang tshangs pa nyid la sogs pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: A woman's body itself is not a proper basis for becoming a universal monarch, Brahmā, and so on.

original: bzlog pa thams cad gnas so //
analyzed: bzlog pa thams cad gnas so //
translated: The opposite of all those is a proper basis.

original: 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen te /
translated: He knows such things as these, the possible and the impossible,

original: dag pa chags pa med pa thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: dag pa chags pa med pa thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: with pure, unattached, unobstructed knowledge.

original: ngag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba ste phyin ci ma log pa'o //🔽gang dang gang gyur pa'o zhes 'dod pas chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ngag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba ste phyin ci ma log pa'o // gang dang gang gyur pa'o zhes 'dod pas chags pa med pa'o //
translated: Pure means just as it is, without error.🔽Unattached means whatever it is, he knows it all.

original: rnam pa gang dang gang gis gyur pa zhes rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang dang gang gis gyur pa zhes rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Unobstructed means he knows it in every way.

original: mkhyen pa de nyid stobs te shin tu yang gzhan rnams kyis brdzi bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gzhan rnams shin tu yang zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhyen pa de nyid stobs te shin tu yang gzhan rnams kyis brdzi bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / gzhan rnams shin tu yang zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That knowledge is a power because it is extremely difficult to overcome and extremely overwhelming to others.

original: las ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Action is meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unshakable, etc.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsod nams ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsod nams ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Meritorious action in the realm of desire is meritorious. Meritorious action in the realms of form and no-form is unshakable.

original: kha cig tu khams gsum ka dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dge ba yang bsod nams su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: kha cig tu khams gsum ka dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dge ba yang bsod nams su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In some places, virtue that is concomitant with all three realms is also established as merit.

original: rnam par smin pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
translated: Maturation is happiness, suffering, and so on.

original: khams sna tshogs pa ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa bskyed pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: khams sna tshogs pa ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa bskyed pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The various realms are the concentrations that generate merit, demerit, and stability.

original: mos pa sna tshogs pa la 'dir mos pa ni 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs pa la 'dir mos pa ni 'dod pa ste /
translated: Various inclinations are inclinations of desire.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la gnas pa'i yang zhe sdang la 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang la gnas pa'i 'dod chags la 'dod pa dang / sbyor ba dman pa'i sbyor ba rgya chen po la dang / sbyor ba rgya chen po'i sbyor ba dman pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la gnas pa'i yang zhe sdang la 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang la gnas pa'i 'dod chags la 'dod pa dang / sbyor ba dman pa'i sbyor ba rgya chen po la dang / sbyor ba rgya chen po'i sbyor ba dman pa la'o //
translated: Thus, one who abides in attachment desires aversion, one who abides in aversion desires attachment, one who abides in the lower vehicle desires the great vehicle, and one who abides in the great vehicle desires the lower vehicle.

original: dbang po rnams ni dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang @277b dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang @277b dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab bo //
translated: The faculties are faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de rnams kyi mchog dang mchog ma yin pa tha ma dang 'bring dang mchog ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog dang mchog ma yin pa tha ma dang 'bring dang mchog ste /
translated: The best, middling, and least of those.

original: 'di ni dbang po tha ma'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po tha ma'o //
translated: This is the least of the faculties.

original: 'di ni dbang po 'bring ngo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po 'bring ngo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the middling faculty, etc.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam ste 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi khams yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang ma nges pa yang shes shing de dag gi rjes su mthun pa'i lam yang shes la ston par yang byed do //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam ste 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi khams yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang ma nges pa yang shes shing de dag gi rjes su mthun pa'i lam yang shes la ston par yang byed do //
translated: The path that goes everywhere is the path that goes everywhere, because it goes everywhere to the realms of sentient beings. Here the bodhisattva knows the realms of sentient beings as they are in reality, as well as those who are not definitely destined and those who are definitely destined. He also knows the path that is suitable for them and teaches it.

original: log pa nyid du nges pa rnam mkhyen nas /
analyzed: log pa nyid du nges pa rnam mkhyen nas /
translated: Having known those who are definitely destined for error,

original: de rnams la btang snyoms kho na rjes su mthun no zhes re zhig gi dus su btang snyoms su byed pa dang 'di ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i lam mo /
analyzed: de rnams la btang snyoms kho na rjes su mthun no zhes re zhig gi dus su btang snyoms su byed pa dang 'di ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i lam mo /
translated: he is indifferent to them, thinking, “It is suitable to be indifferent to them for the time being.” This is the path that acts as the antidote to attachment.

original: 'di ni zhe sdang gi'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhe sdang gi'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the path that acts as the antidote to anger, etc.

original: bsam gtan bzhi rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang / rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gsum rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang / rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gsum rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The four meditative concentrations, the eight liberations, the three meditative attainments such as the one that is accompanied by conceptual thought and accompanied by the investigation of doctrines, the four formless meditative attainments, and the nine serial meditative attainments.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ro myong ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ro myong ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Among them, defilement is due to relishing, etc.

original: rnam par byang ba ni dmigs pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni dmigs pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Purification is due to the absence of objective supports, etc.

original: ldang ba ni seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas sam thod rgal gyis so //
analyzed: ldang ba ni seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas sam thod rgal gyis so //
translated: Emergence is by the lion’s sport meditative attainment or by the meditative attainment of leaping over.

original: sngon gyi gnas ni skye ba snga ma'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas ni skye ba snga ma'o //
translated: Previous abodes are previous births.

original: de'i rjes su dran pa ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su dran pa ni dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection of those is memory.

original: 'chi 'phos pa dang / skye ba dag ni sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba dang skye ba dag go //
analyzed: 'chi 'phos pa dang / skye ba dag ni sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba dang skye ba dag go //
translated: Death and rebirth are the deaths and rebirths of sentient beings.

original: de 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal pos mdor gsungs pa /
analyzed: de 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal pos mdor gsungs pa /
translated: The noble lord of dhāraṇīs has stated this in brief:

original: de la 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan te /
translated: The divine eye of the Tathagata is as follows:

original: gang gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug par zhing du snang ba gang 'ga' zhig bsreg bzhin pa de rnams gzigs pa dang / 'jig bzhin pa rnams dang / 'chags bzhin pa rnams dang / gang du sems can du snang ba de rnams 'chi bzhin pa dang /
analyzed: gang gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug par zhing du snang ba gang 'ga' zhig bsreg bzhin pa de rnams gzigs pa dang / 'jig bzhin pa rnams dang / 'chags bzhin pa rnams dang / gang du sems can du snang ba de rnams 'chi bzhin pa dang /
translated: With it he sees all the appearances of realms in the ten directions, as far as the limits of space, those that are burning, those that are breaking up, those that are forming, and all the appearances of sentient beings there who are dying and

original: skye ba rnams thams cad dang / gang yang snang ba med pa'i sems can ji snyed pa de rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan la snang bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: skye ba rnams thams cad dang / gang yang snang ba med pa'i sems can ji snyed pa de rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan la snang bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: being born. Also, all the sentient beings who are not visible appear to the divine eye of the Tathagata.

original: gal te yang dbang po rnams gnas dan len gyi rang bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te yang dbang po rnams gnas dan len gyi rang bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: If the faculties were by nature appropriated,🔽then, like the mental faculty, the faculty of understanding, and so on,

original: mi shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbang po sangs rgyas nyid kyi gnas skabs na spangs pa na yid kyi blo bzhin du dbang po'i blo la sogs @278a * //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbang po sangs rgyas nyid kyi gnas skabs na spangs pa na yid kyi blo bzhin du dbang po'i blo la sogs @278a * //
translated: the faculties would be abandoned when the nature of ignorance is abandoned in the state of buddhahood.

original: pa rnams kyis yul thams cad yongs su gcod pas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa thams cad ni yul thams cad par 'dod de /
analyzed: pa rnams kyis yul thams cad yongs su gcod pas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa thams cad ni yul thams cad par 'dod de /
translated: Because all consciousnesses completely determine all objects, the Bhagavat asserts that all consciousnesses have all objects.

original: ji skad du dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa /
translated: As it says in the glorious Wheel of Time Tantra:

original: thams cad du ni phyag zhabs mtha' //🔽kun du can dang dbu dang zhal //
analyzed: thams cad du ni phyag zhabs mtha' // kun du can dang dbu dang zhal //
translated: Hands and feet extend everywhere.🔽Heads and faces are all around.

original: kun nas thos ldan 'jig rten du //
analyzed: kun nas thos ldan 'jig rten du //
translated: With ears extended in all directions,

original: thams cad khyab par byas te gnas //
analyzed: thams cad khyab par byas te gnas //
translated: he abides pervading everything.

original: zhes so // 'phags pa dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mdor yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // 'phags pa dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mdor yang gsungs pa /
translated: It also says in the Sutra of Generating the Power of Faith in the Mahayana:

original: 'jam dpal de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor gyis kyang gzigs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor gyis kyang gzigs so //
translated: Manjushri, in the same way, the ushnisha of the Tathagata sees.

original: de bzhin du mdzod spus kyang gzigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdzod spus kyang gzigs so //
translated: The urna also sees.

original: de bzhin du dus cig car phyogs bcu rnams su 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du gzigs so zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus cig car phyogs bcu rnams su 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du gzigs so zhes so //
translated: In the same way, simultaneously, he sees all the infinite world systems in the ten directions.

original: de ltar na yang dbang po'i blor sngon gyi rjes su 'brangs pas rnam par gzhag go zhes pas lha'i mig ces pa la sogs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dbang po'i blor sngon gyi rjes su 'brangs pas rnam par gzhag go zhes pas lha'i mig ces pa la sogs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Nevertheless, the cognition of the sense faculties is established in accordance with the past, and therefore it should be said that there is a divine eye, etc.

original: zag pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The defilements are the passions.

original: de rnams kyi zad pa gang yin pa dang / lam gang gis zad pa de gnyis ka yang zag pa zang pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi zad pa gang yin pa dang / lam gang gis zad pa de gnyis ka yang zag pa zang pa ste /
translated: The exhaustion of those and the path by which they are exhausted are both the exhaustion of the defilements.

original: sems can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi'o //
translated: This is for sentient beings.

original: seng ge bzhin du bsnyems pa shin tu mi mnga' bar rigs par gsungs ba ni mi 'jigs pa ste de'i dngos po'am las ni mi 'jigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: seng ge bzhin du bsnyems pa shin tu mi mnga' bar rigs par gsungs ba ni mi 'jigs pa ste de'i dngos po'am las ni mi 'jigs pa nyid do //
translated: The fearless proclamation of the Dharma in the assembly is fearlessness. The state or action of fearlessness is fearlessness.

original: mi 'jigs pa nyid bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa nyid bzhi rnams te /
translated: The four fearlessnesses are

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa nyid dang / zag pa zad pa la mi 'jigs pa nyid dang / bar du gcod pa'i chos la mi 'jigs pa nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba'i chos la mi 'jigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa nyid dang / zag pa zad pa la mi 'jigs pa nyid dang / bar du gcod pa'i chos la mi 'jigs pa nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba'i chos la mi 'jigs pa nyid do //
translated: fearlessness with respect to perfect enlightenment, fearlessness with respect to the exhaustion of contaminants, fearlessness with respect to the hindrances, and fearlessness with respect to the path of definite emergence.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Full enlightenment is the perfection of the Tathagata's knowledge.

original: zag pa zad pa ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the impurities is the perfection of abandonment.

original: de gnyis ni rang don no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni rang don no //
translated: These two are for one's own benefit.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i gegs so //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i gegs so //
translated: The dharmas that are obstacles are the hindrances to nirvana.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The dharmas that are the means of emancipation are what cause one to attain nirvana.

original: 'di gnyis ni gzhan gyi don te pha rol po rnams la de 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni gzhan gyi don te pha rol po rnams la de 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These two are for the benefit of others, because they are taught to others.

original: de rnams la mi 'jigs pa nyid de //
analyzed: de rnams la mi 'jigs pa nyid de //
translated: One is fearless with regard to those.

original: de dam bca' ba so sor 'god pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dam bca' ba so sor 'god pa rnams la'o //
translated: One is fearless with regard to the establishment of the individual doctrines.

original: de byed pa po mgon med pa sems can rnams te /
analyzed: de byed pa po mgon med pa sems can rnams te /
translated: The agents are the helpless sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyi mgon dang skyabs ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mgon dang skyabs ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The protector and refuge of those is the Lord Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni chos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni chos so //
translated: The twelve branches of the scriptures of the Tathagatas are the Dharma.

original: de'i brjod par bya ba mtha' dag ni don @278b no ;
analyzed: de'i brjod par bya ba mtha' dag ni don @278b no ;
translated: The totality of their expressions is the meaning.

original: / de rnams kho na'i ming gi phyogs gcig la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam pa mang por nges par bshad pa ni nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: / de rnams kho na'i ming gi phyogs gcig la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam pa mang por nges par bshad pa ni nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: The explanation of the many forms of just those terms, etc., is called etymological definitions.

original: yang na rgyu'i chos thams cad ni chos so //
analyzed: yang na rgyu'i chos thams cad ni chos so //
translated: Or else, all dharmas that are causes are called dharmas.

original: 'bras bu'i chos thams cad ni don no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos thams cad ni don no //
translated: All dharmas that are results are called artha.

original: 'gro ba drug tu gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi skad thams cad kho na ni nges pa'i tshig go ;
analyzed: 'gro ba drug tu gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi skad thams cad kho na ni nges pa'i tshig go ;
translated: All the languages of the sentient beings who are included in the six destinies are called nirukti.

original: / de rnams so so yang dag par rig pa ni rim pa ji lta bar chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos la sogs pa rnams pha rol po rnams la bstan pa'i ched du chos la sogs pa so so yang dag par mngon du gyur pa ni spobs pa'o //
analyzed: / de rnams so so yang dag par rig pa ni rim pa ji lta bar chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos la sogs pa rnams pha rol po rnams la bstan pa'i ched du chos la sogs pa so so yang dag par mngon du gyur pa ni spobs pa'o //
translated: The analytical knowledges of those are, in order, the analytical knowledge of dharmas, the analytical knowledge of meanings, the analytical knowledge of languages, and the analytical knowledge of clear expression. The clear expression of dharmas, etc., for the purpose of teaching them to others is called the analytical knowledge of clear expression.

original: de yang 'di yin la so so yang dag par rig pa yang ngo zhes pa spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di yin la so so yang dag par rig pa yang ngo zhes pa spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is this and also the analytical knowledges, thus it is the analytical knowledge of ready speech.

original: ma 'dres par spyod pa zhes pa ni ma 'dres pa'i chos te /
analyzed: ma 'dres par spyod pa zhes pa ni ma 'dres pa'i chos te /
translated: The phrase “unmixed conduct” means unmixed dharmas.

original: gzhan rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: gzhan rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa zhes pa'i don no //
translated: It means not in common with others.

original: de rnams kyang ji skad du 'khrul pa dang / ca co dang dran pa nyams pa med pa nyid dang / thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang  snyoms med pa nyid dang 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang rnam par grol ba rnams nyams pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de rnams kyang ji skad du 'khrul pa dang / ca co dang dran pa nyams pa med pa nyid dang / thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang  snyoms med pa nyid dang 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang rnam par grol ba rnams nyams pa nyid dang /
translated: Moreover, they are as follows: the absence of error, prattle, and loss of mindfulness; the absence of an unequiposed mind, of different kinds of ideation, and of indifference that is not thoroughly investigated; the absence of any loss of aspiration, effort, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, and liberation;

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las thams cad kyi ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang dus gsum rnams la thams cad du ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes rab tu 'jug pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa bco
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las thams cad kyi ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang dus gsum rnams la thams cad du ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes rab tu 'jug pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa bco
translated: The perfection of the wisdom that precedes and follows all the activities of body, speech, and mind, and that penetrates all times without attachment and without obstruction.

original: brgyad do // de la dang po ni sku'i 'phrin la yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad do // de la dang po ni sku'i 'phrin la yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The first of these is the purification of the activity of body.

original: gnyis pa ni gsung gi phrin las so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gsung gi phrin las so //
translated: The second is the activity of speech.

original: de nas bzhi pa ni thugs kyi phrin las so //
analyzed: de nas bzhi pa ni thugs kyi phrin las so //
translated: The fourth is the activity of mind.

original: de nas drug pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po rten dang bcas pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa rnams ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pa med pa las te /
analyzed: de nas drug pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po rten dang bcas pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa rnams ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pa med pa las te /
translated: The sixth is the absence of any loss of the faculties of the Tathagata, together with their support and their fruit.

original: de la rten ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: de la rten ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: The support is will.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The fruit is liberation.

original: dbang po ni brtson 'grus la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po ni brtson 'grus la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The faculties are faith, etc.

original: de nas gsum ni sku la sogs pa'i phrin las rnams ye shes kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams te /
analyzed: de nas gsum ni sku la sogs pa'i phrin las rnams ye shes kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams te /
translated: The next three are the blessings of pristine wisdom with respect to the enlightened activities of body and so on.

original: ye shes rgyu nyid kyis dang / ye shes dang lhan cig spyod pa nyid kyis na'o //
analyzed: ye shes rgyu nyid kyis dang / ye shes dang lhan cig spyod pa nyid kyis na'o //
translated: They are so called because pristine wisdom is their cause and because they are concomitant with pristine wisdom.

original: de nas gsum ni dus gsum rnams la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes rnams @279a * //
analyzed: de nas gsum ni dus gsum rnams la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes rnams @279a * //
translated: The next three are the pristine wisdoms of the three times, which are unobstructed and unattached.

original: so ; /'dir mdo ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: so ; /'dir mdo ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med do zhes pa'o //
translated: The sutra here is, “The Tathagata has no error.

original: ji ltar dgra bcom pa grong la sogs par bsod snyoms kyi ched du rgyu ba rnams glang po che dang rta gtum po dang ba lang dang khyi dang tsher ma dang sbrul la sogs pa rnams kyis gnod pa skyel ba dang / 'brog dgon par chom rkun dang stag la sogs pas 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar dgra bcom pa grong la sogs par bsod snyoms kyi ched du rgyu ba rnams glang po che dang rta gtum po dang ba lang dang khyi dang tsher ma dang sbrul la sogs pa rnams kyis gnod pa skyel ba dang / 'brog dgon par chom rkun dang stag la sogs pas 'jigs pa ste /
translated: Arhats who wander in villages and so on for the sake of alms are harmed by wild elephants, horses, oxen, dogs, thorns, snakes and so on, and in the wilderness they are frightened by robbers and tigers and so forth.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i 'khrul pa de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad kyis thams cad du mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i 'khrul pa de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad kyis thams cad du mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathagata has none of these errors.

original: 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po'i mdor yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po'i mdor yang gsungs pa /
translated: The King of Meditative Stabilizations Sūtra also says:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku'i phrin las 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku'i phrin las 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba ;
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas have no error in physical activity.

original: rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i spyod lam can /
analyzed: rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i spyod lam can /
translated: They have the conduct of generating faith.

original: spyod lam bzhis grong dang grong khyer du 'jug pa dang 'byung ba na zhabs kyi mthil gnyis sa la mi reg cing /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhis grong dang grong khyer du 'jug pa dang 'byung ba na zhabs kyi mthil gnyis sa la mi reg cing /
translated: When they enter and leave towns and cities with the four modes of conduct, the soles of their feet do not touch the ground,

original: sa chen po la 'khor lo rtsibs stong phrag can rnams 'byung ba dang / dri yid du 'ong ba can gyi padma rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa chen po la 'khor lo rtsibs stong phrag can rnams 'byung ba dang / dri yid du 'ong ba can gyi padma rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: but instead there appear wheels with a thousand spokes, and there appear lotuses with delightful scents.

original: gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs dag bzhag pa der gang byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi 'od kyis reg pa de rnams zhag bdun du mchog tu bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs dag bzhag pa der gang byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi 'od kyis reg pa de rnams zhag bdun du mchog tu bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Wherever the feet of the Tathāgata are placed, there sentient beings who are included among the animals, but who are touched by the light of the Tathāgata’s feet, will for seven days have supreme bliss,

original: shi 'phos nas kyang lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi 'phos nas kyang lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and after death they will be reborn among the gods.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la na bza' sor bzhi'i bar gyis mi reg par gnas la rtsom chen gyi rlung gis kyang g-yo bar byed ma nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la na bza' sor bzhi'i bar gyis mi reg par gnas la rtsom chen gyi rlung gis kyang g-yo bar byed ma nus so //
translated: The Tathagata's body is not touched by clothing, etc. even to the extent of four atoms, and even the great wind cannot move it.

original: sku'i 'od kyis mnar med pa'i mthar thug pa'i sems can rnams bde bar byed do //
analyzed: sku'i 'od kyis mnar med pa'i mthar thug pa'i sems can rnams bde bar byed do //
translated: The light of his body makes happy all the sentient beings up to the Avici hell.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa la sku 'khrul pa med par brjod par bya'o zhes te /
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa la sku 'khrul pa med par brjod par bya'o zhes te /
translated: Therefore, the Tathagata is said to have a body without error.

original: rtag pa kho nar yang dag par gzigs nas mdzad pa'i ngang can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa kho nar yang dag par gzigs nas mdzad pa'i ngang can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he always sees correctly and acts with a nature of compassion.

original: ca co mi mnga'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ca co mi mnga'o zhes pa ste /
translated: He does not have meaningless speech.

original: ji ltar dgra bcom pa rnams 'brog dgon par lam nor bas sgra mthon po 'don par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar dgra bcom pa rnams 'brog dgon par lam nor bas sgra mthon po 'don par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: As for the Arhats, when they go astray in the wilderness, they make a loud noise,

original: bag chags kyi dbang las gad mo cher god pa de lta bu sangs rgyas la mi mnga' ste rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags kyi dbang las gad mo cher god pa de lta bu sangs rgyas la mi mnga' ste rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or they laugh loudly through the power of residual impressions. The Buddha does not have that, because he is always in equipoise.

original: dran pa nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes pa ste /
translated: He does not have a loss of mindfulness.

original: ji ltar dgra bcom pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa las dran pa nyams pas bya ba mi byed pa dang / dus las kyang 'da' ba de lta bu sangs rgyas la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: ji ltar dgra bcom pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa las dran pa nyams pas bya ba mi byed pa dang / dus las kyang 'da' ba de lta bu sangs rgyas la mi mnga' ste /
translated: Just as an arhat, due to the loss of mindfulness, does not do what should be done and also misses the time, so it is not for a Buddha.

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he is endowed with great compassion.🔽He does not have an uncollected mind.

original: thugs mnyam par ma @279b bzhag pa mi mnga'o zhes pa ste ji ltar dgra bcom pa snyoms par zhugs pa kho na mnyam par bzhag pa yin gyi gzhan mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du gzhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs mnyam par ma @279b bzhag pa mi mnga'o zhes pa ste ji ltar dgra bcom pa snyoms par zhugs pa kho na mnyam par bzhag pa yin gyi gzhan mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro // tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du gzhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Just as an arhat is collected only when he is in meditative equipoise, but not otherwise, so it is not for a Buddha.

original: tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes mi mnga'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes mi mnga'o zhes pa ste /
translated: He does not have the perception of multiplicity.

original: ji ltar dgra bcom pa mtha' gcig tu phung po rnams la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes can dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes can yin pa de ltar sangs rgyas ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dgra bcom pa mtha' gcig tu phung po rnams la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes can dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes can yin pa de ltar sangs rgyas ma yin te /
translated: Just as an arhat has the perception of the aggregates as being disagreeable and the perception of nirvana as peace, so it is not for a Buddha.

original: rang bzhin gyis bdag med pa nyid kyis na gnyis ka la rnam gnyis ka la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi phyar ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bdag med pa nyid kyis na gnyis ka la rnam gnyis ka la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi phyar ro //
translated: Because of the absence of intrinsic self, he is non-discriminative with regard to both.

original: so sor ma snyoms mi mnga'o zhes pa ste ;
analyzed: so sor ma snyoms mi mnga'o zhes pa ste ;
translated: He is not indifferent to the individual.

original: ji ltar dgra bcom pa so sor ma brtags par sems can gyi don bya ba btang snyoms su byed pa de lta bu sangs rgyas la mnga' ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dgra bcom pa so sor ma brtags par sems can gyi don bya ba btang snyoms su byed pa de lta bu sangs rgyas la mnga' ba ma yin te /
translated: An Arhat is indifferent to the benefit of sentient beings when he is not attentive to it. This is not so for the Buddha.

original: de ni dus la sogs pa rnams so sor brtags pa rnams kho nas bar mar gnas par 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yon no //
analyzed: de ni dus la sogs pa rnams so sor brtags pa rnams kho nas bar mar gnas par 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yon no //
translated: He is attentive to the individual, to the time, etc. and remains in the middle, but not otherwise.

original: 'dun pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa yongs su nyams pa mi mnga'o zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: He does not have a loss of aspiration, etc.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams mdzad pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams mdzad pa la 'dun pa la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The Arhats do not have aspiration, etc. for action.

original: de'i phyir de la 'dun pa la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la 'dun pa la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, they do not have aspiration, etc.

original: de'i phyir nge rnams de rnams las ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nge rnams de rnams las ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams pa rnams so //
translated: Therefore, they are called “those who have fallen away from the attainment of those. ”

original: de lta bu sangs rgyas rnams la ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu sangs rgyas rnams la ma yin te /
translated: Such is not the case for the Buddhas,

original: de rnams kyis ma thob pa'i khyad par gyi chos med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis ma thob pa'i khyad par gyi chos med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no special Dharma that they have not attained.

original: de la 'dun pa la sogs pa rnams gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po'i mdor so sor rtog par mdzad pa ni byams pa dang snying rje dang chos ston pa dang sems can gdul ba dang yongs su smin par byed pa dang / rab tu dben pa dang byang chub yang dag par len du 'jug pa ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa la sogs pa rnams gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal po'i mdor so sor rtog par mdzad pa ni byams pa dang snying rje dang chos ston pa dang sems can gdul ba dang yongs su smin par byed pa dang / rab tu dben pa dang byang chub yang dag par len du 'jug pa ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: In the Dhāraṇīśvararāja Sūtra, aspiration and so on are analyzed as follows: Aspiration is the aspiration for love, compassion, teaching the Dharma, taming sentient beings, bringing them to full maturity, solitude, and taking up enlightenment.

original: brtson 'grus ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Effort is as follows:

original: gdul bya 'gugs par byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang / chos nyan pa rnams la mi sgrub pa med pa'i brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: gdul bya 'gugs par byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang / chos nyan pa rnams la mi sgrub pa med pa'i brtson 'grus te /
translated: Effort in attracting those to be tamed and effort in not failing to establish those who listen to the Dharma.
