original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa de gang bskal par mi skyo bar nyan pa de lta bu'i ngo bo'i chos nyan pa po rnyed na bskal par yang de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston bzhin pa mi bzhengs te /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa de gang bskal par mi skyo bar nyan pa de lta bu'i ngo bo'i chos nyan pa po rnyed na bskal par yang de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston bzhin pa mi bzhengs te /
translated: If the Tathāgata finds listeners of such a nature who listen without weariness for an eon, the Tathāgata will teach the Dharma for an eon without rising.

original: bza' ba dang bral ba'i rgyud kyis dang sems can la ltos pas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa gang ga'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams 'das @280a * //
analyzed: bza' ba dang bral ba'i rgyud kyis dang sems can la ltos pas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa gang ga'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams 'das @280a * //
translated: By the power of his vow, the Tathagata goes to as many buddha-fields as there are sands in the river Ganges, in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: par mdzad nas gang du tha na sems can gcig sangs rgyas kyi gdul byar 'gyur bar yang gshegs so //
analyzed: par mdzad nas gang du tha na sems can gcig sangs rgyas kyi gdul byar 'gyur bar yang gshegs so //
translated: He goes even to the extent of a single sentient being who is to be converted by the Buddha.

original: dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa dran nas sam bsam par mdzad nas sam /
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ste / de bzhin gshegs pa dran nas sam bsam par mdzad nas sam /
translated: He does not lose his mindfulness.

original: rtogs par mdzad nas sems can rnams la chos ston pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par mdzad nas sems can rnams la chos ston pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata does not teach the Dharma to sentient beings without being mindful, attentive, and aware.

original: ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: It is the sameness of samadhi.

original: chos thams cad kyi mi mnyam pa med pa nyid dang ji lta ba bzhin nyid do //🔽gang mnyam pa dang mnyam pa nyid de dang ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mi mnyam pa med pa nyid dang ji lta ba bzhin nyid do // gang mnyam pa dang mnyam pa nyid de dang ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: It is the absence of inequality and the suchness of all dharmas.🔽That which is the sameness of sameness is the sameness of samadhi.

original: gang dang ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa de dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyam pa nas /
analyzed: gang dang ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa de dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyam pa nas /
translated: That which is the sameness of samadhi is the sameness of the Tathagatas.

original: ji srid du khams gsum la yang brten pa med pa nyid kyi phyir nyams pa med cing yongs su nyams pa med pa ste /
analyzed: ji srid du khams gsum la yang brten pa med pa nyid kyi phyir nyams pa med cing yongs su nyams pa med pa ste /
translated: And as long as one does not rely on the three worlds, there is no degeneration or falling away.

original: des na ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: des na ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be said that their concentration is without degeneration.

original: shes rab mnyam pa nyid ni chos thams cad la gzhan gyi rkyen gyis rtogs pa ma yin pa'i ye shes dang / sems can pha rol rnams la chos rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i ye shes dang / so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa la mkhas pas rab tu dbye ba mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang /
analyzed: shes rab mnyam pa nyid ni chos thams cad la gzhan gyi rkyen gyis rtogs pa ma yin pa'i ye shes dang / sems can pha rol rnams la chos rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i ye shes dang / so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa la mkhas pas rab tu dbye ba mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang /
translated: The equality of wisdom is the wisdom that does not realize all phenomena through other conditions, the wisdom that illuminates the Dharma for other sentient beings, the wisdom that knows the divisions through skill in the inexhaustibility of the analytical knowledges,

original: tshig gcig rab tu 'jug pas bskal pa stong phrag brgyar lhag par gnas pa ston pa'i ye shes dang / ji ltar bris pa'i don gsungs pas the tshom gcod pa dang theg pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ston pa'i ye shes dang / sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong rnams mkhyen pa dang /🔽chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rnams ji ltar so sor 'os pa'i chos ston pa'i ye shes so zhes pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtha' yas pa /
analyzed: tshig gcig rab tu 'jug pas bskal pa stong phrag brgyar lhag par gnas pa ston pa'i ye shes dang / ji ltar bris pa'i don gsungs pas the tshom gcod pa dang theg pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ston pa'i ye shes dang / sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong rnams mkhyen pa dang / chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rnams ji ltar so sor 'os pa'i chos ston pa'i ye shes so zhes pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtha' yas pa /
translated: the wisdom that, by means of a single word, teaches for more than a thousand eons; the wisdom that, by teaching the meaning of what is written, cuts through doubts and teaches the presentation of the vehicles; and the wisdom that knows the eighty-four thousand mental behaviors of sentient beings and teaches the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma in accordance with each individual.🔽This is the wisdom that teaches the infinite,

original: mur thug pa med pa mi zad pa tshad med pa ston pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: mur thug pa med pa mi zad pa tshad med pa ston pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: the endless, the inexhaustible, and the immeasurable of the Thus-Gone One.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba ni chags pa dang 'dzin pa thams cad dang bral ba /🔽sngon gyi mtha' dang ma bcings pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par grol ba ni chags pa dang 'dzin pa thams cad dang bral ba / sngon gyi mtha' dang ma bcings pa /
translated: The liberation of the Thus-Gone One is free from all attachment and grasping.🔽It is not bound by the past.

original: phyi ma'i mthar mi 'pho ba /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mthar mi 'pho ba /
translated: It does not move into the future.

original: da ltar byung ba la mi gnas pa sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba de bzhin kho nar shes pa ste de'i phyir skad cig gcig dang yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs🔽par sangs rgyas so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la mi gnas pa sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba de bzhin kho nar shes pa ste de'i phyir skad cig gcig dang yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: “The present is not present. The mind is luminous by nature. It is known just as it is. Therefore, it should be said that in a single moment, through the perfection of wisdom, he fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: “All the activities of the body are preceded by wisdom and follow wisdom.🔽The Tathāgata, who is endowed with all the activities of the body, tames beings even by being seen.🔽Whether he speaks🔽or remains silent,🔽whether he is asked or not asked,

analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug ste /
translated: His seeing of pristine wisdom engages without attachment or obstruction in the present.

original: gang da ltar byung ba phyogs bcu rnams su sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams dang chos rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pa nas ji srid du rigs thams cad dang sa la sogs pa'i khams thams cad dang /

translated: He knows all the buddha fields, phenomena, bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas in the present in the ten directions, up to all the families, the elements of earth and so on,

analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi char bcas pa dang / ji srid du skra'i rtse @281a * //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gnyis kyi rjes su 'brang ba shes pa med de /

original: gnyis su med pa la 'jug pa'i ched du sems can rnams la chos ston par yang mdzad do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa la 'jug pa'i ched du sems can rnams la chos ston par yang mdzad do //
translated: but he also teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in order to make them understand nonduality.

original: 'o na gla te don dam par mtha' dag stong pa nyid kho na yin zhing /
analyzed: 'o na gla te don dam par mtha' dag stong pa nyid kho na yin zhing /
translated: If the ultimate is only the emptiness of all,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang de kho na nyid gzigs pa yin na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang de kho na nyid gzigs pa yin na /
translated: and the Bhagavān sees reality,

original: de ji ltar bcom ldan 'das phyi rol gyi don dang rnam par shes pa dag ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: de ji ltar bcom ldan 'das phyi rol gyi don dang rnam par shes pa dag ston par mdzad de /
translated: how does the Bhagavān teach external objects and consciousness?

original: de kho na nyid gzigs pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin pa ston par byed pa med la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid gzigs pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin pa ston par byed pa med la /
translated: One who sees reality does not teach what is not reality.

original: ston na yang ci ltar de kho na nyid mthong ba'o zhes rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ston na yang ci ltar de kho na nyid mthong ba'o zhes rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: Even if he taught, how could it be understood that he sees reality?

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: phyi rol gyi don dang rnam par rig pa dag sgrub pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das de ston pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don dang rnam par rig pa dag sgrub pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das de ston pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The Bhagavān does not teach that in order to establish external objects and representations.

original: 'on kyang rjes su brjod pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su brjod pa'i don du ste /
translated: But rather, he teaches in order to describe them.

original: phung po lnga po kho na dang rnam par shes pa tsam kho na yod kyi bdag ni med do zhes bdag bkag pa de rjes su brjod pas 'chad par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga po kho na dang rnam par shes pa tsam kho na yod kyi bdag ni med do zhes bdag bkag pa de rjes su brjod pas 'chad par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He wishes to explain that the self is refuted by the statement, “Only the five aggregates exist, only consciousness exists, the self does not exist.”

original: rjes su brjod pa yang ci ltar na stong pa nyid gzigs pa la yin te /
analyzed: rjes su brjod pa yang ci ltar na stong pa nyid gzigs pa la yin te /
translated: But how can one who sees emptiness have a view?

original: de so sor snang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de so sor snang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it does not appear to him individually.

original: ma yin te 'jig rten pa'i blo kho nas rjes su brjod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te 'jig rten pa'i blo kho nas rjes su brjod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is possible that he has a view through mundane cognition.

original: 'jig rten pa'i blo ni de lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i blo ni de lta bu ste /
translated: Mundane cognition is like that,

original: thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is habituated to beginningless ignorance.

original: 'o na gal te bcom ldan 'das la 'jig rten pa'i blo yin na ji ltar de kho na nyid gzigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te bcom ldan 'das la 'jig rten pa'i blo yin na ji ltar de kho na nyid gzigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if the Lord has a mundane cognition, how can he see reality?

original: ma yin te sngon gyi 'phen pas ston pa srid pa'i phyir te 'khor lo 'khor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ma yin te sngon gyi 'phen pas ston pa srid pa'i phyir te 'khor lo 'khor ba bzhin no //
translated: No, because it is possible that he teaches through previous impetus, like a revolving wheel.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa du mar ston pa ni 'jig rten gzhug pa'i ched du 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa du mar ston pa ni 'jig rten gzhug pa'i ched du 'gal ba med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in his teaching in many ways for the purpose of engaging the world.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ldem por dgongs pa rnam pa bzhis ston pa'o //🔽de la gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa ni nyan thos rnams la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: ldem por dgongs pa rnam pa bzhis ston pa'o // de la gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa ni nyan thos rnams la blta bar bya ste /
translated: The teacher is based on four kinds of indirect teachings.🔽Among them, the indirect teaching for the purpose of introducing disciples to the teaching should be understood in terms of the disciples of the Universal Vehicle, because the teaching of the existence of form, etc.

original: bstan pa la gzhug pa'i don du mi skrag pa'i ched du gzugs la sogs pa yod pa nyid du ston pa'i phyir ro //🔽mtshan nyid la ldem por dgongs pa ni don gzhan la dgongs pas na kun brtags la sogs pa ngo bo nyid gsum rnams la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: bstan pa la gzhug pa'i don du mi skrag pa'i ched du gzugs la sogs pa yod pa nyid du ston pa'i phyir ro // mtshan nyid la ldem por dgongs pa ni don gzhan la dgongs pas na kun brtags la sogs pa ngo bo nyid gsum rnams la blta bar bya ste /
translated: is for the purpose of introducing them to the teaching and for the purpose of not frightening them.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa la sogs par chos thams cad ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa la sogs par chos thams cad ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The indirect teaching for the purpose of characteristics should be understood in terms of the three natures, the imagined, etc., because all things are taught as natureless, unproduced, etc.

original: gnyen po la ldem por dgongs pa ni nyes pa rnams 'dul ba la blta @281b bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnyen po la ldem por dgongs pa ni nyes pa rnams 'dul ba la blta @281b bar bya ste /
translated: The indirect teaching for the purpose of antidotes should be understood in terms of the subduing of faults.

original: ji skad du sangs rgyas la brnyas pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad du sangs rgyas la brnyas pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni /
translated: For example, as an antidote to the obscuration that is contempt for the Buddha, it is taught:🔽“The Buddha is permanent because he is the support of the unconditioned.”

original: nga nyid de'i dus na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs pa der gyur to zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nga nyid de'i dus na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs pa der gyur to zhes pa'o //
translated: I myself was the perfect Buddha Vipaśyin at that time.

original: mnyam pa nyid la 'dir ldem por dgongs pa ste chos kyi sku khyad par med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la 'dir ldem por dgongs pa ste chos kyi sku khyad par med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, the intention is to be understood as equality, because the Dharma body is without distinction.

original: chos la brnyas pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos la brnyas pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni /
translated: The antidote to the obscuration of contempt for the Dharma is stated:

original: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas 'di snyed la bsnyen bkur byas nas theg pa chen po khong du chud par gyur to zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas 'di snyed la bsnyen bkur byas nas theg pa chen po khong du chud par gyur to zhes pa'o //
translated: Having served as many Buddhas as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river, one will understand the Great Vehicle.

original: le lo'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: le lo'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni /
translated: The antidote to the obscuration of laziness is stated:🔽Those who make aspirations to be in Sukhāvatī will be born there.

original: gang rnams bde ba can du smon lam byed par 'gyur ba de rnams der skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa dang sangs rgyas dri med zla 'od kyi mtshan gzung ba 'di tsam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gang rnams bde ba can du smon lam byed par 'gyur ba de rnams der skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa dang sangs rgyas dri med zla 'od kyi mtshan gzung ba 'di tsam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro🔽zhes pa ste /
translated: By merely holding the name of the Buddha Vimalacandraprabha, one will certainly attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: dus gzhan du zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan du zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The other time is the intention.

original: cung zad tsam gyis chog pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni 'ga' zhig la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba gang yin pa de nyid bsngags par mdzad la 'ga' zhig la smod pa ste /
analyzed: cung zad tsam gyis chog pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni 'ga' zhig la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba gang yin pa de nyid bsngags par mdzad la 'ga' zhig la smod pa ste /
translated: The antidote to being satisfied with just a little is taught in some places by praising generosity and so on, and in some places by disparaging it.

original: cung zad tsam gyis chog pa'i gang zag gi bsam pa la dgongs pas so //
analyzed: cung zad tsam gyis chog pa'i gang zag gi bsam pa la dgongs pas so //
translated: This is because it is intended for the inclination of individuals who are satisfied with just a little.

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'byor pa bsngags par mdzad pa'o //🔽nga rgyal la spyod pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni /🔽gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas 'ga' zhig gi phun sum tshogs pa lhag par bsngags par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'byor pa bsngags par mdzad pa'o // nga rgyal la spyod pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni / gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas 'ga' zhig gi phun sum tshogs pa lhag par bsngags par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the obscurations of those who engage in attachment is taught in some places by the Blessed One praising the wealth of the Buddha's realm.🔽The antidote to the obscurations of those who engage in pride is taught in some places by the Blessed One praising the excellence of some Buddhas.

original: 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni /
translated: The antidote to the obscurations of regret is taught in some places by the Blessed One praising the excellence of some Buddhas.

original: gang rnams sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod pa byed pa de rnams thams cad mtho ris su nye bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnams sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod pa byed pa de rnams thams cad mtho ris su nye bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Those who harm the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas will all go to heaven.🔽The antidote to the obscuration that separates the Bodhisattvas from the Great Vehicle is taught in the following passages:

original: re zhig tsam ma nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams theg pa chen po las 'byed pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni nyan thos chen po rnams sangs rgyas nyid du ston pa dang / theg pa gcig tu ston pa yang ngo //
analyzed: re zhig tsam ma nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams theg pa chen po las 'byed pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni nyan thos chen po rnams sangs rgyas nyid du ston pa dang / theg pa gcig tu ston pa yang ngo //
translated: The great disciples are shown to be Buddhas, and the One Vehicle is taught.

original: bsgyur ba la ldem por dgongs pa ni rjod byed zab pa nyid la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: bsgyur ba la ldem por dgongs pa ni rjod byed zab pa nyid la blta bar bya ste /
translated: The indirect intention regarding transformation should be understood in terms of the profundity of the expression.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example:

original: snying po med la snying por shes //
analyzed: snying po med la snying por shes //
translated: Those who know the insubstantial as substantial,

original: phyin ci log la shin tu gnas //
analyzed: phyin ci log la shin tu gnas //
translated: who are thoroughly involved in error,

original: nyon mongs kyis kyang rab nyon mongs //
analyzed: nyon mongs kyis kyang rab nyon mongs //
translated: and who are greatly afflicted by the afflictions

original: byang chub dam pa thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes pa @282a * //
analyzed: byang chub dam pa thob par 'gyur // zhes pa @282a * //
translated: will attain the highest enlightenment.

original: ste ; 'di ni 'dir ldem por dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: ste ; 'di ni 'dir ldem por dgongs pa ste /
translated: This is the indirect intention here.

original: snying po med pa rnam par g-yeng ba med pa la gang rnams kyi snying po'i blo can dang / rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang ba dang bdag tu 'dzin pa las bzlog pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log la shin tu gnas pa yongs su ma nyams pa dang /
analyzed: snying po med pa rnam par g-yeng ba med pa la gang rnams kyi snying po'i blo can dang / rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang ba dang bdag tu 'dzin pa las bzlog pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log la shin tu gnas pa yongs su ma nyams pa dang /
translated: The absence of essence is the absence of distraction. Those who have the idea of an essence are those who are very much attached to the perversions of permanence, happiness, purity, and self, which are the opposites of impermanence, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa ste dka' ba spyod pa'i rtsol ba'i ngal bas shin tu yongs su nyon mongs pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ste dka' ba spyod pa'i rtsol ba'i ngal bas shin tu yongs su nyon mongs pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: They are very much afflicted by the afflictions, because of the fatigue of striving in the difficult practices.

original: dbyangs kyi yan lag drug cu rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdor ji skad du gsungs pa rnams te /
analyzed: dbyangs kyi yan lag drug cu rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdor ji skad du gsungs pa rnams te /
translated: The sixty melodious qualities are as they are explained in the Tathāgataguhya Sūtra.

original: de la gsung gi gnyen po ni sems can gyi khams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gsung gi gnyen po ni sems can gyi khams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the remedy for speech is the teaching of the roots of virtue to the realm of sentient beings.

original: 'jam pa ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la bde ba la reg par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la bde ba la reg par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Smoothness is the quality of bringing about the experience of happiness in this very life.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni don bzang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni don bzang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Pleasantness is the quality of having a good meaning.

original: yid du 'thad pa ni yi ge bzang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'thad pa ni yi ge bzang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is pleasing because the words and syllables are excellent.

original: dag pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa bla na med pa'i rjes la thob pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dag pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa bla na med pa'i rjes la thob pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is pure because it is attained subsequent to the supramundane, unsurpassed path.

original: / dri ma med pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal dang bag chags thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: / dri ma med pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal dang bag chags thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is immaculate because it is free from all the latent impulses and instincts of the afflictions.

original: gsal ba ni tshig dang yi ge so sor grags pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ni tshig dang yi ge so sor grags pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is clear because the words and syllables are well known.

original: snyan cing 'jebs pa ni mu stegs can blo gros ngan pa can thams cad kyi lta ba 'joms pa'i stobs kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan cing 'jebs pa ni mu stegs can blo gros ngan pa can thams cad kyi lta ba 'joms pa'i stobs kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is melodious because it possesses the quality of strength that destroys the views of all non-Buddhists with evil understanding.

original: mnyan par 'os pa ni sgrub pas nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyan par 'os pa ni sgrub pas nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is worthy of being heard because it leads to liberation through practice.

original: mi tshugs pa ni pha rol gyi smra ba po thams cad kyis gcad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi tshugs pa ni pha rol gyi smra ba po thams cad kyis gcad par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is invincible because it cannot be refuted by any opponent.

original: snyan pa ni dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan pa ni dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is beautiful because it delights.

original: dul ba ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dul ba ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Discipline is the antidote to desire.

original: mi rtsub pa ni bslab pa bca' ba'i bde ba'i thabs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtsub pa ni bslab pa bca' ba'i bde ba'i thabs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Not harsh is the method of happiness in the precepts.

original: mi brlang ba ni de las 'das pa na yang dag par nges par 'byung ba nye bar ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brlang ba ni de las 'das pa na yang dag par nges par 'byung ba nye bar ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Not violent is the teaching of right liberation even when one transgresses those.

original: rab tu dul ba ni theg pa gsum gyis 'dul ba nye bar ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dul ba ni theg pa gsum gyis 'dul ba nye bar ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Well disciplined is the teaching of discipline by the three vehicles.

original: rna bar snyan pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rna bar snyan pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Pleasant to the ear is the antidote to distraction.

original: lus tshim par byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lus tshim par byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Satisfying to the body is the generation of samadhi.

original: sems tshim par byed pa ni lhag mthong gi rab tu dga' ba skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems tshim par byed pa ni lhag mthong gi rab tu dga' ba skyed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Satisfying to the mind is the generation of the joy of vipashyana.

original: snying dga' bar byed pa ni the tshom gcod par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snying dga' bar byed pa ni the tshom gcod par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Gladdening the heart is the cutting off of doubt.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba bskyed pa ni @282b log par nges pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba bskyed pa ni @282b log par nges pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Generating joy and bliss is the removal of wrong certainty.

original: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni sgrub pa po 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni sgrub pa po 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a source of remorse, because the practitioner has no regrets.

original: kun du shes par bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du shes par bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is to be fully understood, because it is the basis for the perfection of the knowledge that comes from listening.

original: rnam par rig par bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig par bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is to be cognized, because it is the basis for the perfection of the knowledge that comes from reflection.

original: rnam par gsal ba ni slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud med par chos ston pa'i phyir ro //🔽dga' bar bya ba ni rang gi don rjes su thob pa rnams dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gsal ba ni slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud med par chos ston pa'i phyir ro // dga' bar bya ba ni rang gi don rjes su thob pa rnams dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is to be clarified, because the teacher teaches the Dharma without holding anything back.🔽It is to be delighted in, because it delights those who have attained their own goals.

original: mngon par dga' bar 'os pa ni rang gi don rjes su thob pa rnams kyis spro bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar 'os pa ni rang gi don rjes su thob pa rnams kyis spro bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is to be rejoiced in, because it is the delight of those who have attained their own goals.

original: kun shes par bya bar gzhug tu 'os pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kun shes par bya bar gzhug tu 'os pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is to be fully known, because it is the teaching of the inconceivable Dharma.

original: rnam par rig par byar gzhug tu 'os pa ni bsam par bya ba'i chos yang dag par ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig par byar gzhug tu 'os pa ni bsam par bya ba'i chos yang dag par ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is worthy of being known because it teaches the Dharma that is to be contemplated.

original: rigs pa ni tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa ni tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable because it is not contrary to valid cognition.

original: 'brel pa ni ji ltar 'os par gdul bya la ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni ji ltar 'os par gdul bya la ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is coherent because it teaches disciples in a suitable manner.

original: zlos pa'i skyon med pa ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zlos pa'i skyon med pa ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without the fault of repetition because it is not fruitless.

original: seng ge'i sgra'i shugs ni mu stegs can gyi tshogs thams cad skrag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra'i shugs ni mu stegs can gyi tshogs thams cad skrag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has the force of a lion’s roar because it frightens the entire herd of tīrthikas.

original: glang po che'i sgra skad ni rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: glang po che'i sgra skad ni rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It has the voice of an elephant because it is vast.

original: 'brug gi sgra dbyangs ni zab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brug gi sgra dbyangs ni zab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It has the sound of thunder because it is deep.

original: klu'i dbang po'i sgra dbyangs ni gzung bar 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: klu'i dbang po'i sgra dbyangs ni gzung bar 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It has the voice of the lord of the nāgas because it is worthy of being grasped.

original: dri za'i glu dbyangs ni snyan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dri za'i glu dbyangs ni snyan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It has the melody of the gandharvas because it is pleasant.

original: ka la ping ka'i sgra dbyangs ni rno ba dang 'jebs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ka la ping ka'i sgra dbyangs ni rno ba dang 'jebs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has the voice of the kalaviṅka bird because it is sharp and sweet.

original: tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa ni thag ring por grags pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa ni thag ring por grags pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The sound of Brahma's voice is renowned far and wide.

original: shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su grags pa ni grub pa thams cad la bkra shis pa nyid kyis sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su grags pa ni grub pa thams cad la bkra shis pa nyid kyis sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The sound of a kalaviṅka bird is renowned as an auspicious sign for all accomplishments.

original: de la sgra bzung ba ni don rtogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sgra rtogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de la sgra bzung ba ni don rtogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sgra rtogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: Here, the sound is grasped in order to understand the meaning that is characterized by the expression of sound.

original: dbyangs bzung ba ni thag ring por de dang de'i brda rtogs par byed pa'i don no //
analyzed: dbyangs bzung ba ni thag ring por de dang de'i brda rtogs par byed pa'i don no //
translated: The voice is grasped in order to understand the meaning that is the expression of that and that symbol at a distance.

original: grags pa bzung ba ni de dang de'i dbyangs kyis brda rjes su ston pa rtogs par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: grags pa bzung ba ni de dang de'i dbyangs kyis brda rjes su ston pa rtogs par byed pa'i don to //
translated: Renown is grasped in order to understand the meaning that is the expression of that and that symbol by that and that voice.

original: lha'i dbang po'i dbyangs ltar snyan pa ni 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rda'i sgra ni bdud dang glags tshol ba thams cad las rgyal ba'i sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po'i dbyangs ltar snyan pa ni 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rda'i sgra ni bdud dang glags tshol ba thams cad las rgyal ba'i sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The voice is pleasant like the voice of the lord of the gods because it is not to be transgressed. The sound of a conch is renowned as the forerunner of victory over all demons and adversaries.

original: ma khengs pa ni bstod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med @283a * //🔽pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma khengs pa ni bstod pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med @283a * // pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not turned around, because it is not afflicted by praise.🔽It is not turned aside, because it is not afflicted by dispraise.

original: mi dma' ba ni smad pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ni lung ston pa thams cad la mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad la rjes su zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dma' ba ni smad pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro // sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ni lung ston pa thams cad la mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad la rjes su zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not low, because it is not afflicted by contempt.🔽It is not filled with pride, because it is not afflicted by praise.🔽It is not confused, because it is not afflicted by gain and honor.

original: sgra zur chag pa med pa ni dran pa nyams pas mi gsung ba'i phyir ro //🔽ma tshang ba med pa ni gdul bya'i bya ba rnams la dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽ma zhum pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra zur chag pa med pa ni dran pa nyams pas mi gsung ba'i phyir ro // ma tshang ba med pa ni gdul bya'i bya ba rnams la dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro // ma zhum pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not distracted, because it is not afflicted by loss and dishonor.🔽It is not attached, because it is not afflicted by pleasure.🔽It is not depressed, because it is not afflicted by suffering.🔽It is not frightened, because it is not afflicted by fear.🔽It is not timid, because it is not afflicted by lack of confidence.🔽It is not timid, because it is not afflicted by lack of confidence.

original: ma zhen pa ni 'jigs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma zhen pa ni 'jigs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not frightened, because it is not afflicted by fear.🔽It is not depressed, because it is not afflicted by suffering.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not attached, because it is not afflicted by pleasure.🔽It is not low, because it is not afflicted by contempt.🔽It is not filled with pride, because it is not afflicted by praise.🔽It is not confused, because it is not afflicted by gain and honor.🔽It is not distracted, because it is not afflicted by loss and dishonor.🔽It is not turned away, because it is not afflicted by dispraise.🔽It is not turned aside, because it is not afflicted by praise.🔽It is not turned around, because it is not afflicted by disharmony.🔽It is not turned off, because it is not afflicted by harmony.🔽It is not turned off, because it

original: khyab pa ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad mkhas pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad mkhas pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is pervasive because it is endowed with skill in all the branches of knowledge.

original: chub pa ni sems can rnams kyi de'i don thams cad phun sum tshogs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chub pa ni sems can rnams kyi de'i don thams cad phun sum tshogs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is complete because it accomplishes all the aims of beings.

original: rgyun chags pa ni rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa ni rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is continuous because it is uninterrupted.

original: 'brel ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs su nye bar gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs su nye bar gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is connected because it is present in various forms.

original: sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni sgra gcig las sgra'i rnam par rig pa du ma nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni sgra gcig las sgra'i rnam par rig pa du ma nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It satisfies all sounds because many sound-cognitions are present in one sound.

original: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa ni gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa ni gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It satisfies all faculties because many object-cognitions are present in one object.

original: ma smad pa ni dam bca' ba ji lta ba bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma smad pa ni dam bca' ba ji lta ba bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is irreproachable because it is in accord with its promise.

original: mi 'gyur ba ni dus la bab par rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni dus la bab par rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unchanging because it is applied at the proper time.

original: ma brtabs pa ni rtab rtab por mi gsung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma brtabs pa ni rtab rtab por mi gsung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not hurried because it does not speak hurriedly.

original: 'khor kun du grag pa ni ring ba dang nye ba'i 'khor du mtshungs par thos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor kun du grag pa ni ring ba dang nye ba'i 'khor du mtshungs par thos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is heard everywhere because it is heard equally in the retinue near and far.

original: rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten pa'i don thams cad dpe'i chos su bsgyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten pa'i don thams cad dpe'i chos su bsgyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes so //
translated: It is endowed with the best of all aspects because all mundane goals are transformed into the Dharma of examples.

original: de bzhin du yon tan gzhan rnams kyang mdo sna tshogs rnams su rgyas par bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan gzhan rnams kyang mdo sna tshogs rnams su rgyas par bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, other qualities are also taught extensively in various sūtras.

original: spyod pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis 'jug pa'i yon tan ni gdul bya ji lta bar bdag nyid kyi lus yang dag par phye ba kun du ston pas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis 'jug pa'i yon tan ni gdul bya ji lta bar bdag nyid kyi lus yang dag par phye ba kun du ston pas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The quality of engaging in various activities is engaging because it displays the correct differentiation of one's own body according to the trainees.

original: dge ba'i chos skye ba mkhyen pa'i yon tan ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skye ba mkhyen pa'i yon tan ni /
translated: The quality of knowing the arising of virtuous dharmas

original: dper na sor mo'i phreng ba la sogs pa rnams la bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na sor mo'i phreng ba la sogs pa rnams la bzhin te /
translated: is like for those with a rosary of fingers and so on.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul las 'das pa dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon phra mo yang rdo'i gseb tu son pa'i gser gyi sa bon bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul las 'das pa dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon phra mo yang rdo'i gseb tu son pa'i gser gyi sa bon bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he knows without error even the subtle seeds of the root of virtue that transcend the domain of sravakas and so on, like seeds of gold that have entered a stone.

original: ji ltar mos pa bzhin du ston pa'i yon tan ni @283b yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du rnam par rtog pa med par yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang dang / rang gi mos pa'i dbang las de bzhin gshegs pa gser gyi kha dog la sogs pa'i sku can du mthong ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mos pa bzhin du ston pa'i yon tan ni @283b yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du rnam par rtog pa med par yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang dang / rang gi mos pa'i dbang las de bzhin gshegs pa gser gyi kha dog la sogs pa'i sku can du mthong ba ste /
translated: The quality of teaching in accordance with disposition is that, like a wish fulfilling gem, the Tathagata is seen as having a body of golden color and so on, without conceptualization, but through the power of the Tathagata and the power of one's own disposition.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtog par mi mdzad pa rnam par rtog par mdzad ces pa la sogs pa mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtog par mi mdzad pa rnam par rtog par mdzad ces pa la sogs pa mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The Tathagata does not conceptualize, but it is as if he does, and so on, just as in the sutra.

original: tshad med pa'i rten gyis sems can 'dul ba la rab tu sbyor ba'i yon tan ni tshad med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rten rnams kyis sems can 'dul ba'i ched du rab tu sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa'i rten gyis sems can 'dul ba la rab tu sbyor ba'i yon tan ni tshad med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rten rnams kyis sems can 'dul ba'i ched du rab tu sbyor ba ste /
translated: The quality of applying to the discipline of beings by means of immeasurable supports is the application of the bodhisattvas who have immeasurable supports for the sake of disciplining beings.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang sems pa dang / sgom pa'i rim gyis ye shes kyi khyad par thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rjes su 'dzin pa dang yongs su gtang ba dag gis yongs su chad pa med par brgyud pas rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang sems pa dang / sgom pa'i rim gyis ye shes kyi khyad par thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rjes su 'dzin pa dang yongs su gtang ba dag gis yongs su chad pa med par brgyud pas rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is engaged in uninterruptedly through the lineage of acceptance and rejection by the bodhisattvas who have attained the distinctive pristine wisdom through the stages of listening to, reflecting on, and meditating on the excellent doctrine by the power of the Tathagata.

original: chos kyi sku dang pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam par rdzogs pa'i yon tan ni gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sku can sangs rgyas kyi sa la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mtshungs par rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam par rdzogs pa'i yon tan ni gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sku can sangs rgyas kyi sa la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mtshungs par rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The quality of the perfection of the Dharma body and the perfections is the nondifferentiation of the Dharma body and the perfections, because the perfections of giving and so on are equally perfected in the Buddha stage of the buddhas who have the nondifferentiated Dharma body.

original: 'dres pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji ltar mos pa bzhin yang dag par ston pa'i yon tan ni /
analyzed: 'dres pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji ltar mos pa bzhin yang dag par ston pa'i yon tan ni /
translated: The quality of displaying a buddha field that is not mixed, just as one wishes,

original: sems can gyi mos pa la ltos pas 'dres pa med cing ma 'dres par sangs rgyas kyi zhing gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi mos pa la ltos pas 'dres pa med cing ma 'dres par sangs rgyas kyi zhing gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is because, in dependence on the aspirations of sentient beings, one displays a buddha field of the nature of gold, etc., that is not mixed, that is unmixed.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum po rnams kyi yang yul yongs su chad pa med pa'i yon tan ni thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma spangs pa'i sangs rgyas sku gsum gyi bdag nyid rnams kyi sa rnams dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su thams cad du yul🔽yongs su gcad pa med pas mnyam pa nyid du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum po rnams kyi yang yul yongs su chad pa med pa'i yon tan ni thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma spangs pa'i sangs rgyas sku gsum gyi bdag nyid rnams kyi sa rnams dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su thams cad du yul🔽yongs su gcad pa med pas mnyam pa nyid du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The quality of the three buddha bodies having an unlimited domain is because, in all the stages of the three buddha bodies, which are free from beginning, middle, and end, and in all the buddha fields, there is no limitation of domain.🔽The quality of the three buddha bodies being equal is because they are equal in the three buddha bodies of enjoyment, transformation, and reality.

original: 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa 'khor ba'i bar du gnas pa las de'i rgyu mthun pa mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams gdul bya rnams
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa 'khor ba'i bar du gnas pa las de'i rgyu mthun pa mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams gdul bya rnams
translated: The quality of remaining close to benefit and happiness for all sentient beings until the end of cyclic existence is due to the fact that the extremely pure dharmadhatu remains until the end of cyclic existence and its natural outcome, the Dharma of the sutras and so on, remains for disciples

original: kyi dus ji lta ba bzhin phyi ma'i mthar dang de'i tshe nyid na yang so sor nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽mi zad pa nyid kyi yon tan ni chos kyi dbyings la rnam par bkod pa rnams nam mkha' bzhin du mthar thug pa @284a * //
analyzed: kyi dus ji lta ba bzhin phyi ma'i mthar dang de'i tshe nyid na yang so sor nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro // mi zad pa nyid kyi yon tan ni chos kyi dbyings la rnam par bkod pa rnams nam mkha' bzhin du mthar thug pa @284a * //
translated: at the appropriate time and also at the end of time.

original: med pa las 'khor ba ji srid par chos kyi dbyings las 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don bya ba rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir yon tan mi zad pa nyid do //
analyzed: med pa las 'khor ba ji srid par chos kyi dbyings las 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don bya ba rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu sbyor ba nyid kyi phyir yon tan mi zad pa nyid do //
translated: The quality of inexhaustibility is due to the fact that the arrays of the dharmadhatu are like space, without limit and from them, until the end of cyclic existence, the activity for the sake of all beings is uninterrupted, due to the dharmadhatu.

original: mdzes pa dang slar ma ldog pa dang ma lus pa rtogs pa'i yon tan te /
analyzed: mdzes pa dang slar ma ldog pa dang ma lus pa rtogs pa'i yon tan te /
translated: The qualities of beauty, nonreturn and complete realization.

original: 'dis kyang rim pa ji lta bar phyi rol pa dang slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams rnam par gcod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rim pa ji lta bar phyi rol pa dang slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams rnam par gcod par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that these three types of liberation are, respectively, the liberation of non Buddhists, the liberation of those still in training, and the liberation of those no longer in training.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis thob pa de nyid kyis na mdzes par rtogs pa yin la de bzhin du phyi rol pa rnams kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis thob pa de nyid kyis na mdzes par rtogs pa yin la de bzhin du phyi rol pa rnams kyi ma yin te /
translated: The liberation of the Buddha is the most beautiful of all, because it is obtained through the supramundane path.

original: mtshams dang bcas pa nyid kyis de'i thar pa ni thar pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams dang bcas pa nyid kyis de'i thar pa ni thar pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The liberation of non Buddhists is not beautiful, because their liberation is not true liberation, since it is limited.

original: ldog pa'o zhes brjod pa na skye ba dang skyon kun du 'byung ba ste /🔽de dag kyang slob pa rnams kyi yin la bcom ldan 'das ni mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'o zhes brjod pa na skye ba dang skyon kun du 'byung ba ste / de dag kyang slob pa rnams kyi yin la bcom ldan 'das ni mi slob pa'o //
translated: The liberation of those still in training is not beautiful, because it is subject to retrogressing, to the arising of the defilements, and to the arising of the bodily basis.🔽The liberation of those no longer in training is not beautiful, because it is subject to retrogressing and to the arising of the bodily basis.

original: lus pa ni nyon mongs pa med cing nad med la lus dang ngag dang yid las su mi rung ba'am lam 'chad pa la mi gsal ba'o //🔽de theg pa dman pa'i mi slob pa dgra bcom pa rnams la yang ji ltar srid pa bzhin yod la /
analyzed: lus pa ni nyon mongs pa med cing nad med la lus dang ngag dang yid las su mi rung ba'am lam 'chad pa la mi gsal ba'o //🔽de theg pa dman pa'i mi slob pa dgra bcom pa rnams la yang ji ltar srid pa bzhin yod la /
translated: The liberation of the Buddha is not subject to retrogressing, to the arising of the defilements, to the arising of the bodily basis, to the arising of the bodily basis that is not clear.🔽The liberation of the Buddha is the most powerful of all, because it is not subject to retrogressing, to the arising of the defilements, to the arising of the bodily basis, to the arising of the bodily basis that is not clear.🔽The liberation of the Buddha is the most excellent of all, because it is not subject to retrogressing, to the arising of the defilements, to the arising of the bodily basis, to the arising of the bodily basis that is not clear.

original: bcom ldan 'das la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la ni ma yin no //
translated: But this is not so for the Lord.

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa'i yon tan te /
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa'i yon tan te /
translated: The good qualities of being endowed with knowledge and conduct are

original: de la rig pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: de la rig pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the training in higher wisdom.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa ni zhabs so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa ni zhabs so //
translated: Higher morality and higher mind are conduct.

original: rigs pa sngon ma can de dag zhabs nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: rigs pa sngon ma can de dag zhabs nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: They are conduct because they are preceded by knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir rig pa mig dang 'dra bas bltas pas cig shos zhabs dang 'dra ba dag gis de ltar 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig pa mig dang 'dra bas bltas pas cig shos zhabs dang 'dra ba dag gis de ltar 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Lord, having seen with the eye of knowledge, goes by means of the other two which are like feet.

original: dbang phyug dang gzugs dang grags pa dang dpal dang ye shes dang brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan te /
analyzed: dbang phyug dang gzugs dang grags pa dang dpal dang ye shes dang brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa'i yon tan te /
translated: The good qualities of being endowed with mastery, form, fame, glory,

original: de la dbang phyug ni gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: de la dbang phyug ni gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa yin la /
translated: Mastery is not being under the control of others.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: That is the perfection of the Lord,

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has abandoned all obscurations together with their traces.

original: rnam pa thams cad du yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yang ngo //
translated: It is also characterized by the perfection of all virtues in every way.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa med pa ni bde ba chen po'i bdud rtsis mngon par bran zhing bla na med la sgrib pa med pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs phun sum tshogs pa rtogs par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa med pa ni bde ba chen po'i bdud rtsis mngon par bran zhing bla na med la sgrib pa med pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs phun sum tshogs pa rtogs par mdzad pas so //
translated: Because the Blessed One, being free from obscurations, has realized the body, speech, and mind that are endowed with the unsurpassed and unobstructed nectar of great bliss.

original: bcom ldan 'das mar gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mar gsungs pa /
translated: The Blessed One has said:

original: gang yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni bde ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: gang yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni bde ba'o zhes so //
translated: That which is perfect and complete enlightenment is bliss.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kho na bde ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kho na bde ba ste /
translated: Only perfect and complete enlightenment is bliss,

original: @284b sdug bsngal ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: @284b sdug bsngal ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the bliss of the complete pacification of all suffering.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:🔽The supreme, unshakable, and peaceful,

original: rab tu zhi ba mi g-yo mchog / dbang bsgyur mnyam dang mi mnyam pa //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba mi g-yo mchog / dbang bsgyur mnyam dang mi mnyam pa //
translated: the mastery, the equal and unequal,

original: rnam par mi rtog bde de'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog bde de'i phyir //
translated: the non-conceptual bliss - for that reason,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rtogs par byed //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rtogs par byed //
translated: the bodhisattva should realize it.

original: ces so // de nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la bcom ldan 'das ni btang snyoms kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no zhes 'dod pa ni mi 'thad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ces so // de nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la bcom ldan 'das ni btang snyoms kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no zhes 'dod pa ni mi 'thad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that it is not tenable for the Bhagavån to be the nature of the gnosis of equanimity in the system of the perfections.

original: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa ni bla na med pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad thams cad kyis rnam par gsal ba'i sku can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa ni bla na med pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad thams cad kyis rnam par gsal ba'i sku can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of form is the body that is fully evident with all the marks and signs of a great being.

original: grags pa phun sum tshogs pa ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sgra grag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa phun sum tshogs pa ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sgra grag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of fame is the proclamation of his fame in all directions.

original: phun sum tshogs pa gang gis na mang po rnams kyis bstan par bya ba de ni dpal te /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa gang gis na mang po rnams kyis bstan par bya ba de ni dpal te /
translated: The perfection of glory is the perfection by which he is to be taught by many.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs bla na med pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs bla na med pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: It is glory that has the nature of the unsurpassed accumulation of merit.

original: de phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'dod pa rnams kyis bstan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'dod pa rnams kyis bstan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of glory is the perfection by which he is to be taught by those who desire all the perfections, mundane and supramundane.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni shes bya thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du dag pa dang chags pa med pa dang thogs pa med pa'i ye shes can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni shes bya thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du dag pa dang chags pa med pa dang thogs pa med pa'i ye shes can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of pristine wisdom is the possession of pristine wisdom that is pure, nonattached, and unobstructed with respect to all objects of knowledge.

original: brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ni bla na med pa'i gsung phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ni bla na med pa'i gsung phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The perfection of diligence is the perfection of unexcelled speech.

original: lhun gyis grub pas chags pa med cing mi ldog la 'bad pa med par 'byung ba dang 'gro ba thams cad bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin tshim par byed pa dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag thams cad dang ldan pa dang / 'gro ba grol bar byed pa'i gsung ste /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pas chags pa med cing mi ldog la 'bad pa med par 'byung ba dang 'gro ba thams cad bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin tshim par byed pa dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag thams cad dang ldan pa dang / 'gro ba grol bar byed pa'i gsung ste /
translated: It is effortless, nonattached, unobstructed, and spontaneous speech, which satisfies all migrating beings according to their wishes, which is endowed with all the aspects of melodious speech, and which is the speech that liberates migrating beings.

original: gzhan gyi don rnam pa thams cad la longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku dag gis rtag tu mi ldog pa'i bya ba can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don rnam pa thams cad la longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku dag gis rtag tu mi ldog pa'i bya ba can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is because the enjoyment body and the emanation body always perform the activity of never turning away from all the aspects of the benefit of others.

original: ye shes zhabs kyis ni /
analyzed: ye shes zhabs kyis ni /
translated: Jñanapada states:

original: rang bzhin legs par rnam par gnas pa me long ye shes kyis thob pa'i phyir dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin legs par rnam par gnas pa me long ye shes kyis thob pa'i phyir dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with perfect mastery, because he has attained the mirror-wisdom, which is the perfect natural state.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus thob pa'i phyir gzugs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus thob pa'i phyir gzugs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with a perfect body, because he has attained a body whose nature is the wisdom of equality and whose essence is inconceivable.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas na cho 'phrul thams cad kyis shin tu phra ba'i mtha' yas pa'i gdul bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i phyir grags pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //🔽'jig rten gyi khams thams @285a * //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas na cho 'phrul thams cad kyis shin tu phra ba'i mtha' yas pa'i gdul bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i phyir grags pa phun sum tshogs pa'o // 'jig rten gyi khams thams @285a * //
translated: He is endowed with perfect fame, because he has discernment-wisdom and therefore removes the obscurations of all disciples through all his miracles, which are infinite in their subtlety.

original: cad du mos pa ji lta bar sems can thams cad kyi mtha' yas pa'i bsod nams dang bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs las mi zad pa'i rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi rten la sogs pa ston pas tshim par byed pa'i phyir dpal phun🔽sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: cad du mos pa ji lta bar sems can thams cad kyi mtha' yas pa'i bsod nams dang bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs las mi zad pa'i rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi rten la sogs pa ston pas tshim par byed pa'i phyir dpal phun🔽sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with perfect glory, because he satisfies all beings in all world-realms with whatever they desire, manifesting for them inexhaustible riches and so forth, through the blessing of the wisdom that accomplishes all that is to be done.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i chos dang ldan pa thams cad du ye shes la dbang nyid thob pa'i phyir ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i chos dang ldan pa thams cad du ye shes la dbang nyid thob pa'i phyir ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is replete with intuition because it has attained mastery over intuition in all its uncommon qualities.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i shin tu sems can gyi don la mchog tu sbyor ba na mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes rnam gzhag mdzad do ;
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i shin tu sems can gyi don la mchog tu sbyor ba na mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes rnam gzhag mdzad do ;
translated: It is replete with effort because it is supremely devoted to the benefit of sentient beings and has attained the sameness of supreme nirvana.

original: / de la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye ste /
analyzed: / de la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye ste /
translated: The Enjoyment Body is born in its own pure buddha-field,

original: nam mkha' gnas pa ji srid par bzhugs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' gnas pa ji srid par bzhugs so //
translated: and it remains as long as the world exists.

original: de ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it called a buddha-field?

original: de nyid der gtso bor 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid der gtso bor 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the principal source of that.

original: 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pas na 'jig rten te /
analyzed: 'jig cing rab tu 'jig pas na 'jig rten te /
translated: The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed.

original: skye dgu dang de'i snod do //
analyzed: skye dgu dang de'i snod do //
translated: It is the sentient beings and their container.

original: des na 'jig rten gyi khams ni rnam pa gnyis te sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten gyi khams ni rnam pa gnyis te sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: Thus, the world has two aspects: the world of sentient beings and the world of their physical environment.

original: de la snod kyi 'jig rten du sa gzhi lag mthil ltar mnyam pa khang bzangs skyed mos tshal dang 'bab stegs dang dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pas bskor ba'i sems can gyi gnas mchog tu 'bar ba gser dang dngul dang bee d'urya dang mu sa ra gar
analyzed: de la snod kyi 'jig rten du sa gzhi lag mthil ltar mnyam pa khang bzangs skyed mos tshal dang 'bab stegs dang dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pas bskor ba'i sems can gyi gnas mchog tu 'bar ba gser dang dngul dang bee d'urya dang mu sa ra gar
translated: The world of the physical environment is a supreme abode for sentient beings, consisting of a flat ground like the palm of the hand, surrounded by mansions, parks, cascades, wish fulfilling trees and so on, blazing with the seven precious substances such as gold, silver, vaiḍūrya, coral,

original: bha dang rdo'i snying po dang mu tig dmar po dang kar ke ta na ste /
analyzed: bha dang rdo'i snying po dang mu tig dmar po dang kar ke ta na ste /
translated: cat’s eye, ruby and emerald.

original: rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin dpag tu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du 'gro ba'i 'od zer chen po 'gyed pa /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin dpag tu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du 'gro ba'i 'od zer chen po 'gyed pa /
translated: It is a world system of immeasurable extent, radiating great light rays that travel to other world systems.

original: steng du yang nam mkha' dang rjes su mthun par snang ba'o //
analyzed: steng du yang nam mkha' dang rjes su mthun par snang ba'o //
translated: It appears in the sky above, in harmony with the sky.

original: der sems can gang su dag skyes pa de rnams thams cad kyang 'phags pa'i sa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: der sems can gang su dag skyes pa de rnams thams cad kyang 'phags pa'i sa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: All sentient beings born there are bodhisattvas who have attained the ārya grounds.

original: slar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub tu smin par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub tu smin par bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One will ripen them for Awakening.

original: sems can de rnams kyang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis ni khams drug pa can te /
analyzed: sems can de rnams kyang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin gyis ni khams drug pa can te /
translated: Those sentient beings are made of the six elements, earth, water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness.

original: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Monks, this person is made of six elements.”

original: de rnams kyi lus kyang mdzes pa dang ldan pa 'od kyi dkyil 'khor can te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi lus kyang mdzes pa dang ldan pa 'od kyi dkyil 'khor can te /
translated: Their bodies are beautiful, with halos of light.

original: sa gzhi dang rjes su mthun pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs can no //
analyzed: sa gzhi dang rjes su mthun pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs can no //
translated: They have colors and shapes that accord with the ground.

original: de na sems @285b can rnams kyi longs spyod la yongs su longs spyod pa yang lha'i 'jig rten thams cad las so sor khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: de na sems @285b can rnams kyi longs spyod la yongs su longs spyod pa yang lha'i 'jig rten thams cad las so sor khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: The enjoyment of the pleasures of sentient beings there is superior to that of all the worlds of the gods.

original: gang rnams kyi longs spyod ni mtha' gcig tu dge ba bde ba mtha' gcig tu kha na ma tho ba med pa mtha' gcig tu dbang bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi longs spyod ni mtha' gcig tu dge ba bde ba mtha' gcig tu kha na ma tho ba med pa mtha' gcig tu dbang bsgyur ba'o //
translated: Their pleasures are entirely virtuous, entirely blissful, entirely irreproachable, and entirely controlled.

original: 'di 'dra ba ni khams drug yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba ni khams drug yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: Such is the complete purity of the six elements.

original: mtha' yas pa nyid dang / mtshams dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / shin tu rol pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa nyid dang / mtshams dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / shin tu rol pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of their infinity, because they are without limit, and because they are extremely delightful.

original: der skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su song nas der sems can de rnams kyi mi dge ba bsags pa spang bar bya ba dang / de'i gnyen po dge ba sogs pa rnams rab tu mkhyen nas dge ba'i chos bskyed pa'i ched du chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: der skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su song nas der sems can de rnams kyi mi dge ba bsags pa spang bar bya ba dang / de'i gnyen po dge ba sogs pa rnams rab tu mkhyen nas dge ba'i chos bskyed pa'i ched du chos ston par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are born there go to infinite world systems and, knowing the nonvirtue that is accumulated and abandoned by those sentient beings and the virtue that is accumulated and abandoned by them, they teach the Dharma in order to generate the virtuous natures in them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang yon tan 'di rnams thams cad yod la mchog tu rnam par dag par son pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang yon tan 'di rnams thams cad yod la mchog tu rnam par dag par son pa ni ma yin no //
translated: All of these qualities are possessed by the bodhisattvas, but they have not yet attained the highest purity.

original: de ltar mtshams med pa'i yon tan gyi gter gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du mtha' yas pa'i rin po che'i rang bzhin gzhal med khang gi 'khor gyi nang na /
analyzed: de ltar mtshams med pa'i yon tan gyi gter gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du mtha' yas pa'i rin po che'i rang bzhin gzhal med khang gi 'khor gyi nang na /
translated: Thus, in the buddhaverse that is a treasure of the qualities of the immeasurables, in the midst of the retinue in the palace that is the nature of infinite jewels,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang dpe byad mchog tu 'bar bas sku rnam par gsal ba ni bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dang dpe byad mchog tu 'bar bas sku rnam par gsal ba ni bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //

original: de la gzugs tshad mar byed pa'i gang zag rnams kyi ngor dad pa mngon par 'phel ba'i ched du skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rnams rnam par gzhag gi 'di rnams kyi grangs 'di tsam du bya bar
analyzed: de la gzugs tshad mar byed pa'i gang zag rnams kyi ngor dad pa mngon par 'phel ba'i ched du skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rnams rnam par gzhag gi 'di rnams kyi grangs 'di tsam du bya bar
translated: The thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks of a great being are established for the purpose of increasing faith in the eyes of those persons who take form as the measure.

original: nus par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nus par bya ba ni ma yin no //

original: de la mtshan rnams ni phyag dang zhabs 'khor los mtshan pa nyid dang / rus sbal bzhin zhabs shin tu gnas pa nyid dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar dra bas 'brel ba nyid dang / phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de la mtshan rnams ni phyag dang zhabs 'khor los mtshan pa nyid dang / rus sbal bzhin zhabs shin tu gnas pa nyid dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar dra bas 'brel ba nyid dang / phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa nyid dang /
translated: The major marks are: hands and feet with webbed fingers and toes like the king of geese, hands and feet soft and youthful,

original: bdun mtho ba nyid dang / sor mo ring ba nyid dang / rting pa yangs pa nyid dang / sku che zhing drang ba nyid dang / zhabs 'bur mi mngon pa nyid dang / sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa nyid dang / byin pa ri dags ae ne ya lta bu dang /🔽dpung pa ring zhing mdzes pa nyid dang / mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa nyid dang / mdog gser 'dra ba nyid dang// @286a * //

translated: His seven parts are elevated, his fingers are long, his heels are broad, his body is large and straight, his ankles are not protruding, the hairs on his body point upward, his calves are like the eneya deer,🔽his shoulders are long and beautiful, his sexual organ is concealed in a sheath, and his complexion is like gold.
