analyzed: yongs su gab ba ni mnyam pa ste lte ba nas bzung nas sku smad dang sku stod tshad mnyam pa'o //
translated: The evenness is the equality of the lower and upper parts of the body, starting from the navel.

original: yang na 'dom ni nya gro dha ste sku bzhengs par gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag gnyis 'dom du byas pa na sku mtha' dag chu dang zhes dag mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dom ni nya gro dha ste sku bzhengs par gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag gnyis 'dom du byas pa na sku mtha' dag chu dang zhes dag mnyam pa'o //
translated: Or, the cubit is the nyagrodha, and when the Bhagavān stands with his two arms extended, his entire body is equal in height and width.

original: nya gro dha ni shing kha kha ta ste de dang 'dra bar chu dang zheng mnyam pa'o zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: nya gro dha ni shing kha kha ta ste de dang 'dra bar chu dang zheng mnyam pa'o zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that the nyagrodha is the wood of the khakkhata tree, and that the body is equal in height and width like that.

original: gtsug tor ni dbu dkris pa'i rnam par zlum zhing legs par yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor ni dbu dkris pa'i rnam par zlum zhing legs par yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The uṣṇīṣa is the topknot, round and well-formed.

original: ljags che ba nyid ni ring ba nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: ljags che ba nyid ni ring ba nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: His tongue is large because it is long.

original: snyan gyi bug pa'i bar dang dpral ba'i skra mtshams kyi mthar thug par ljags kyis reg pa'o //
analyzed: snyan gyi bug pa'i bar dang dpral ba'i skra mtshams kyi mthar thug par ljags kyis reg pa'o //
translated: It is long because it can cover his entire face up to the hairline.🔽His voice is like that of Brahma because it is like the sound of Brahma’s voice.🔽His eyes are like those of a bull because they are long and beautiful.🔽His head is large because it is large like a maṇḍala.

original: shin tu yang dag par rdzogs pa ma yin pa chos bcu gnyis kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba legs par 'brel pa dang 'gram pa'i mtha' zlum pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: shin tu yang dag par rdzogs pa ma yin pa chos bcu gnyis kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba legs par 'brel pa dang 'gram pa'i mtha' zlum pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: His head is like a maṇḍala because it is well-proportioned like the disk of the moon with twelve parts.

original: 'gram pa seng ge'i lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: 'gram pa seng ge'i lta bu nyid do //
translated: His cheeks are like those of a lion because they are well-rounded.

original: tshems bzhi bcu tshad ba ni gzhan rnams kyi bzhin du sum cu rtsa gnyis sam nyi shu rtsa brgya ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshems bzhi bcu tshad ba ni gzhan rnams kyi bzhin du sum cu rtsa gnyis sam nyi shu rtsa brgya ma yin pa'o //
translated: His teeth are forty because he has forty teeth, not thirty-two or twenty-eight like other people.

original: spyan ni zlum pa'i dbus snum zhing gnas pa dang nag po zlum po'i logs gnyis dkar ba dang / rdzi ma gnas pa'i go skabs snum la mthing gar 'dug pa dang / mtha' gnyis shing pi ppa la'i shun pa ltar dmar ba dang / rdzi ma dang spyan gyi bar gser gyi kha dog go zhes pa 'di lta bu dang ba lnga rnams dang ldan kyang spyan gyi dkyil 'khor gtso bo nyid kyi phyir spyan mthon mthing ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: spyan ni zlum pa'i dbus snum zhing gnas pa dang nag po zlum po'i logs gnyis dkar ba dang / rdzi ma gnas pa'i go skabs snum la mthing gar 'dug pa dang / mtha' gnyis shing pi ppa la'i shun pa ltar dmar ba dang / rdzi ma dang spyan gyi bar gser gyi kha dog go zhes pa 'di lta bu dang ba lnga rnams dang ldan kyang spyan gyi dkyil 'khor gtso bo nyid kyi phyir spyan mthon mthing ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: The eyes are round, with a shiny center, and black on the two sides of the round center. The eyelashes have a shiny, dark blue space between them. The two ends are red like the bark of a pippala tree. The space between the eyelashes and the eyes is golden. Although the eyes have these five qualities, they are called “deep blue eyes” because the circle of the eyes is the most important.

original: be'u gzhon nu'i bzhin du bla 'og shin tu snum zhing 'od dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ma 'dzings pa nyid kyi phyir spyan rdzi ma pa'i lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: be'u gzhon nu'i bzhin du bla 'og shin tu snum zhing 'od dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ma 'dzings pa nyid kyi phyir spyan rdzi ma pa'i lta bu nyid do //
translated: The eyelashes are like those of a young calf, very shiny and radiant above and below, and not matted, so they are like those of a young calf.

original: mtshan 'di rnams rjes su gsal par byed pa'am mtshan dang rjes su mthun par gsal bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: mtshan 'di rnams rjes su gsal par byed pa'am mtshan dang rjes su mthun par gsal bar byed pa'am /
translated: These marks are either illuminating or illuminating in accordance with the marks.

original: skyes bu chen por rab tu gsal bar byed ces pa'am /
analyzed: skyes bu chen por rab tu gsal bar byed ces pa'am /
translated: Or they are said to illuminate the great being.

original: rjes su mthun par mdzes par byed ces pa dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rnams te /🔽sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu nyid dang / sen mo snum pa nyid dang / sen mo @287b mtho ba nyid dang / sor mo zlum pa nyid dang / sor mo rgyas pa nyid dang / sor mo byin gyis phra ba nyid dang / rtsa mi mngon pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rjes su mthun par mdzes par byed ces pa dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rnams te / sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu nyid dang / sen mo snum pa nyid dang / sen mo @287b mtho ba nyid dang / sor mo zlum pa nyid dang / sor mo rgyas pa nyid dang / sor mo byin gyis phra ba nyid dang / rtsa mi mngon pa nyid dang /
translated: The eighty minor marks are described as “beautifying the body in a harmonious way.”🔽They are as follows: nails that are the color of copper, glossy nails, prominent nails, rounded fingers, full fingers, tapered fingers, invisible veins,

original: rtsam dud pa med pa nyid dang / long bu mi mngon pa nyid dang / zhabs mi mnyam pa med pa nyid dang / seng ge'i stabs su gshegs pa nyid dang / glang po che'i stabs su gshegs pa nyid dang / ngang pa'i stabs su gshegs pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rtsam dud pa med pa nyid dang / long bu mi mngon pa nyid dang / zhabs mi mnyam pa med pa nyid dang / seng ge'i stabs su gshegs pa nyid dang / glang po che'i stabs su gshegs pa nyid dang / ngang pa'i stabs su gshegs pa nyid dang /
translated: invisible ankles, even feet, a gait like that of a lion, a gait like that of an elephant, a gait like that of a swan,

original: khyu mchog gi stabs su gshegs pa nyid dang / g-yas phyogs su bskor bas gshegs pa nyid dang / mdzes par gshegs pa nyid dang / mi g-yo bar gshegs pa nyid dang / sku 'khril bag chags pa nyid dang / sku byi dor byas pa lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: khyu mchog gi stabs su gshegs pa nyid dang / g-yas phyogs su bskor bas gshegs pa nyid dang / mdzes par gshegs pa nyid dang / mi g-yo bar gshegs pa nyid dang / sku 'khril bag chags pa nyid dang / sku byi dor byas pa lta bu nyid do //
translated: he walks with an unwavering gait,🔽his body is well-proportioned,🔽his body is well-rounded,🔽his body is well-shaped,🔽his body is well-purified,

original: sku rim par 'tsham pa nyid dang sku gtsang ba nyid dang / sku 'jam pa nyid dang / sku rnam par dag pa nyid dang / mtshan yongs su rdzogs pa nyid dang / sku kho lag yangs shing bzang ba nyid dang / gom pa snyoms pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sku rim par 'tsham pa nyid dang sku gtsang ba nyid dang / sku 'jam pa nyid dang / sku rnam par dag pa nyid dang / mtshan yongs su rdzogs pa nyid dang / sku kho lag yangs shing bzang ba nyid dang / gom pa snyoms pa nyid dang /
translated: his body is well-ornamented,🔽his body is well-polished,🔽his body is well-arranged,🔽his body is well-cleansed,🔽his body is well-smooth,🔽his body is well-purified,🔽his major marks are complete,🔽his body is well-proportioned,🔽his stride is even,🔽his eyes are pure,🔽his body is very youthful,🔽his body is not stooped,🔽his body is well-developed,🔽his body is very firm,🔽his major and minor body parts are very distinct,🔽his body is very straight,🔽his body is very well-proportioned,🔽his body is very well-rounded,🔽his body is very well-shaped,🔽his body is very well-purified,🔽his body is very well-ornamented,🔽his body is very well-polished,🔽his body is very well-arranged,🔽his body is very well-cleansed,🔽his body is very well-smooth,🔽his body is very well-purified,🔽his major marks are complete,🔽his body is well-proportioned,🔽his stride is even,🔽his eyes are pure,🔽his body is very youthful,🔽his body is not stooped,🔽his body is well-developed,🔽his body is very firm,

original: spyan rnam par dag pa nyid dang / sku shin tu gzhon sha can nyid dang / sku zhum pa med pa nyid dang / sku rgyas pa nyi dang / sku shin tu grims pa nyid dang / yan lag dang nyid lag shin tu rnam par 'byes pa nyid dang /
analyzed: spyan rnam par dag pa nyid dang / sku shin tu gzhon sha can nyid dang / sku zhum pa med pa nyid dang / sku rgyas pa nyi dang / sku shin tu grims pa nyid dang / yan lag dang nyid lag shin tu rnam par 'byes pa nyid dang /
translated: his major and minor body parts are very distinct,

original: gzegs pa rab rib med cing dag pa nyid dang / dku zlum pa nyid dang / dku skabs phyin pa nyid dang / dku ma rnyongs pa nyid dang / phyal phyang nge ba nyid dang / lta ba zab pa nyid dang / lte ba g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba nyid dang /🔽kun nas mdzes pa nyid dang / kun du spyod pa gtsang ba nyid dang / sku la sme ba dang gnag bag med pa nyid dang / phyag mthil shing bal ltar shin tu 'jam pa nyid dang / phyag gi ri mo mdangs yod pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gzegs pa rab rib med cing dag pa nyid dang / dku zlum pa nyid dang / dku skabs phyin pa nyid dang / dku ma rnyongs pa nyid dang / phyal phyang nge ba nyid dang / lta ba zab pa nyid dang / lte ba g-yas phyogs su 'khyil ba nyid dang / kun nas mdzes pa nyid dang / kun du spyod pa gtsang ba nyid dang / sku la sme ba dang gnag bag med pa nyid dang / phyag mthil shing bal ltar shin tu 'jam pa nyid dang / phyag gi ri mo mdangs yod pa nyid dang /
translated: His sides are even, his waist is rounded, his waist is well-proportioned, his waist is not sunken, his belly is not pendulous, his belly is deep, his navel is deep, his navel is coiled to the right,🔽he is beautiful from all sides, his conduct is pure, his body is free of moles and discoloration, the palms of his hands are as soft as cotton, the lines on his palms are clear,

original: phyag gi ri mo zab pa nyid dang / phyag gi ri mo ring ba nyid dang / zhal ha cang mi ring ba nyid dang / shin tu dang zhing 'od 'bar ba nyid las zhal la gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyag gi ri mo zab pa nyid dang / phyag gi ri mo ring ba nyid dang / zhal ha cang mi ring ba nyid dang / shin tu dang zhing 'od 'bar ba nyid las zhal la gzugs brnyan 'char ba'i phyir /
translated: the lines on his palms are deep, the lines on his palms are long, his face is not too long, and his face is very clear and radiant, because images appear on his face.

original: zhal la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba nyid dang / ljags mnyen pa nyid dang / ljags srab pa nyid dang / ljags dmar ba nyid dang / glang po che'i nga ro dang 'brug gi sgra dang ldan pa nyid dang / gsung snyan zhing mnyen la 'jam pa nyid dang /🔽mche bzlum pa nyid dang / mche ba rno ba nyid dang / mche ba dkar ba nyid dang / mche ba @288a * //
analyzed: zhal la gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba nyid dang / ljags mnyen pa nyid dang / ljags srab pa nyid dang / ljags dmar ba nyid dang / glang po che'i nga ro dang 'brug gi sgra dang ldan pa nyid dang / gsung snyan zhing mnyen la 'jam pa nyid dang / mche bzlum pa nyid dang / mche ba rno ba nyid dang / mche ba dkar ba nyid dang / mche ba @288a * //
translated: The reflection of forms appears on his face, his tongue is supple, slender, and red, he has the voice of an elephant and the sound of a dragon, and his speech is melodious, gentle, and soft.🔽His canine teeth are round, sharp, white,

original: mnyam pa nyid dang / mche ba byin gyis phra ba nyid dang / shangs mtho ba nyid dang / shangs gtsang ba nyid dang / spyan yangs pa nyid dang // rdzi ma stugs pa nyid dang / spyan dkar nag 'byes shing padma'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu nyid dang /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid dang / mche ba byin gyis phra ba nyid dang / shangs mtho ba nyid dang / shangs gtsang ba nyid dang / spyan yangs pa nyid dang // rdzi ma stugs pa nyid dang / spyan dkar nag 'byes shing padma'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu nyid dang /
translated: even, and tapered, his nose is prominent, his eyes are large, his eyelashes are thick, and his eyes are like the petals of a fully opened lotus.

original: smin tshugs ring ba nyid dang / smin ma 'jam pa nyid dang ; smin ma snum pa nyid dang / smin ma'i spu mnyam pa nyid dang / phyag ring zhing rgyas pa nyid dang / snyan mnyam pa nyid dang / snyan ma nyams pa nyid dang /🔽dpral ba legs par 'byes pa nyid dang / dpral ba dbyes che ba nyid dang / dbu rgyas pa nyid dang / dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag pa nyid dang ; dbu skra stug pa nyid dang / dbu skra 'jam pa nyid dang / dbu skra ma 'dzings pa nyid dang /
analyzed: smin tshugs ring ba nyid dang / smin ma 'jam pa nyid dang ; smin ma snum pa nyid dang / smin ma'i spu mnyam pa nyid dang / phyag ring zhing rgyas pa nyid dang / snyan mnyam pa nyid dang / snyan ma nyams pa nyid dang / dpral ba legs par 'byes pa nyid dang / dpral ba dbyes che ba nyid dang / dbu rgyas pa nyid dang / dbu skra bung ba ltar gnag pa nyid dang ; dbu skra stug pa nyid dang / dbu skra 'jam pa nyid dang / dbu skra ma 'dzings pa nyid dang /
translated: His eyebrows are long, smooth, and glossy. His eyebrows are evenly spaced. His hands and feet are long and broad. His ears are even. His ears are undamaged.🔽His forehead is well-shaped. His forehead is broad. His head is large. His hair is as black as a bee. His hair is thick. His hair is smooth. His hair is not matted.

original: dbu skra mi bshor pa nyid dang / dbu skra dri zhim pa nyid dang / dpal gyi be'u dang bkra shis dang g-yung drung 'khyil pas thugs kha dang phyag dang / zhabs brgyan pa nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: dbu skra mi bshor pa nyid dang / dbu skra dri zhim pa nyid dang / dpal gyi be'u dang bkra shis dang g-yung drung 'khyil pas thugs kha dang phyag dang / zhabs brgyan pa nyid ces pa'o //
translated: His hair is not disheveled. His hair has a pleasant smell. His chest, hands, and feet are adorned with srivatsa, swastika, and spiral designs.

original: thugs kar yang dpal be'u la sogs pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: thugs kar yang dpal be'u la sogs pa 'byung ba ste /
translated: The srivatsa and so forth also appear on his chest.

original: thugs ka na gnas pa'i dpal be 'u la sogs pa rnams las 'od zer rnams 'byung ngo zhes pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs ka na gnas pa'i dpal be 'u la sogs pa rnams las 'od zer rnams 'byung ngo zhes pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Light rays emerge from the glorious vase-shaped-life at the heart and so on.

original: mdo gzhan du phyag dang zhabs la sdod ris dang bum pa gang ba dang nya dang gnya' shing dang rgyal mtshan dang / dung dang khri bzang po dang gdugs dkar po dang / rnga yab la sogs pa rnams kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo gzhan du phyag dang zhabs la sdod ris dang bum pa gang ba dang nya dang gnya' shing dang rgyal mtshan dang / dung dang khri bzang po dang gdugs dkar po dang / rnga yab la sogs pa rnams kyang gsungs so //
translated: Other sūtras mention wheels, vases, fish, ox-goad, victory banner, conch, excellent throne, white parasol, yak-tail fan, and so on on his hands and feet.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad 'di rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang 'khor los sgyur ba rnams la yang 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad 'di rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang 'khor los sgyur ba rnams la yang 'byung ste /
translated: These signs and features also appear on great bodhisattvas and cakravartins.

original: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yul na gnas pa dang / gsal ba dang rdzogs pa nyid rnams kyis bla na med par phul du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yul na gnas pa dang / gsal ba dang rdzogs pa nyid rnams kyis bla na med par phul du 'byung ba'o //
translated: However, they are unsurpassed and supreme in the tathāgatas because they abide in their domain, are clear, and are complete.

original: phal cher ni 'di rnams bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: phal cher ni 'di rnams bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: Most of these are the enjoyment body of the Bhagavat.

original: gzugs kyi sku gang la gnas nas de de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku mngon du mdzad pa'i sku de bsam gyis mi bya ba cing sna tshogs gzugs can te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku gang la gnas nas de de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku mngon du mdzad pa'i sku de bsam gyis mi bya ba cing sna tshogs gzugs can te /
translated: The body in which the Tathāgata actualizes the Dharma Body, that inconceivable body, is of various forms.

original: gzugs can de dang des byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i rgyu nyid kyis yongs su 'gyur bar mdzad do //
analyzed: gzugs can de dang des byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i rgyu nyid kyis yongs su 'gyur bar mdzad do //
translated: By means of that form, he causes the bodhisattvas to fully enjoy the Dharma, and thus he transforms them.

original: de @288b las sgra gang byung ba de las 'jig rten yang rnam pa de lta bu'i chos bstan pa'i snod du 'gyur zhing phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de @288b las sgra gang byung ba de las 'jig rten yang rnam pa de lta bu'i chos bstan pa'i snod du 'gyur zhing phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: From that body, whatever sound arises, from that the world becomes a vessel for the teaching of the Dharma in that way, and they realize the nonerroneous reality.

original: gang gi phyir 'dis sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pas smon lam bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dis sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pas smon lam bskyed pa ste /
translated: Because he, when previously a bodhisattva, made this aspiration:

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'di rnams dus 'dir 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog par yid bzhin nor bu dang dpag bsam gyi shing dang 'dra bar ji ltar rjes su mthun par sems can gyi don sgrub pa rdzogs par mdzad mod kyang skad cig kyang chos kyi
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'di rnams dus 'dir 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog par yid bzhin nor bu dang dpag bsam gyi shing dang 'dra bar ji ltar rjes su mthun par sems can gyi don sgrub pa rdzogs par mdzad mod kyang skad cig kyang chos kyi
translated: Just as the bhagavān buddhas of the past, without any concepts, accomplished the perfect benefit of sentient beings in accordance with their dispositions, like wish-fulfilling gems and wish-granting trees, so too do the buddhas of the present.🔽

original: dbyings las mi g-yo ba dang / sems can gdul ba'i dus las mi 'da' ba de bzhin du bdag kyang 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbyings las mi g-yo ba dang / sems can gdul ba'i dus las mi 'da' ba de bzhin du bdag kyang 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the blessed buddhas, without any discursive thought, accomplish the welfare of beings in the present moment, like wish-fulfilling gems and wish-granting trees, and yet, without wavering from the dharmadhatu for even a moment, never miss the right time to tame beings, in the same way, may I also become like that.

original: nam mkha' ji srid pa dang sems can ji srid pa dang ji srid du nyon mongs pa dang / las rnams rab tu gdags pa de srid du bdag srog chags gcig gi yang bya ba la /
analyzed: nam mkha' ji srid pa dang sems can ji srid pa dang ji srid du nyon mongs pa dang / las rnams rab tu gdags pa de srid du bdag srog chags gcig gi yang bya ba la /
translated: For as long as space remains, for as long as sentient beings remain, and for as long as the imprints of afflictions and karma are imputed, for that long, with regard to the welfare of even a single sentient being,

original: sangs rgyas kyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs kyang /
translated: may I accomplish the activities of the buddhas.

original: gnas bar bya zhing pan ba rnams bya'o zhes pa 'di'i smon lam gyi 'phen pa'i dbang las dang / gdul bya rnams kyi yang rnam pa de lta bu'i chos nyan pa 'jug pa'i las yongs su smin pa las /
analyzed: gnas bar bya zhing pan ba rnams bya'o zhes pa 'di'i smon lam gyi 'phen pa'i dbang las dang / gdul bya rnams kyi yang rnam pa de lta bu'i chos nyan pa 'jug pa'i las yongs su smin pa las /
translated: The Buddha's thought is, I will stay and help those who can be helped.🔽 This is the power of the Buddha's aspiration prayers.🔽🔽The disciples' thought is, I will listen to the Dharma in this way.🔽

original: de 'dra ba'i bya ba'i khyad par rnams rab tu gdags te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bya ba'i khyad par rnams rab tu gdags te /
translated: The special activities of the Buddha are designated from the power of the impetus of the aspiration prayer, “May I remain and do what is to be done,” and from the complete maturation of the activity of engaging in listening to the Dharma of that kind by those to be trained.

original: gang la rnam par rtog pa med par gyur kyang mtha' med pa'i dus su nam mkha' ji srid par ji ltar gdul bya dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba 'jug pas mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi don mdzad do //
analyzed: gang la rnam par rtog pa med par gyur kyang mtha' med pa'i dus su nam mkha' ji srid par ji ltar gdul bya dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba 'jug pas mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi don mdzad do //
translated: Even though he is free of conceptualization, he acts for the sake of the infinite realm of sentient beings by engaging in activities that are in accord with those to be trained for as long as space endures.

original: sku 'di yang sa bcu'i dbang phyug kho na'i byang chub sems dpa' rang gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs nye bar bsags pas dri ma med pa'i shes rab kyi me long can rnams la so sor snang gi sa 'og ma rnams la ma yin no //
analyzed: sku 'di yang sa bcu'i dbang phyug kho na'i byang chub sems dpa' rang gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs nye bar bsags pas dri ma med pa'i shes rab kyi me long can rnams la so sor snang gi sa 'og ma rnams la ma yin no //
translated: This body is perceived by bodhisattvas who are lords of the tenth level, who have accumulated the collections of merit and wisdom, and who have the mirror of stainless wisdom, but not by those on lower levels.

original: sems can 'dul ba'i rgyu mthun du ji skad brjod pa'i sku las /
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba'i rgyu mthun du ji skad brjod pa'i sku las /
translated: The emanation body is the natural outcome of the cause of training sentient beings.

original: gzhan rgyu mtshan pa'i sku 'jug pa rnams ni chos kyi sku'i mthu las yang dag par byung ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan rgyu mtshan pa'i sku 'jug pa rnams ni chos kyi sku'i mthu las yang dag par byung ba'am /
translated: The other bodies that are the cause of taming sentient beings, which are mentioned in the above verse, are produced from the power of the dharmakāya or

original: gzugs kyi sku'i ma thu las yang dag par byung ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku'i ma thu las yang dag par byung ba yang rung ste /
translated: are produced from the power of the rūpakāya.

original: de rnams kyi yang mthu phul du byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab po //🔽de ltar ni gang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gnas skabs las gang sngon thog ma med pa dang @289a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang mthu phul du byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab po // de ltar ni gang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gnas skabs las gang sngon thog ma med pa dang @289a * //
translated: The power of those is also inconceivable.🔽Thus, from the state of omniscient wisdom, all the various limits of conduct of one’s own birth states in saṃsāra, which is possessed from beginningless time,

original: ldan pa'i 'khor bar rang gi skye ba'i gnas skabs 'gag pa spyod pa'i mtha' sna tshogs pa du ma de rnams gsal ba ste /
analyzed: ldan pa'i 'khor bar rang gi skye ba'i gnas skabs 'gag pa spyod pa'i mtha' sna tshogs pa du ma de rnams gsal ba ste /
translated: are clarified.

original: lus pa med pa'i spyod pa'i mtha' bstan pa las phan tshun 'dres pa med pa de rnams thams cad shin tu yongs su dag pa'i me long gi dkyil 'khor la gdong gi gzugs brnyan bzhin du cig car nyid du rgyu mthun pa'i sku gcig kho na la /
analyzed: lus pa med pa'i spyod pa'i mtha' bstan pa las phan tshun 'dres pa med pa de rnams thams cad shin tu yongs su dag pa'i me long gi dkyil 'khor la gdong gi gzugs brnyan bzhin du cig car nyid du rgyu mthun pa'i sku gcig kho na la /
translated: In the teaching on the conduct of the bodhisattvas, which is without exception, all these are shown simultaneously, without mutual confusion, in a single body that is the natural outflow of the bodhisattvas' own mind, just like the reflections of faces in a very pure mirror.

original: 'bad pa med pa kho nar kun nas ston par byed do //🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sngon spyad pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'bad pa med pa kho nar kun nas ston par byed do // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa sngon spyad pa rnams te /
translated: They are shown without any effort.🔽The bodhisattvas who have previously practiced the perfection of generosity

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang bsnyen bkur byas pa rnams /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang bsnyen bkur byas pa rnams /
translated: are the bodhisattvas who have served the bhagavat buddhas.

original: gang 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bee d'u rya dang / padma r'a ga dang / aindra n'i la dang / shel la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rin po che'i ljon shing la sogs pas mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: gang 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bee d'u rya dang / padma r'a ga dang / aindra n'i la dang / shel la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rin po che'i ljon shing la sogs pas mdzes par byas pa /
translated: The buddha realms that they will attain are beautified by trees of the seven precious substances such as beryl, ruby, sapphire, crystal and so on.

original: zhe dang chu dang zlum skor la sogs pa rnams dang bcas pa de la brten pa'i sems can rnams kyi khyad par gyis nye bar mdzes par /
analyzed: zhe dang chu dang zlum skor la sogs pa rnams dang bcas pa de la brten pa'i sems can rnams kyi khyad par gyis nye bar mdzes par /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas, together with their retinues of śrāvakas and bodhisattvas, and with their abodes, the fields, and so forth, are all displayed in a single body.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bltams pa la sogs pa ston par bshad pa de ma lus pa sku gcig la ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bltams pa la sogs pa ston par bshad pa de ma lus pa sku gcig la ston par mdzad do //
translated: The Buddhas display all of this without exception in a single body.

original: sangs rgyas de rnams kyi yang sku dang spyod pa dag gi mthu phul du byung ba dang / ji snyed du de rnams kyi dge 'dun 'dus par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de rnams kyi yang sku dang spyod pa dag gi mthu phul du byung ba dang / ji snyed du de rnams kyi dge 'dun 'dus par gyur pa'am /
translated: The power of the bodies and deeds of those Buddhas, the extent of the assemblies of their saṅghas,

original: chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i rnam pa gang gis nyan thos dang bcas pa'i dge 'dun du gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas de rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gang 'dra ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams mtshan dang dpe byad kyis rnam par bkra ba'i sku can dbyibs dang ldan pa zhal zas dang chos gos dang gnas la sogs pa yongs su spyod pa dang ldan pa
analyzed: chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i rnam pa gang gis nyan thos dang bcas pa'i dge 'dun du gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas de rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gang 'dra ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams mtshan dang dpe byad kyis rnam par bkra ba'i sku can dbyibs dang ldan pa zhal zas dang chos gos dang gnas la sogs pa yongs su spyod pa dang ldan pa
translated: The aspects of practicing the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma by which they become the Sangha together with the Shravakas,🔽the bodhisattvas who appear in the buddhafields of those buddhas with bodies adorned with the major and minor marks, with the right shape, with the right enjoyment of food, Dharma robes, dwellings and so on,🔽the teachings of the Dharma they give based on the one vehicle or three vehicles,

original: rnams byung ba dang / theg pa gcig dang theg pa gsum la brten pa'i pa'i chos nye bar bstan pa gang 'dra ba dang / bdag nyid bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs su rab tu skyes pa gang 'dra ba dang / gzugs dang blo dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: rnams byung ba dang / theg pa gcig dang theg pa gsum la brten pa'i pa'i chos nye bar bstan pa gang 'dra ba dang / bdag nyid bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs su rab tu skyes pa gang 'dra ba dang / gzugs dang blo dang ldan pa dang /
translated: the kind of high caste in which they are born such as the brahmin caste, their physical beauty, their intelligence,

original: khyim pa dang rab tu byung bar gyur pa dang / chos mnyan nas spyod pa gang la spyod pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i bslab pa khas blangs pa dang / @289b sangs rgyas de rnams dang nyan thos dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rnams la bza' ba la sogs pa dang chos gos dang /
analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung bar gyur pa dang / chos mnyan nas spyod pa gang la spyod pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i bslab pa khas blangs pa dang / @289b sangs rgyas de rnams dang nyan thos dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rnams la bza' ba la sogs pa dang chos gos dang /
translated: precious ornaments and so on that he offered to those buddhas and their śrāvaka and bodhisattva saṅghas for as long as they lived and in whatever quantity.🔽Just as he demonstrated the limits of the way of engaging in the perfection of generosity in that way, he also demonstrated the limits of the way of engaging in the perfections of ethical discipline,

original: rin po che'i rgyan la sogs pa dus ji srid du tshad gang phul ba dang / ji ltar yang 'di sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i spyod tshul gyi mtha' ston pa de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang /
analyzed: rin po che'i rgyan la sogs pa dus ji srid du tshad gang phul ba dang / ji ltar yang 'di sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i spyod tshul gyi mtha' ston pa de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang /
translated: patience, diligence,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la spyod pa yang gang sngon gyi gnas skabs ma tshang ba med pa de rnams ma lus par sku gcig la ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la spyod pa yang gang sngon gyi gnas skabs ma tshang ba med pa de rnams ma lus par sku gcig la ston par mdzad do //
translated: meditative absorption and wisdom in that very same body.

original: de lta bu lta zhog / gzhan yang ba spu'i khung bu ra  yang bdag nyid kyi spyod pa thams cad gsal bar ston par mdzad do //🔽gzhan yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas bzung nas ji srid byang chub snying po'i bar gyi spyod pa gang rnams dang ; dus gsum gyi byang chub sems dpa' dang /
analyzed: de lta bu lta zhog / gzhan yang ba spu'i khung bu ra  yang bdag nyid kyi spyod pa thams cad gsal bar ston par mdzad do // gzhan yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas bzung nas ji srid byang chub snying po'i bar gyi spyod pa gang rnams dang ; dus gsum gyi byang chub sems dpa' dang /
translated: To say nothing of that, he also displays in a single pore of his body all his own activities.🔽Moreover, he displays in a single pore of his body all the activities of the Buddhas of the past, present, and future, beginning with their first production of the thought of enlightenment and continuing to the point where they sit on the seat of enlightenment.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams dang / skye bo ma lus pa rnams kyi yang gnas skabs thams cad ba spu'i khung bu re rer ci car ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams dang / skye bo ma lus pa rnams kyi yang gnas skabs thams cad ba spu'i khung bu re rer ci car ston par mdzad do //
translated: He also displays the entire life of all the Bodhisattvas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Sravakas of the three times, as well as of all living beings.

original: nam mkha'i mtha' klas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyang bzhed na rdul phra rab gcig gi nang du ste /🔽'jig rten phra rab gyur pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtha' klas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyang bzhed na rdul phra rab gcig gi nang du ste / 'jig rten phra rab gyur pa yang ma yin la /
translated: And if he wishes, he can display in a single atom the worlds of the ten directions, as limitless as space.

original: rdul phra rab che bar yang ma yin no /
analyzed: rdul phra rab che bar yang ma yin no /
translated: The worlds are not diminished, and the atom is not enlarged.

original: rdul phra rab gcig gis kyang mtha' med pa'i yul la khyab pa dang 'jig rten ma lus pa brten pa ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig gis kyang mtha' med pa'i yul la khyab pa dang 'jig rten ma lus pa brten pa ston par mdzad do //
translated: And a single atom pervades the infinite objective realm and displays the entire world.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa rnams na ji snyed pa'i rdul phra rab de snyed las lhag pa'i spyod pa rnam par bkra ba rnams skad cig gcig la rnam par rtog pa med par 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa rnams na ji snyed pa'i rdul phra rab de snyed las lhag pa'i spyod pa rnam par bkra ba rnams skad cig gcig la rnam par rtog pa med par 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du ston par mdzad do //
translated: In every world system, for as long as saṃsāra lasts, they display, in a single instant, without any conceptual thought, as many colorful deeds as there are atoms in all the world systems, and even more than that.

original: de ltar 'gro ba'i dbang phyug sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan phul du byung ba rnam pa de lta bu'i mig 'phrul gyi ngo bo las ma 'das pa'i rang bzhin mngon sum pa yang dag
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba'i dbang phyug sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan phul du byung ba rnam pa de lta bu'i mig 'phrul gyi ngo bo las ma 'das pa'i rang bzhin mngon sum pa yang dag
translated: Thus, the Blessed Buddhas, the Lords of the world, and the Bodhisattvas, are able to display, in actuality, such uncommon, excellent qualities, which are not beyond the nature of a magical illusion.

original: par ston par nus pa'o zhes mkhas pa rnams kyis mos par bya'o //
analyzed: par ston par nus pa'o zhes mkhas pa rnams kyis mos par bya'o //
translated: The wise should have conviction in this.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das khams gsum @290a * //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das khams gsum @290a * //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, who is beyond the three worlds,

original: las 'das pa yang /
analyzed: las 'das pa yang /
translated: is also

original: sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis 'jig rten rjes su gzhug pas yum dang yab dang sras la sogs pa'i 'brel pa yang dag par ston zhing khams gsum par bzhugs nas ji ltar rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa yang dag par 'jug pas rnam pa sna tshogs pa spyod🔽pa'i sems can gyi khams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis 'jig rten rjes su gzhug pas yum dang yab dang sras la sogs pa'i 'brel pa yang dag par ston zhing khams gsum par bzhugs nas ji ltar rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston pa yang dag par 'jug pas rnam pa sna tshogs pa spyod pa'i sems can gyi khams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la /
translated: They perfectly engage in teaching the Dharma in accordance with the dispositions of beings while dwelling in the three realms.

original: grags pa dang lan du phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa 'dod pas ma yin par thugs rjes 'gro ba rab tu zhi ba la sogs pa'i phrin las rnams kyis rab tu 'god par mdzad do //
analyzed: grags pa dang lan du phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa 'dod pas ma yin par thugs rjes 'gro ba rab tu zhi ba la sogs pa'i phrin las rnams kyis rab tu 'god par mdzad do //
translated: Thus, they establish beings of various dispositions in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, not out of desire for fame, reciprocation, or reward, but through their compassionate deeds of fully pacifying beings and so forth.

original: de ltar ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni /
translated: Thus, it says:

original: 'gro rnam zhi ba'i las dang ni //
analyzed: 'gro rnam zhi ba'i las dang ni //
translated: The deeds of fully pacifying beings🔽and so forth,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ji srid du /🔽chos kyi sku yi phrin las 'di //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ji srid du / chos kyi sku yi phrin las 'di //
translated: up to:🔽These are asserted to be the twenty-seven

original: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod //
translated: aspects of the activity of the dharmakāya.

original: ces pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan no //
analyzed: ces pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan no //
translated: This is the Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: phrin las de rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das sku de rnams su sprul pa ste /
analyzed: phrin las de rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das sku de rnams su sprul pa ste /
translated: Those deeds are as follows:🔽By extinguishing the hell beings' hell fires, teaching them the Dharma, and similarly giving them his own flesh, blood and so on, he benefits animals.

original: gang dmyal ba pa rnams kyi dmyal ba'i me shi bar byas pas dang / chos ston pas dang / de bzhin du byol song rnams la yang rang gi sha dang khrag la sogs pa ster bas dang / de bzhin du yi dags rnams la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa byin pa dang /🔽chos ston pas kyang sems mngon par dang bar byas nas /
analyzed: gang dmyal ba pa rnams kyi dmyal ba'i me shi bar byas pas dang / chos ston pas dang / de bzhin du byol song rnams la yang rang gi sha dang khrag la sogs pa ster bas dang / de bzhin du yi dags rnams la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa byin pa dang / chos ston pas kyang sems mngon par dang bar byas nas /
translated: By giving hungry ghosts food, drink and so on and teaching them the Dharma, he benefits them.🔽By teaching the Dharma, he benefits gods and humans.🔽By teaching the Dharma, he benefits gods who are content with the lower vehicle and causes them to be born in the higher realms.

original: mngon par dang bas de bas kyang rang gi 'gro ba rnams nas shi 'phos nas lha dang mi rnams su skye bar byed pa dang / lha theg pa dman pa la mo sa pa rnams kyang chos bstan pas mngon par dang bar byas nas dmigs su skye ba nas ji srid du nyan thos kyi byang chub la 'god do zhes pa la sogs pa rnams mdo ji lta bar ;
analyzed: mngon par dang bas de bas kyang rang gi 'gro ba rnams nas shi 'phos nas lha dang mi rnams su skye bar byed pa dang / lha theg pa dman pa la mo sa pa rnams kyang chos bstan pas mngon par dang bar byas nas dmigs su skye ba nas ji srid du nyan thos kyi byang chub la 'god do zhes pa la sogs pa rnams mdo ji lta bar ;
translated: He establishes them in the enlightenment of the sravakas and so on.

original: bdag gis gong du gnas skabs ji ltar brjod zin to //
analyzed: bdag gis gong du gnas skabs ji ltar brjod zin to //
translated: I have already explained the occasion above.🔽Moreover, the Blessed One teaches the Dharma to disciples in order to generate that and that thought, just as he himself generated the thoughts of the first ground and so on.

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das 'di ji ltar rang nyid thugs dang po la sogs pa rnams bskyed pa de bzhin du sems de dang de bskyed pa'i ched du gdul bya rnams la chos ston par mdzad do zhes mdor bsdus nas 'di'i phrin las bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das 'di ji ltar rang nyid thugs dang po la sogs pa rnams bskyed pa de bzhin du sems de dang de bskyed pa'i ched du gdul bya rnams la chos ston par mdzad do zhes mdor bsdus nas 'di'i phrin las bstan pa'o //
translated: In brief, this is the teaching of his activity.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan ji skad brjod pa 'di rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du 'do la rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan ji skad brjod pa 'di rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du 'do la rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And these qualities of the Blessed One, as they have been described, are completely purified in every way on the buddha ground.

original: gang rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are completely perfected in every way.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab @290b pa'i ye shes kyi yul can de las gzhan pa'i yon tan mtha' dag ldan pa'i bde bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku las tha dad pa med par 'jug pa nam mkha' gcig pu dpe dang dper bya ba'i yon tan re rer yon tan
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab @290b pa'i ye shes kyi yul can de las gzhan pa'i yon tan mtha' dag ldan pa'i bde bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku las tha dad pa med par 'jug pa nam mkha' gcig pu dpe dang dper bya ba'i yon tan re rer yon tan
translated: The qualities of the dharmakāya are inseparable from the Tathāgata.🔽

original: ma lus pa rgyas pa rnams ni /
analyzed: ma lus pa rgyas pa rnams ni /
translated: The dharmakāya of the tathāgatas, which is endowed with all qualities other than the inconceivable object of wisdom, is indivisible from the single space that pervades all qualities without exception in each example and exemplified quality.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na gnas pa'i 'gro ba ma mgon med pa /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na gnas pa'i 'gro ba ma mgon med pa /
translated: The protector of all beings who dwell in all worlds in the ten directions,

original: rnam pa thams cad kyis snod ji lta ba bzhin du rgyun chad pa med par nam mkha' 'jug pa ji srid par mgon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyis snod ji lta ba bzhin du rgyun chad pa med par nam mkha' 'jug pa ji srid par mgon du 'gyur ro //
translated: is a protector in every way, like a vessel, without interruption, for as long as space remains.

original: ci sangs rgyas thams cad rnam pa thams cad mnyam par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci sangs rgyas thams cad rnam pa thams cad mnyam par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Do all buddhas become equal in every respect?

original: rgyu gsum rnams kyis mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu gsum rnams kyis mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: They are equal in three ways.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par 'grub pa dang / chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku dag gis 'jig rten gyi don spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par 'grub pa dang / chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku dag gis 'jig rten gyi don spyod pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the accumulations of merit and knowledge of all the Buddhas, the perfection of the Dharma Body, and the service to the world through the Enjoyment and Transformation Bodies.

original: sku tshe dang rigs dang tshad kyis byas pa'i tha dad par ni 'gyur te /
analyzed: sku tshe dang rigs dang tshad kyis byas pa'i tha dad par ni 'gyur te /
translated: There is a difference in life, family, and size.

original: shin tu ring ba dang thung bar 'tsho ba'i phyir dang bram ze dang rgyal rigs su rigs tha dad pa'i phyir dang / 'od srungs dang goo ta ma la sogs pa rus tha dad pa'i phyir dang / chung ba dang che ba'i bong tshod tha dad pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: shin tu ring ba dang thung bar 'tsho ba'i phyir dang bram ze dang rgyal rigs su rigs tha dad pa'i phyir dang / 'od srungs dang goo ta ma la sogs pa rus tha dad pa'i phyir dang / chung ba dang che ba'i bong tshod tha dad pa'i phyir te ;
translated: Because they live for a very long or short time, because of the difference in family, Brahmin or Kshatriya, because of the difference in clan, Kasyapa or Gautama, and because of the difference in size, small or large.

original: dus ji lta ba'o //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba'o //
translated: As for time,

original: phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum po 'di nyid yid la byed pa'i mkhas pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi drung du shin tu dga' ba dang gus pa bskyed par bya nus te /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum po 'di nyid yid la byed pa'i mkhas pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi drung du shin tu dga' ba dang gus pa bskyed par bya nus te /
translated: The wise who keep in mind these three perfections of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are able to generate great joy and respect for them.

original: 'di lta ste rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang phan pa byed pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang phan pa byed pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: They are the perfection of cause, the perfection of effect, and the perfection of benefit.

original: de la rgyu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of cause is fourfold:

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad la goms par byed pa dang / dus ring por goms par byed pa dang / rgyun du goms par byed pa dang / bkur stir byas te goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad la goms par byed pa dang / dus ring por goms par byed pa dang / rgyun du goms par byed pa dang / bkur stir byas te goms par byed pa'o //
translated: cultivation of all the stores of merit and knowledge, cultivation over a long time, continuous cultivation, and cultivation with reverence.

original: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of effect is fourfold:

original: ye shes dang / spangs pa dang / mthu dang / gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang / spangs pa dang / mthu dang / gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of knowledge, the perfection of abandonment, the perfection of might, and the perfection of the body of form.

original: phan par byed pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: phan par byed pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of benefit is fourfold:

original: ngan song gsum dang / 'khor ba'i sdug @291a * //
analyzed: ngan song gsum dang / 'khor ba'i sdug @291a * //
translated: the perfection of the certain deliverance from the three miserable states of existence and from the sufferings of cyclic existence;

original: bsngal las shin tu nges par 'grol pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / theg pa gsum dang bde 'gro la 'god pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsngal las shin tu nges par 'grol pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / theg pa gsum dang bde 'gro la 'god pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: and the perfection of the establishment in the three vehicles and in happy destinies.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of knowledge is fourfold:

original: nye bar ma bstan par mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du mkhyen pa dang / 'bad pa med par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar ma bstan par mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du mkhyen pa dang / 'bad pa med par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: knowledge without teaching; knowledge of all things; knowledge of all aspects; and effortless knowledge.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of abandonment is fourfold:

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / shin tu spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / shin tu spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: abandonment of all addictions; complete abandonment; abandonment together with the instincts; and abandonment of the obscurations to the attainments of all the meditative concentrations.

original: mthu phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mthu phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of power is fourfold:

original: phyi rol gyi yul rnam sa sprul zhing yongs su bsgyur ba dang byin gyis rlob pa la dbang ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / sku tshe gtong ba dang byin gyis rlob pa la dbang ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsgribs pa dang nam mkhar dang ring ba la myur bar gshegs pa dang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul rnam sa sprul zhing yongs su bsgyur ba dang byin gyis rlob pa la dbang ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / sku tshe gtong ba dang byin gyis rlob pa la dbang ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsgribs pa dang nam mkhar dang ring ba la myur bar gshegs pa dang /
translated: vast places.🔽The perfection of the mastery of entering many minute objects.🔽The perfection of the natural, various, wondrous qualities such as the

original: phra ba mang por 'jug pa la dbang ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / sku'i 'od kyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gnyug ma'i ngo mtshar ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba mang por 'jug pa la dbang ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / sku'i 'od kyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gnyug ma'i ngo mtshar ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: light of the body illuminating infinite world systems.

original: gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of the form body is also fourfold.

original: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa dang / dpe byad phun sum tshogs pa dang / stobs phun sum tshogs pa dang / rdo rje'i snying po'i rus pa'i lus phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa dang / dpe byad phun sum tshogs pa dang / stobs phun sum tshogs pa dang / rdo rje'i snying po'i rus pa'i lus phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfect major marks, the perfect minor marks, the perfect powers, and the perfect body of bones with a vajra-like core.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i yang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor tha dad pa dang zhing tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i yang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor tha dad pa dang zhing tha dad pa ste /
translated: The retinue circle of the enjoyment body is different, and the realm is different.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku 'ga' zhig gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni shel gyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku 'ga' zhig gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni shel gyi rang bzhin /
translated: The realm of some enjoyment bodies is the nature of crystal.

original: 'ga' zhig gi ni bee d'urya'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi ni bee d'urya'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Some are the nature of beryl.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is like that and so forth.

original: ming tha dad pa ni 'od dpag med dang / rnam par snang mdzad ces pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ming tha dad pa ni 'od dpag med dang / rnam par snang mdzad ces pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The different names are Amitābha, Vairocana, and so forth.

original: sku tha dad pa ni 'ga' zhig gis rnam pa 'ga' zhig tu mthong ba ste /
analyzed: sku tha dad pa ni 'ga' zhig gis rnam pa 'ga' zhig tu mthong ba ste /
translated: The different bodies are seen in some way by some.

original: shel gyi rang bzhin la sogs pa tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: shel gyi rang bzhin la sogs pa tha dad pa'am /
translated: It is like the different natures of crystal and so forth,

original: sku chung ba dang sku che ba tha dad pas so //
analyzed: sku chung ba dang sku che ba tha dad pas so //
translated: or the different small and large bodies.

original: chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa tha dad pa ni sa bcu pa dang blo @291b gros mi zad pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs la sogs pa chos kyi rnam grangs tha dad pas so //
analyzed: chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa tha dad pa ni sa bcu pa dang blo @291b gros mi zad pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs la sogs pa chos kyi rnam grangs tha dad pas so //
translated: The enjoyment of the Dharma is distinct because of the distinct Dharma teachings, such as the Ten Stages, the Dharma teaching of Akṣayamati, and so on.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor tha dad pa ni der 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor tha dad pa ni der 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ltos pa ste /
translated: The circle of retinue is distinct because it depends on the bodhisattvas assembled there.

original: bskor ba tha dad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: bskor ba tha dad pa yang ngo //
translated: The distinct turning of the wheel is also that.

original: ji ltar sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis po 'di rnams 'khor dang bcas pa 'dir nges par bstan pa de ltar kho nar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis po 'di rnams 'khor dang bcas pa 'dir nges par bstan pa de ltar kho nar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Just as these twenty-two types of generation of the resolve are definitely taught here with their retinue, just so should they be understood.

original: gnas gang de rnams bsams na byis pa nus pa zad pa las skyo zhing smyo la brgyal ba dang 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i gnas de rnams ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams te /
analyzed: gnas gang de rnams bsams na byis pa nus pa zad pa las skyo zhing smyo la brgyal ba dang 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i gnas de rnams ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams te /
translated: Those places that are inconceivable, where the exhaustion of the power of the childish leads to weariness, madness, fainting, and death, are inconceivable.

original: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not the domain of sophistry.

original: de rnams kyang ji ltar bcom ldan 'das rnal 'byor can gyi dbang phyug gi gtso bos gzigs shing bstan pa de kho na ltar bdag gis 'dir gdams ngag ji lta bar nges par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang ji ltar bcom ldan 'das rnal 'byor can gyi dbang phyug gi gtso bos gzigs shing bstan pa de kho na ltar bdag gis 'dir gdams ngag ji lta bar nges par bshad pa'o //
translated: The Lord, the master of yoga, has seen and taught these qualities, and I have explained them here in accordance with the instructions.

original: de ltar 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi bdag nyid chen po nyid mdor bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi bdag nyid chen po nyid mdor bsdus pa ste /
translated: This is a brief presentation of the greatness of the buddhas.

original: phye bar bya na ni dbye ba mtha' yas par 'gyur ro //🔽sangs rgyas rnams kho nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ba spu'i khung bu re rer dang dpe byad dang skyes bu'i mtshan dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par de rnams kyang yongs su gcod par nus la /
analyzed: phye bar bya na ni dbye ba mtha' yas par 'gyur ro // sangs rgyas rnams kho nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ba spu'i khung bu re rer dang dpe byad dang skyes bu'i mtshan dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par de rnams kyang yongs su gcod par nus la /
translated: If it were to be analyzed, it would be infinite.

original: mngon par brjod par yang nus mod /
analyzed: mngon par brjod par yang nus mod /
translated: Only the buddhas can fully comprehend and express the distinctive qualities of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, such as the pores of their bodies, their major and minor marks, their powers, their fearlessnesses, their distinctive qualities of buddhahood, and so on.

original: ye shes kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bskal pa grangs med par sku tshe'i tshad byin gyis brlabs par gyur cing /
analyzed: ye shes kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bskal pa grangs med par sku tshe'i tshad byin gyis brlabs par gyur cing /
translated: The lifespan of the wisdom body is blessed to be inconceivable eons.

original: myur zhing myur bar las gzhan med par gyur nas gal te brjod par gyur pa de lta na yang yon tan yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba nyid na /
analyzed: myur zhing myur bar las gzhan med par gyur nas gal te brjod par gyur pa de lta na yang yon tan yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba nyid na /
translated: The lifespan of the Buddha is blessed to be inconceivable eons of wisdom, but even if he were to speak quickly and only about that, he would not be able to complete the description of the qualities of a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lta ci smos la rang sangs rgyas sam nyan thos rnams kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi mtha' shes pa'am brjod par mi nus par sngar kho na'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lta ci smos la rang sangs rgyas sam nyan thos rnams kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi mtha' shes pa'am brjod par mi nus par sngar kho na'o //
translated: What need is there to mention that bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and śrāvakas are unable to know or describe the extent of the qualities of a buddha?

original: gshog pa'i rgya shin tu yangs pa'i rlung gi shugs rlob cing pha rol gnon pa'i nam mkha' lding yang /
analyzed: gshog pa'i rgya shin tu yangs pa'i rlung gi shugs rlob cing pha rol gnon pa'i nam mkha' lding yang /
translated: A garuḍa, with its vast wings and powerful speed, soars in the sky.

original: nam mkha' yongs su zad do snyam nas nam mkha' las 'bab pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nam mkha' yongs su zad do snyam nas nam mkha' las 'bab pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It does not descend from the sky thinking, “The sky is exhausted.”

original: 'on kyang rang gi stobs dang pha rol gnon pa nyams pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi stobs dang pha rol gnon pa nyams pas so //
translated: Rather, it descends because its own strength and power are exhausted.

original: de bzhin du gang sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam @292a * //🔽par thob pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam @292a * // par thob pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the bodhisattvas who abide on the ten levels have attained inconceivable qualities.

original: de rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan de snyed mngon par brjod pa nus pa las /
analyzed: de rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan de snyed mngon par brjod pa nus pa las /
translated: They are not able to fully express the qualities of the tathagatas.

original: yon tan yongs su zad pas nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' med pa'i yon tan rnams las ldog pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yon tan yongs su zad pas nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' med pa'i yon tan rnams las ldog pa ma yin gyi /
translated: They do not turn away from the limitless qualities that are like space due to the exhaustion of those qualities.

original: rang gi blo'i stobs yongs su nyams pas ni log nas gnas na /🔽rang sangs rgyas rnams dang nyan thos rnams kyis yon tan gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: rang gi blo'i stobs yongs su nyams pas ni log nas gnas na / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang nyan thos rnams kyis yon tan gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
translated: But if they turn away due to the weakness of their own mental power,🔽what need is there to mention that the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas and sravakas will be understood?

original: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas kyi yon tan yongs su shes pa'am mngon par brjod pa la 'di lta bu'i gtam 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas kyi yon tan yongs su shes pa'am mngon par brjod pa la 'di lta bu'i gtam 'di lta ste /
translated: When the qualities of the buddhas are fully understood or expressed, this is the kind of discourse that occurs.

original: de'i phyir bdag lta bu'i ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis long ba ji lta ba bzhin gyi de kho na nyid shin tu lkog tu gyur pa can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan brjod pa'i skabs ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag lta bu'i ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis long ba ji lta ba bzhin gyi de kho na nyid shin tu lkog tu gyur pa can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan brjod pa'i skabs ga la yod /
translated: Therefore, how can there be any occasion for me to speak of the qualities of the Tathagata, since the reality of things is extremely hidden and I am like one blind from birth, obscured by the cataracts of ignorance?

original: gal te yang de lta ste /🔽de lta na yang 'phags pa klu sgrub dang / 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde la sogs pa la brten ba las /
analyzed: gal te yang de lta ste / de lta na yang 'phags pa klu sgrub dang / 'phags pa rnam par grol ba'i sde la sogs pa la brten ba las /
translated: Even if that is so,

original: the tshom med par bdag gis yon tan phyogs gcig gi cha tsam brjod do //
analyzed: the tshom med par bdag gis yon tan phyogs gcig gi cha tsam brjod do //
translated: I will speak without hesitation of just a fraction of one quality of the Tathagata, relying on the noble Nagarjuna and the noble Muktaketu and others.

original: de ltar yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mtha' yas shing rmad du byung ba'i yon tan rin po che chen po'i 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mtha' yas shing rmad du byung ba'i yon tan rin po che chen po'i 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: Thus, the Tathagatas are the source of the great jewels of infinite and marvelous qualities.

original: 'on kyang slar yang byis pa rang yon tan gyis bkren pas mos pa dang bral ba rnams yon tan phun sum tshogs pa de 'dra ba thos kyang sangs rgyas de'i chos la gus par mi byed la /
analyzed: 'on kyang slar yang byis pa rang yon tan gyis bkren pas mos pa dang bral ba rnams yon tan phun sum tshogs pa de 'dra ba thos kyang sangs rgyas de'i chos la gus par mi byed la /
translated: However, childish beings, bereft of faith due to their poverty of good qualities, do not respect the Dharma of the Buddha even when they hear of such perfect qualities.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni rkang gi khong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das de dang de'i chos la'ang mngon par rab tu dang bar byed do //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni rkang gi khong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das de dang de'i chos la'ang mngon par rab tu dang bar byed do //
translated: The wise, even from the marrow of their bones, have clear faith in the Lord and his Dharma.

original: de rnams de la dad pa tsam gyis kyar mngon par bsgrub pa rnams /
analyzed: de rnams de la dad pa tsam gyis kyar mngon par bsgrub pa rnams /
translated: By that mere faith in them, the accumulations

original: rnam par smin pa ma nges pa'i sdig pa rnams kyi phung po rnams zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma nges pa'i sdig pa rnams kyi phung po rnams zil gyis mnan te /
translated: of the mass of sins of uncertain retribution are overcome.

original: lha dang mi'i dpal nyams su myong zhing /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i dpal nyams su myong zhing /
translated: They experience the glory of gods and humans,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub bla na med pa mchog tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub bla na med pa mchog tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: and they go to the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: thub pa'i dgongs pa'i rgyan las yon tan gyi snang pa'i le 'u ste yongs su bcad ba bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: thub pa'i dgongs pa'i rgyan las yon tan gyi snang pa'i le 'u ste yongs su bcad ba bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourth chapter, on the appearance of good qualities, from the Ornament of the Sage’s Thought, an explanatory treatise on the perfection of wisdom.

original: // / zhes pa thub dgongs dpag bsam ljon shing rtog pa'i rlung gis ni //
analyzed: // / zhes pa thub dgongs dpag bsam ljon shing rtog pa'i rlung gis ni //
translated: The wish-fulfilling tree of the Sage’s thought, shaken by the wind of imagination,

original: g-yos shing lta ngan chu yis rgyun du rab zhir mthar zhugs pa //
analyzed: g-yos shing lta ngan chu yis rgyun du rab zhir mthar zhugs pa //
translated: finally enters the stream of the water of bad views,

original: mi mthun phyogs rnams nye bar gyur las 'bras bu bzang rnams bsdus //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs rnams nye bar gyur las 'bras bu bzang rnams bsdus //
translated: and the good fruits are gathered from the approach of the adverse conditions.

original: kye snying slar yang skye ba dag pa 'byung ba ga la zhig / snang ba 'di las phan dang @292b mi phan pa yang rnam bltas nas //
analyzed: kye snying slar yang skye ba dag pa 'byung ba ga la zhig / snang ba 'di las phan dang @292b mi phan pa yang rnam bltas nas //
translated: Having seen that in this appearance there is benefit and harm,

original: gang las mtho bas yon tan rang bzhin theg pa 'di zhon te //
analyzed: gang las mtho bas yon tan rang bzhin theg pa 'di zhon te //
translated: having mounted this vehicle whose nature is the higher qualities,

original: bdag nang stobs ldan dgra bo'i rigs kyi rtsa ba myur chod la //
analyzed: bdag nang stobs ldan dgra bo'i rigs kyi rtsa ba myur chod la //
translated: quickly cut the root of the type of inner powerful enemy.

original: srid gsum rnam rgyal phun tshogs byang chub gnas kyis phun tshogs byon //
analyzed: srid gsum rnam rgyal phun tshogs byang chub gnas kyis phun tshogs byon //
translated: Having attained the state of perfect enlightenment, which is the perfection of the victory over the three worlds,

original: tshul gsum rnams la bden pa zung gi srog / mdor bsdus bdag gis 'di ru nye bar bkod //
analyzed: tshul gsum rnams la bden pa zung gi srog / mdor bsdus bdag gis 'di ru nye bar bkod //
translated: I have here set forth in brief the life of the two truths in the three ways.

original: gal te nyes par zin na de bzod mdzod //
analyzed: gal te nyes par zin na de bzod mdzod //
translated: If it is grasped as a fault, please forgive it.

original: bden pa gnyis la sa brnyes tshad ma yin //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la sa brnyes tshad ma yin //
translated: The one who has attained the stages of the two truths is the valid cognizer.

original: gzhung lugs smad med bshad pa'i legs byas 'dod bya zla ba ni //
analyzed: gzhung lugs smad med bshad pa'i legs byas 'dod bya zla ba ni //
translated: The moon, which is the good action of explaining the faultless scriptural tradition,🔽may it satisfy beings, destroying the darkness of sleep.

original: rab rib 'joms byed gnyid bral de yis skye bo tshim byed shog bdag kyang so so'i sku 'dzin bsam mi khyab sku phun tshogs kyis //
analyzed: rab rib 'joms byed gnyid bral de yis skye bo tshim byed shog bdag kyang so so'i sku 'dzin bsam mi khyab sku phun tshogs kyis //
translated: May I also attain the inconceivable perfect body of each of the individual bodies of the buddhas.

original: rtsod pa dang bral bskal par rol pa'i ched du 'du bar shog / yon tan dam pa bsgrigs pa'i rgyan //
analyzed: rtsod pa dang bral bskal par rol pa'i ched du 'du bar shog / yon tan dam pa bsgrigs pa'i rgyan //
translated: The ornament of the arrangement of holy qualities,

original: brten pa 'od 'bar dri med pa //
analyzed: brten pa 'od 'bar dri med pa //
translated: the support, radiant, stainless,

original: snang ba 'di ni skyo bo yi //
analyzed: snang ba 'di ni skyo bo yi //
translated: this light,

original: mgrin pa rnams la gdags par mdzod//
analyzed: mgrin pa rnams la gdags par mdzod//
translated: should be worn around the necks of the poor.

original: snang ba dang bcas rgyan 'di ltar //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas rgyan 'di ltar //
translated: This ornament with light

original: sems can sems la sdong bu bzhin //
analyzed: sems can sems la sdong bu bzhin //

original: thub pa nang 'od 'jug ched du //
analyzed: thub pa nang 'od 'jug ched du //
translated: In order to enter the inner light of the Sage,🔽may it remain as long as space exists.

analyzed: nam mkha' ji srid gnas par shog / thub pa dgongs pa'i rgyan slob dpon mkhas pa chen po 'jigs med 'byung gnas sbas pa'i zhabs kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so / // / rnam gnon tshul mkhas 'ji gas med kyi //
translated: The Ornament of the Sage's Intention composed by the great master Āchārya Ārya-Vimuktisena is complete.

original: gnas la reg pa'i tshul 'di ni //
analyzed: gnas la reg pa'i tshul 'di ni //
translated: This method of touching the abode

original: dpal ldan dga' skyong rgyal srid kyi //
analyzed: dpal ldan dga' skyong rgyal srid kyi //
translated: of the skilled one who is fearless

original: sum cu'i lo la byas pa yin //🔽phyed dang bcas pa'i stong phrag lnga //
analyzed: sum cu'i lo la byas pa yin // phyed dang bcas pa'i stong phrag lnga //
translated: was composed in the thirty-year reign🔽of the glorious Nāgadeva.🔽The measure of the summary by the wise

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis sdom pa'i tshad //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis sdom pa'i tshad //
translated: is five thousand with half.

original: bsngags 'os brgyan pa'i ched du 'di'i ;
analyzed: bsngags 'os brgyan pa'i ched du 'di'i ;
translated: For the sake of adorning the praiseworthy,

original: / tshad bzhin snying la dngos po rnams //
analyzed: / tshad bzhin snying la dngos po rnams //
translated: the measure of these things should be in the heart.

original: zhes pa'o // bde gshegs bstan pa bsam 'phel nor bu skye bo kun gyi rang gi mi shes mun pas bsgribs nas don med 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // bde gshegs bstan pa bsam 'phel nor bu skye bo kun gyi rang gi mi shes mun pas bsgribs nas don med 'gyur //
translated: The Sugata's teachings are a wish-fulfilling jewel, but people, obscured by the darkness of their own ignorance, do not benefit from it.

original: de rtogs don du shes rab sgron ma 'degs par byed pa'i dbang gyur shing rta chen po rnams kyang nub gyur te //
analyzed: de rtogs don du shes rab sgron ma 'degs par byed pa'i dbang gyur shing rta chen po rnams kyang nub gyur te //
translated: In order to understand it, the great charioteers raised the lamp of wisdom, but it has set.

original: 'gro ba kun la shin tu don med lta bur mi 'jigs seng ge'i thugs rje'i spyan gyis rab gzigs nas //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun la shin tu don med lta bur mi 'jigs seng ge'i thugs rje'i spyan gyis rab gzigs nas //
translated: Seeing that all beings are as if utterly without purpose, with the compassionate eye of a fearless lion,

original: yon tan rang bzhin thub chen dgongs pa'i sgron ma 'di ni mi shes mun pa bsal phyir mdzad //
analyzed: yon tan rang bzhin thub chen dgongs pa'i sgron ma 'di ni mi shes mun pa bsal phyir mdzad //
translated: the Sage, whose nature is good qualities, has composed this lamp of the intention, in order to dispel the darkness of ignorance.

original: de lta na yang 'phags pa'i skad kyis dben pa'i skye bo dag la don med lta bur kho bos rab rtogs nas //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'phags pa'i skad kyis dben pa'i skye bo dag la don med lta bur kho bos rab rtogs nas //
translated: Even so, I have understood that for people who are isolated by the noble language, it is as if it has no purpose.

original: de dag @293a * //
analyzed: de dag @293a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: kun gyis yid kyi mun pa shin tu stug po rnam par bsal phyir bdag gis legs par 'di bsgyur nas //
analyzed: kun gyis yid kyi mun pa shin tu stug po rnam par bsal phyir bdag gis legs par 'di bsgyur nas //
translated: In order to completely dispel the very thick darkness of the mind of all, I have translated this well.

original: byung ba'i bsod nams chu 'dzin 'od zer lta bur shin tu gsal zhing dga' ba skyed pa gang yin des //
analyzed: byung ba'i bsod nams chu 'dzin 'od zer lta bur shin tu gsal zhing dga' ba skyed pa gang yin des //
translated: May the rain-cloud-like radiance of the very clear and delightful merit that arises from this

original: 'di ru skye bo kun gyi yid kyi mun pa shin tu stug po rnam par bsal nas zab mo'i lam rtogs shog //
analyzed: 'di ru skye bo kun gyi yid kyi mun pa shin tu stug po rnam par bsal nas zab mo'i lam rtogs shog //
translated: completely dispel the very thick darkness of the mind of all beings here and may they realize the profound path.

original: / mkhas pa rnams kyi gtsug gi nor bu bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' rab 'byams la shes pa'i snang ba skyes pa'i mkhas pa chen po de nyid las mnyan nas /
analyzed: / mkhas pa rnams kyi gtsug gi nor bu bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' rab 'byams la shes pa'i snang ba skyes pa'i mkhas pa chen po de nyid las mnyan nas /
translated: Having listened to the great scholar who has given rise to the light of knowledge of the infinite words of the Sugata, the crown jewel of the wise,

original: de nyid kyi zhal sngar sh'a kya'i dge slong dpang zho gsal ba grags zhes bya bas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi zhal sngar sh'a kya'i dge slong dpang zho gsal ba grags zhes bya bas /
translated: the Śākya bhikṣu Pangjawa Trashi Drak

original: yul dbus kyi grong khyer chen po mkhas pa'i 'byung gnas dpal n'a lendrar bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: yul dbus kyi grong khyer chen po mkhas pa'i 'byung gnas dpal n'a lendrar bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
translated: translated, revised, and finalized this text in the presence of that very master in the great city of the land of Magadha, the glorious Nālandā, the source of scholars.

original: // / dus phyis lung dang rigs pa'i dbang phyug stag sde pa chen po seng ge rgyal mtshan gyi bka' drin dang / de nyid kyi sras kyi thu bo bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i blo gros kyi stobs kyis mtha' yas pa'i shes bya'i chos la dbang bsgyur ba shong ston lo ts'a ba rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyis legs par bshad pa'i srol la sogs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: // / dus phyis lung dang rigs pa'i dbang phyug stag sde pa chen po seng ge rgyal mtshan gyi bka' drin dang / de nyid kyi sras kyi thu bo bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i blo gros kyi stobs kyis mtha' yas pa'i shes bya'i chos la dbang bsgyur ba shong ston lo ts'a ba rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyis legs par bshad pa'i srol la sogs pa la brten nas /
translated: Later, through the kindness of the great lord of scriptures and reasoning, the great Sa-gya-pa Seng-ge Gyal-tshan, and through the power of the inconceivable intelligence of his chief spiritual son, the translator from Sho-tong, Dor-je Gyal-tshan, who had mastered the infinite phenomena of knowledge,

original: phyi dang nang gi gzhung lugs du ma rnams la blo'i snang ba cher rgyas pa /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi gzhung lugs du ma rnams la blo'i snang ba cher rgyas pa /
translated: the light of my mind greatly expanded with regard to the many scriptural traditions, both Buddhist and non-Buddhist.

original: zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dpang dge slong dpal ldan blo gros brtan pas /
analyzed: zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dpang dge slong dpal ldan blo gros brtan pas /
translated: The great translator from Zhu-chen, the monk Pal-den Lodro Ta-na,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dog shing dbon po dang / bde ba chos kyi bzang po la sogs pas /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dog shing dbon po dang / bde ba chos kyi bzang po la sogs pas /
translated: with the help of the spiritual friend Dog-shing Won-po, De-wa Chok-gyi Zang-po, and others,

original: mthun rkyen bsgrubs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: mthun rkyen bsgrubs pa la brten nas /
translated: who provided the necessary conditions,

original: legs par bcos nas dag par bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: legs par bcos nas dag par bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
translated: revised it well, corrected it, and finalized it.

original: // / slar yang dpal ldan blo gros brtan pa de nyid kyis gzhung 'di'i skabs dang gzhung lugs gzhan gyi skabs mthun pa ji snyed rnyed pa rnams sbyar zhing rgya dpe dang gtugs te legs par brtags shing dpyad nas zhus chen bgyis la /
analyzed: // / slar yang dpal ldan blo gros brtan pa de nyid kyis gzhung 'di'i skabs dang gzhung lugs gzhan gyi skabs mthun pa ji snyed rnyed pa rnams sbyar zhing rgya dpe dang gtugs te legs par brtags shing dpyad nas zhus chen bgyis la /
translated: Again, the glorious Sthiramati himself has applied all the concordant passages from this text and other treatises that he has found, and has examined and analyzed them well in comparison with the Indian texts.

original: don la yang legs par dpyad pas shin tu dag par bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: don la yang legs par dpyad pas shin tu dag par bgyis pa'o //
translated: He has made a great revision, and has made it very pure by also examining the meaning well.

original: sgra don snang ba nyin byed 'od //
analyzed: sgra don snang ba nyin byed 'od //
translated: The appearance of the meaning of the words, the light of the sun,

original: brtson pas yang yang brten pa yis //
analyzed: brtson pas yang yang brten pa yis //
translated: By striving again and again,

original: gzhung mchog zab yangs 'dab brgya'i tshal //
analyzed: gzhung mchog zab yangs 'dab brgya'i tshal //
translated: The hundred-petaled grove of the profound and vast supreme treatise,

original: dgongs don ge sar rab gsal gyur //
analyzed: dgongs don ge sar rab gsal gyur //
translated: Has become the clearly visible stamen of the meaning of the intention.

original: 'gro ba mang po la phan gyur cig //
analyzed: 'gro ba mang po la phan gyur cig //
translated: May it be of benefit to many beings.
